Reviews.Title: “Faboso”
Reviews.Author: Lucanthelord Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: Brilliantly situated two minutes from La Rambla, tucked away in a quiet alley. Arrived very early morning but was able to check in our luggage so that we could explore the city. Likewise on the journey home. Friendly staff. Lovely breakfast. Superb night's sleep in huge bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pleasant, a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: altonaco
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located a few short blocks from Plaza d’Espana, and the Ramblas, It is a little off the main drag so it was quiet, which is handy if you’re trying to get over jet-lag or away from the throngs of people that are always out-and-about. It allows quick access to the hop on/off tourist buses, the Ramblas with its touristy restaurants and a food market, many small shops in the neighborhood, and the Gothic Quarter. The reception people were very nice to let us check in so early. The room was small but had all the necessities and we did not expect to spend much time there; the view was the opposing balcony. The lobby is smallish, international style, but a nice place to spend a minute. They also have drinks and some snacks for sale.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Jose_Manuel_36 Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: very good hotel.. only 1 block away from the metro station and Rambla. I will use this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndyKent500 Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - good room with good en suite - fantastic breakfast available with 20% discount if you book at check in. Staff all very helpful. Free WI-FI for 30 mins. Bus stop for airport transfer (also very good/efficient/cheap) just a 5min walk. La Rambla 2 min walk. All good.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Tomash10
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location, booked via its web site and asked for a quiet room. And we really got a quiet one: # 610 on the highest floor. The room is rather small, but it has quite a large balcony with beautiful view over the city (see pics) and a generous and nice bathroom. However – like in many other hotel rooms – there were no so practical hooks in the bathroom. The room and the hotel itself were clean and well maintained; we appreciated that there were no wall-to-wall carpets. The breakfast buffet presented a rich choice of drinks, fruits, bread, warm & cold food, etc. – but it was every morning exactly the same. The personnel were kind and helpful, although they did not agree to grant any discount when we paid the hotel bill in cash. The location is ideal – in a small and quiet street just between La Rambla and Portal l’Angel, the pedestrian shopping paradise, within walking distance from Plaça de Catalunya and the Cathedral. I do not mind to recommend this hotel and would return there with pleasure, although the price level is relatively high.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Zhamilya
Reviews.Content: I liked location, as it let you to be in the hear of the city. Breakfasts has very good variety of choice. Staff is helpful. Only lobby wi fi system with temporary log-in is not perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Gothic Location”
Reviews.Author: Ladybug2go Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice & clean with basic amenities. It provided everything I was looking for with a central location in the Gothic area. It was easy to get to all my tours and a quick walk to La Ramba and the sights I wanted to see. At first it takes a little effort in locating it since it is central and not on La Rambla but once you do there is no problem. There were only a couple of downsides to the hotel and that would be that the wi-fi can only be accessed from the lobby and the thermostat in the room seemed to be a little on the warm side.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!!”
Reviews.Author: Sara F
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect place to get around to everything in the city. We walked to all the major tourists spot without any problems. Clean, very nice staff, and would recommend to anyone. Breakfast is available, but we chose to eat on the run while we were out and about.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for major sights of Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: Deb T
Reviews.Content: The location is great; very asscesible to the major sights in Barcelona. We basically walked the whole area from Passig de Gracia to the beach and El Rival to Born. Staff is friendly and helpful. Our room was basic, clean, including safe and mini bar (very reasonably priced). We did not have the breakfast. There is a little market across the street that made purchasing water and snacks very convenient. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Samantha G Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and in a fantastic location. The hotel is very close to Las Ramblas but located on a quiet side street.Our flight back to England was on the same day as the general strikes in Spain and Matt on the reception was very helpful in checking that the flights and buses were running on time. The only downside was that there were a lot of people staying in the hotel who were up before 7am each day which woke us up most mornings. Apart from that the hotel was lovely. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Standard nh”
Reviews.Author: Esssi
Reviews.Content: Standard nh quality for staying. No surprises in good or a bad way. Room was nice and clean. Sleep quality: The bed was not great for two, some noises from the hotel kitchen and street was coming to our room. Could also hear a man snoring in some other rooms near by. However, sleeping was ok. Didn't go to the breakfast which was recommenned by our friend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location; right in the hub of Barcelona but on a quiet street. Rooms were a nice size, neat & clean. The front desk personnel were always courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice in BCN”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter1948
Reviews.Content: We were three couples 60+ and all of us enjoyed our stay. On a silent side street with good standard rooms for a reasonable price. Comfortable beds/pillows, efficient shower, safety box, minibar and air condition. That's all you need. Friendy and efficient staff. We had our breakfast outside for half a price enjoying the local ambience and gastronomy. BCN is a brilliant city, lots of interesting places to see and excellent restaurants to visit. Do not miss La Sagrada Familia, but make the booking of the tickets by internet or go there around 9 o'clock in the morning when they'll open. Otherwise there is a que of hunreds of meters and it takes a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: chrish61 Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern, conveniently located near La Rambla and Plaza Catalunya but tucked away on a more quiet street, this hotel was a great choice. The staff was so helpful and friendly to us. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: MissTN
Reviews.Content: It is located in an ideal location best for shopping and sight seeing. It is in the old town and is close to Placa Catalunya, the quay as well as some hot night spots by foot. The area is quite at night so one is assured of having a restful sleep. If travelling with luggage, it would be wise to take a taxi to the hotel as cars are not allowed around the pedestrian area. I loved the rooms, the bathroom was large enough and they provide most of the amenities you need. As for the restaurant they only provide breakfast. If you would like to have other meals you will have to order take out. The hotel is ideal for short stay in Barcelona and considering the location, there will be no need to spend your time in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “three star value and convenience”
Reviews.Author: Ulsterwoman
Reviews.Content: Really easy to get to this hotel - aeroport bus A2 cost 5.30 euro, 20 minute journey to Placa Catalunya and then 5 minute walk to a quiet sidestreet. Room small but clean and everything we needed. Blue skies were welcome! We didn't eat breakfast here but free wifi in lobby. Loved Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms quiet, but drab”
Reviews.Author: AriaProf
Reviews.Content: The NH Duc de la Victoria was adequate for our two night stay after our Mediterranean cruise. We wanted to be in the Gothic Quarter, and it was very well located and not loud. We had a room in the back, but due to rain and humidity the room felt small and stuffy and we couldn't open the window because it would rain in. The TV was ancient and the lighting was very low voltage. The bathroom was large and adequate for our needs. There's no luxury here, but the price is moderate and the staff is very friendly. I think this hotel needs refurbishing. Then it might be a real jewel in the Gothic Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & hotel”
Reviews.Author: UncleDom
Reviews.Content: Back to Barcelona for 2 nights in January and first time here at the NH Duc de la Victoria. Situation is ideal very, very central and minutes from the aerobus drop off point in Placa Catalunya. Had booked in advance on NH hotels website during flash sales at 55 euro a night so checkin was quick & efficient. Allocated room 329 on third floor overlooking the back of the hotel & Decathon store below. Room was a good size and plenty of storage space and fridge/minibar. I was handed an offers card on checkin which advertised the full minibar for 9.72 euro which is very good value if you wanted to empty it !!! There was also offers to upgrade room to superior for 16.20 euro or to a junior suite for 37.80 euro which seemed good value. Bed was lovely & big & long and very comfortable to sleep in. Blackout curtains were good & provided a good night's sleep. As rear facing there was absolutely no noise except from some kids in the morning going to breakfast from nearby rooms. There was 3 lifts to the 6 floors which seemed like a lot but we still had to wait for one on Sunday when checking out. Bathroom was up to the usual NH standard & pretty adequate, small amount of shampoo & shower gels which were replaced after use. Good sized tub & shower was fine too. Breakfast was not included in my rate but there are plenty of coffee shops & bars nearby for morning coffee & croissants both mornings ( less so on the Sunday) There is 30 minutes free wifi in the lobby but no free internet to print off boarding passes & reception did not seem to want to help only pointing to pay internet service which was 5 euro......did print off boarding passes at internet shop near Placa Reial for 25 cents... most hotels do now offer a free facility for this service nowadays, take note NH Hotels. Otherwise very pleased with the hotel & would recommend & stay again if got a good rate. It really is the perfect location & easy to find even if you are a first time visitor to Barcelona. All the shops/bars /restaurants are on your doorstep as is the Ramblas....

Reviews.Title: “It's a must....”
Reviews.Author: vixxy1969
Reviews.Content: First time to Barcelona, so wasn't sure what to expect.... but hotel was lovely, deserves a four star I reckon. Checking in was easy and straight forward, rooms was spotless. I love continental breakfast, so was really pleased with the hotels buffet that they put on. Mini bar was cheap, which was a surprise. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “very near to attraction, clean, quiet, ask for nothing more”
Reviews.Author: lileba
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time for me to visit Barcelona, but the first time to stay in this hotel. if you look for luxury and character, this isn't the place. But you will find a simple business hotel, clean and quiet, than bingo ! We didn't take breakfast on this hotel at that time. We came to stay in this hotel end of May 2011 for 2 nights (just have the time to write it down now). I came with my hubby and child (8yo). We got the room at extra bed, small balcony, and what we like is the hotel in the quiet alley, walking distance from the Areobus airport bus stop at Placa Catalunya and to Cathedral. The room was compact and didn't feel too cramp although we had extra bed. The bathroom has shower and bath tub, complete amenities (hair dryer, toiletries) We walked around the Barri Gothic, just not that far from the hotel. Lots of places to eat .. walk around 5-10 minutes to Picasso place, and still can walk until we reach La Musica de Palau and other market (not the one at the RA Lambra, forget the name already). Just 2-3 minutes walk to La Rambla and we can walk down to beach and also to the Maritime Museum. On our last day, we were rushing as we were looking for Caleum cafe around Barri Gothic. Got lost and we had only a little time to rush to Airport. Thank God that this hotel is nearby the Aerobus, .. so we could catch the airport bus on time. If we have another chance to visit BCN again, definitely will return to this hotel. Value for money, clean, quiet ...yup quietness which is something you will hard to find in Barcelona :-)

Reviews.Title: “Another Average NH hotel”
Reviews.Author: AltaPat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from December 29, 2011 to January 5, 2012. Due to a leaking shower, we changed rooms from the 6th floor to the lst floor after one night. The second room was small with poor lighting however the bed and pillows weren't bad - much better than the London NH Kensington we had just come from. As to the decor, attached are pictures which speak louder than words. The room was quiet and clean so no problem there but the ventilation was poor. After every shower, we had to open the window to let the steam out. The many amenities included a shower cap, soap, shampoo, conditioner, sponge and even a little pack containing a toothbrush and toothpaste. There were only a few English channels on the TV. The staff was polite and helpful. We didn't take the breakfast here but went out to some of the handy places close by. It is easy to take the Aerobus from Placa de Catalunya to the Airport, which is only about an easy 5 minute walk from the hotel and only cost 5.3 euros. The location of the hotel is great - close to every attraction in the Barri Gotic, including the Cathedral and La Rambla. We bought a 3 day pass for the Metro which is the best metro system of anywhere we have ever travelled. Usually we only had to wait 1 or 2 minutes for the next train. Using our pass, we were able to visit the Sagrada Familia, Parc Guell, Placa Espanya, Montjuic and the Monestir de Pedralbes. For seeing Casa Mila and Casa Batllo in the Eixample, just walk past the Placa de Catalunya and north up Passeig de Gracia, not far at all. Barcelona is a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Debs593
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel with lots of character this isn't it. However if you want a clean comfortable room in a good location this hotel ticks all the boxes. The hotel is within a couple of minutes walk of Placa Catalunya (where the airport shuttle bus drops you off) and only 2 minutes walk to Las Ramblas. We didn't take breakfast at the hotel but there are plenty of cafes nearby for coffee and croissants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: BusLeis45458
Reviews.Content: Pluses: The rooms were spacious, bed was more than comfortable, linens and housekeeping was first rate, great location, fast and good room service options Minues: Front desk was average or a little below

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and excellent quiet location in the Bari Gotic”
Reviews.Author: ponymad
Reviews.Content: We go to Barcelona frequently and this time wanted a budget break. We normally stay up Passeig Gracia as we are happy to walk up and down. But we had less time and were arriving at about 7pm. Chose the hotel based on reviews and were very happy. Tthe location is less than 5 minutes easy walk from the Airport bus in Catalunya Sq. Walk down Angel and take 2 nd on right then first left and the hotel is on the RHS immediately. We were offered a deal on breakfast but did tn take up (still 12E plus each) and we like to eat lunch. The hotel was comfortable, the beds were really good and the room was quiet . Did nt get a balcony but outdoor patio , did get the requested high floor. only the soap was stingy it totally disintegrates and sorry but I don t like getting washed with a satsuma! Minor niggle as I always take soap. Woud visit again and being central you can easily call in with any purchases rather than wearing yourself out!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, wooden floor bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: GypsySoleil
Reviews.Content: When travelling in Spain, more often than not, you come across very bad customer service, however this was not the case at this hotel! Centrally located, close to Las Ramblas and LOTS of shopping, quiet street, friendly staff, great bedroom with wooden floors, and a very nice bathroom. We had breakfast at the hotel and it was also very good. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “So close to Gothic quarter”
Reviews.Author: Adventurenerd410
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3days before our transatlantic cruise out of Barcelona. We arrived before check in time thinking we would have to leave our bags and walk around until check in time but, they kindly allowed us to go directly to our room. It was wonderful to able to relax right away after a long travel from US. The location was wonderful. Very close to Gothic quarter so you can enjoy the old city in the morning, day and night. We also used HOHO bus to get around since we were not familiar with Barcelona yet. It was a good idea to use HOHO to get overview of Barcelona. We booked weekend special and got wonderful breakfast buffet. Large variety and great quality. Everything was fresh and delicious. My favorite was the sweetest melon and prosciutto. Couple small grocery stores within a block and 3minutes walk to Rambras.

Reviews.Title: “good location /good facilities”
Reviews.Author: erfanhospital
Reviews.Content: it is located in city center near the most beautiful sight-seeing areas esp. La Rambla pedestrian street.Also varieties of food stors are located in few minutes from it(both fast food and traditional dishes of various nationalities).Facilities of inside the hotel is favorable.kind staff are the other positive points .Beside the memoriable and enjoyful travel to BARCELONA, I suggest to experince this valuable hotal.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid location, room and service”
Reviews.Author: NN-CPH
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for exploring Barcelona. Had a superior standard room and it was superior. In general the service was very good, and the breakfast was superb. Only downside was that not all the plates on the breakfast buffet was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Everything average..but excellent location and rates = Very good!”
Reviews.Author: Babyseal03
Reviews.Content: We stayed in for 2 nights in June this years after 20 days in Europe. No regrets whatsoever...though we cannot say that the service is top notch, it is worthy to note that for the price we pay - the location is wonderful. Just a short walk (less than 1 min) and we are right smack in the middle of the action of La Ramblas and less than 15mins walk to the famous market. Just along the Las Rambla main road, not far from the hotel; its where you can purchase the Hop on/Hop off bus tickets. Ask the concierge for more information - they will give you this package and forms where you can receive a discount when you buy the tickets. Pls only choose the Turistic Tour , i reckoned it offers the best routes in Barcelona as they offer 3 main routes across the city ( the logo of an Eye ) The location is along a quiet stretch of road , abt 2 strrets away form La Ramblas..ideal location as not too touristy. The room is basic but a good decent size, considering we are in Europe. We were allocated the corner room and hence larger than most room. The beds are soft and the pillows as thin as paper... but then again, not much complaints here as we were hardly in our rooms and by the time, we get back to our rooms..the thin as paper pillows were not that big a deal..No breakfast included in our rates but no worries here again... plenty of cafes and tapas place to choose from around the hotel . We will definitely return to NH Duc de la when we return to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: sonofdragon
Reviews.Content: You can't wrong with this wonderful hotel -- great location, reasonably priced, exceptional brunch buffet, courteous, helpful, and friendly staff, clean and quiet. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LukeEarthwalker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH Duc de la Victoria Hotel for 5 days at the beginning of our 3 week tour of Spain in July 2011. We did all our Spain vacation booking online through www.hotels.ca and we would highly recommended. Great prices, reliable and helpful customer service staff when we needed to make some changes. NH Duc de la Victoria is a very good and clean hotel. Very amiable staff in an unbeatable downton location - in Barrio Gothic, 3 minutes from the Catheral and La Rambla, 5 minutes from Plaza Catalunya and the main subway/Metro station. Although rated a 3 star hotel, it has all the amenities you will need, including free wi-fi. Very safe, well lit area of downtown Barcelona. Reception desk staff speak good English and are very helpful. Next time we are going to Barcelona, NH Duc de la Victoria Hotel is definitely where we are going to stay. A walk on Passeo de Gracia to visit the Gaudi houses Casa Batllo and La Pedrera will take no more than 15 minutes. About half an hour walk to Gaudi's Sagrada Familia Cathedral. Quick tips: - if you are a smoker, ask for a smoking room WITH a balcony - there is a little food store just around the corner (on the street leading to the Cathedral) that has everything you need including cold beer, wine, liquor, etc. - open 8:30 am - 830 pm - for greater choice there is a Carrefour food store on La Rambla just 5 minutes away from the hotel - parking IS a problem but the hotel has an arrangement with the underground parking lot at the Cathedral (25 euro/day as opposed to the regular 45 euro/day)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: los4caracoles
Reviews.Content: Walk to Las Ramblas and all kinds of little shops! We always grabbed a croissant from a neighborhood panaderia on our way out to sightsee, so we did not try the breakfast. Two teenagers stayed in one room, two adults in the other. Unfortunately they were not able to put us on the same floor. The woman at the front desk was especially helpful, and we visited a great restaurant at her suggestion. Can't beat this location. Liked the bathrooms very much!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Mary052010
Reviews.Content: Hotel duc de la Victoria is a few blocks from the Plaza Catalunya where the aeroport bus drops off/picks up and where you can catch the metro. The hotel is in the Barri Gothic, an older upscale and quiet part of town which we appreciated. Las Ramblas is a couple streets away which worked well too. We LOVED the location compared with other options in Barcelona. The staff were very friendly and helpful, suggesting restaurants and even a salon where I could get a hair cut. We stayed for 5 nights and the rates varied based on weekend/weekday/holiday. If you have the flexibility, it's more reasonable to stay on weekdays. Breakfast was not included and was 16 Euros so we skipped that and opted for some fun local places for breakfast each morning which were just a block or two away.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money & excellent location in Gothic Quarter off Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: MarysLittleLamb
Reviews.Content: This is a hidden gem of a hotel that is part of the Hisperia Group. Excellent location in the Gothic Quarter just off Las Ramblas just by the main shopping area. Free wi-fi in the lobby. Forget about the views as there are none however for this price, you can't go wrong. Only downside was that none of the locals seem to know where the hotel was even though it was just around the corner from where we asked them. Also as it is in the Gothic Quarter, car access is problematic with taxis unwilling to drive in however pickup from the hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Alpwalker
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after reading reviews on several blog sites and can't speak too highly of it. If you're considering a stay in Barcelona I can thoroughly recommend this hotel and we will certainly stay here again when we return to the city. Firstly, location. Set in a quiet area of the old town near to the cathedral, a 2 minutes walk from La Ramblas and 5 from Placa Catalunya, this hotel is ideally suited for visiting many of the local attractions and enjoying the night-life. Placa Catalunya is the terminus for the airport bus (Aerobus) and takes 25 minutes to reach this central city square at a cost of 8.30 euros one way. The hotel is away from roads and the only vehicles allowed near it are taxis, delivery lorries and bikes, so it is relatively quiet at night although there is always a chance of noise from revelers until the early hours. Don't be put off by pictures from Google Earth which at street level suggest a dark, deserted environment. I don't know when they took the footage but you'll find that the sides of the Carrer (passage way) are lined with shops behind those roller blinds and there is an exciting vibrancy to the whole area. Placa Catalunya is also the starting point for the two tour bus companies and we found it worth while investing in a two day pass that gave us free access to the buses which leave every 10 minutes and stop at numerous places around their routes to pick up and drop off. We used our first abd second morning to take north and south tours and then the afternoons to revisit places of interest we wanted to see. Hotel rooms: As your research will tell you, hotel rooms in Barcelona tend to be smaller than average. That said we found our room large enough to meet our needs. It was well cleaned and well appointed. The twin beds were larger than the British equivalent and speaking as an over six-footer, I was more than comfortable. The bathroom was well planned for the space and all we wanted. Breakfast: Wonderful - a great range of Spanish foods - mostly cold buffet but some hot. I was dismayed by some reviews I'd read about not being able to get a 'cooked breakfast'. Really, if you want a full English - stay in England or get yourself out to one of the Irish pubs and pay a bit extra. The breakfast hours are strictly adhered to which allows prices to be kept to a minimum. Not a problem for most but I did overhear one couple complaining because they'd booked a coach tour that left before breakfast started and were rather forcefully and repeatedly asking the receptionist what she was going to do about it. In the USA you might well expect some form of 'positive' response but not in Spain; and that's not an indication of rudeness - far from it, we found the people of Barcelona helpful and friendly. Safety: We read far too much in reviews about pick pockets. We felt as safe as in any other major European city. We always keep our eyes open especially in tight crowds but were perfectly safe. Just don't openly make yourself a target by having wallets bulgingly on display. Think! The hotel has free to use safes in every room. Make use of them and only take out what you need and a bit more. Leave your passport as well, you don't need it with you once you've checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: CitybreakNiki
Reviews.Content: A fabulous well located hotel! Close to la Rambla, the Barca cathedral and transport links! Surrounded by fabulous restaurants, bars and cafes but in a quiet street for a restful nights sleep! Never felt unsafe or at risk, it's no different to any major tourist city! Be sensible and don't take any risks! Want to go back to Barcelona and will look to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: usermom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a clean modern well kept 3 star (although I would rate it a 3 1/2 or 4 star) hotel in a great safe location and a 5 minute walk from Placa Catalunya, Las Ramblas and La Boqueria, and a 2 minute walk from the Cathedral. We crossed the street from the Aerobus Placa Catalunya stop onto Avinguda del Porta de I'Angel (see a large thermometer on a building), walked the slightly down inclined Avinguda del Porta de I'Angel street (this was the longest part of the walk past small shops and musicians and an El Ingles Corte store), made the first right onto Carrer de la Canuda (the signage was not good for this street, but you will see the red awning of a Periodicos stand on your left which you can't miss and the lettering: Thomas Cookon the building on your right), then the first left onto the short street Carrer del Duc and the hotel is on your right. The staff were extremely helpful in giving us directions to the sights, Aerobus schedules, metro and bus lines and stops to use. There was a security guard in the lobby on Sunday when we checked in and every night he made rounds throughout the hotel. We did not take the breakfast option for 14 Euros each since we went to local pastry shops and the market for our breakfast which was about 1/3 of the cost. We used the small food store across from the hotel to buy fruit and water very reasonably too. A few things to know about the rooms are: 1) It is like other European hotels that are green. When you enter your room, your key needs to go in the slot next to the door/light switch; this turns the lights and water on. Remember to take it out when you exit the room. 2) There is no clock or alarm in the room, but the staff was great about doing wake-up calls for us. 3) There are no dressers to put clothing in. The closet has a hanging section on one side of it and shelves on the other side to place clothes. 4) There is a safe is in the closet. We would definitely stay here again. 5) The modern marble tiled bathroom was supplied with shampoo, shower gel, soap, facial sponge, toothbrush and pocket tissues. The supplies were replenished as needed. 6) The balcony was narrow and only large enough for 2 people to stand on it and overlooked the street.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: K_B_49_11
Reviews.Content: One of the most helpful reception desks I've been to! Lovely staff, all speak great english and very polite/accommodating. Room was spotless, lovely bathroom with nice complimentary things! Breakfast was spot on, lots of things to choose from, everything you could ask for. Really good location too, 5 mins walk from the bus tour stops, lots of great shopping, about 15/20 mins walk to the beach (unless you get lost like us!!). Minibar not overpriced either. Overall a fantastic base to see this beautiful city! Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location!”
Reviews.Author: 5331Monica
Reviews.Content: Great location, in the gothic quarter, close to Las Ramblas, (but quite and safe) and very clean! The ladies at the front desk were nice. Unfortunately the free wi-fi never worked!! But I'd be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: billys19
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 5 times always pre or post cruise. Our accommodation this time was in a standard room, previously we have been in superior rooms and junior suites. The standard room was great (photos attached). The hotel is very clean, the staff helpful and the beds are large and soft yet firm. There was no noise at all during the night. We arrived early at the hotel as you do coming from the port and the staff held our cases until our room was ready. They give a receipt for each case and attach a corresponding label to them and store them in an area somewhere behind the reception area to which only the staff have access. The hotel is 5 minutes walk to La Ramblas and in the other direction 5 minutes to the Cathedral. There are lots of restaurants in both directions.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Location and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinCruisin09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location in the gothic area of Barcelona. Close to La Rambla but away from the noise. Very easy to get to from the Aerobus stop at Placa Catalunya arriving from the airport. We got to the hotel at 12:30pm and were able to get checked into our room ahead of the 3:00 check in time. The rooms are nicely appointed with a flat screen tv and fridge. The room was very clean. The main reason this hotel has an excellent rating from us is because of the staff. Their attention to detail and helpfulness when we needed assistance in making last minute travel arrangements was really appreciated. They went out of their way to help out and that makes this hotel stand out from the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: seni3
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so easy to find once we got off the airport shuttle. The hotel lobby was clean and the younger gentleman at the front counter went out of his way for us when we found out that we never canceled our original reservation. He was able to get us in touch with the hotel. He was very kind and explained how the free wifi worked in the lobby and the process for securing wifi in the hotel room. I also used their wake up call service and they were always on time and consistent. My hotel room was big and always clean. The bathroom was a nice size and the shower was great. The water pressure and the amount of hot water was perfect. I plan to visit Barcelona with other family members in a few years and I plan to stay here again. I wont look anywhere else. There is also a little grocery store across the way and a few stores down where you can buy fruit, snacks, cheese, meat, water and all other types of things. Having this store so close is another plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: UkWilliams
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel. Visited Barcelona during the summer with my boyfriend and we were both impressed with the location of this hotel. We used the Aerobus from the airport which only cost a few euros & stopped Placa de Catalunya. Outside the aerobus stop we discovered a tourist information place & got directions to the hotel which turned out to be a short walk (about 3mins). The street is situated on a quiet street right next to Las Ramblas which is great for shops, bars & restaurants & walkng distance with heels at night!! :-). We walked to and from the beach on our last day and this was about a 20 min brisk walk. Room wasnt ready for check in which was a bit of a pain but the room we ended up in was nice & clean and the air conditioning was great! Breakfast is a bit on the expensive side (but all food appeared to be in Barcelona!!) however it was nice. Good choice & friendly helpful staff. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would definately return to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Choice after Tripadvisor Research”
Reviews.Author: Neil18thMo
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at this hotel from 3rd to 5th October after booking a package with Expedia. Our (non smoking) room was not ready when we arrived late morning (not unexpected as check in/out is noon) but the desk staff stowed our bags so we could stroll around to get our bearings. The hotel, as many others have said is ideally located,just a couple of minutes walk off La Rambla and a short distance from Placa Catalunya, the central hub of the city. Having returned from a refreshing beer and some tapas in a nearby bar, we returned shortly after noon & our room was ready. It was on the first floor and overlooked the internal courtyard of the hotel. No view but we did not mind as this was also expected form other reviews. If you want a view, you may need to specify this in advance. Reception offer you breakfast at check in but we declined. You get 10% discount for booking the buffet breakfast at check in but the cost is quite high at nearly 15 euros. We found an alternative restaurant on La Rambla next to the Royal hotel and used by their guests at 12 euros per head which was a little better. Alternatively, La Bocqueria market has fruit, baguettes for much cheaper, lighter breakfast. The rooms are clean, modern and functional. Quite small but perfectly adequate for a couple just needing a comfortable bed and bathroom with good shower. Note, the shower gel bottle is small and doesn't go far if you like the lather up! You may wish to bring extra! The minibar in the room is available at a cost but a better option is to use the minimarket opposite the hotel. A large 1.5 L bottle of water is 80cents, not 2 euros for a 0.5L bottle in the minibar. Cold beers also available in the market for about a third of the cost in the minibar. Please note that Barcelona is an expensive city. You will need to expect to have open wallet surgery performed on you if you don't be careful! We did the open top, hop on/off bus tour at 30 euros per person for a 2 day pass (23 euros for a 1 day pass.) The bus tours start at Placa Catalunya, 5 min walk from the hotel.This was an excellent way to get around the city so we did the three different city loops on the first day to see the sights and then used the second day to get off at our selected stops. The tour ticket includes a booklet with various discounts at museums/restaurants and attractions so can save you quite a lot. A recommended restaurant is "Les Quinze Nits" in Placa Reial, halfway down La Rambla, turn left into this picturesque square surrounded by bars, restaurants and street entertainers performing. The food was very reasonable and good quality. It was the only restaurant on the square with a regular queue of diners. That has to say something! On checkout we left the bags in reception for later collection so we could explore on our last day. The hotel was ideal for us and we would not hesitate to return. For travel to and from the airport, use the aerobus which stops at Place Catalunya. One way ticket is 5.3 euros per person, return 9.20 (they don't advertise the return price, valid for 7 days on the price board at the airport so "y buelta, por favor" will get you the return price! Barcelona is a beautiful city and well worth a visit. Just be very aware of your personal belongings and your surroundings so your trip is not ruined by the infamous pickpockets

Reviews.Title: “Central and very good value”
Reviews.Author: Home-is-Manhattan
Reviews.Content: Excellent place for a short stay close to Plaza Catalunya and La Rambla. Short walk to the hop-on hop-off bus tour terminal and all the shopping. Comfortable and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: AEast10025
Reviews.Content: Cost of about $160/night was a bit pricey but location was great and hotel was nice. Hotel is located in an area called El Raval immediately next to the Gothic Quarter. About 2-3 blocks from La Rambla. About 10 minute walk from most of the major sites and the Aerobus which picks up/drops off at the airport (though you need to get the metro to see Sagrada Familia which is definitely worth the visit). Hotel room was clean and bed was comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful with finding some tour information.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, thats pretty much it though”
Reviews.Author: RYSAMBO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights as part of a pre-cruise warm up in Barcelona and it did the job, thats all I can really say about it. The location of the hotel was the main selling point for me, and considering this was only a bonus to add on-to our cruise I was only looking for something cheap and cheerful. However in saying that I did feel a bit disapointed with the hotel in comparison to other hotels I have stayed in over the years in major cities. Location was perfect to be honest and for me the only selling point of the hotel. Rooms were clean in all fairness and quiet which is always a positive after being out 12 hours a day :) Plenty going on with a short walk and easy to walk from Airport shuttle bus. Negatives though - when we entered the room it smelled quite strong of smoke, something that my wife and I cannot stand. It was supposed to be a non smoking room but for me this was not the case. We were travelling with my mother who had a room a few doors down, same problem in there. I checked with reception for another room but was told the hotel was full and no other rooms were available. Clothes and bedding in the room always had a damp feeling too, so was glad to get into the sun of Barcelona in the mornings. Dont get me wrong, the hotel served its purpose. Location was perfect and we had no major concerns. I guess I just like a little more comfort in hotels and got what I paid for on this occasion. Would I recommend the hotel - depends what your looking for. A place to store bags and explore Barcelona - yes; a romantic weekend away - Id prob look for something a little more plush. However, it didnt spoil our Barcelona adventure and was a perfect start for a fantastic cruise with Royal Caribbean! :)

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: bagobones33
Reviews.Content: Hotel is basic enough but very clean and staff are lovely. The location is perfect, its just off La Ramble and near enough to shops and the gothic quarter would deffo stay hear again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Good quality.”
Reviews.Author: AndreiSavich
Reviews.Content: NH Group rate this hotel as 3 stars but in reality you will find normal European 4 star hotel. The Hotel located in absolute heart of Gothic Quarter and it's just a few blocks from Cathedral and famous La Rambla and Placa de Cataluniya. As I've got a very special offer for my accommodation the Value marked as Excellent, I saw that average price can be a little bit high BUT location costs this extra asked. Personal are friendly and helpful. Hotel lobby are slim. Free Wi-Fi Internet provided at the lobby: printed log-in credentials you will find at the reception desk . It's declared as 30 min per person per day but nobody will refuse you to pick-up the new log-in. I'm not first time in Barcelona but already want to come back again. NH Duc de la Victoria would be the best option for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “NH Duc De La Victoria - Barcelona, Spain”
Reviews.Author: TJ-USA
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights after the cruise. Good location! Extremely close to the Rambla without the noise. Also close to the square where tour buses are located. The hotel lobby was clean and had A/C. Staff was friendly. They offer a deal so check out the fridge in the room. 9 euros for everything in the frige per day! Just make sure they restock it properly. It was a good deal. After a long day, a couple of beers, drinks and snacks were well worth it. All of the rooms are different. We had one of the SMALLEST rooms in the hotel. Rooms on the center are smaller and those on the ends are larger. If the price is the same, ask for rooms away from the elevator, they are larger. However, the bath was well equipped, the room was modern and pretty decent for the price. They offer breakfast for an additional fee. Did not try it but it looked decent. The Rambla is a 2 minute walk one way and the cathedral is 2 minutes the other way. Good location, decent value and I would consider it again if in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Aussiecouple258
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and easy to walk to all attractions, shops, restaurants, transport etc. The room was a good size and fitted out nicely but had no free WIFI. Free WIFI in lobby only. Staff were very helpful. We would not hesitate with staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ROhler
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the NH Duc de la Victoria for two nights prior to leaving on a cruise. I booked the hotel based on online research and reviews from TripAdvisor. We we weren't disappointed. The location was perfect and we could walk in 5 minutes to Placa de Catalunya and Las Ramblas. We took a taxi from the airport which cost approximately 30 Euros and he took us right up to the front of the hotel. These pylons you see on some streets in the Gothic Quarter are retractable and I was expecting to have to walk a couple blocks to the hotel, but he dropped us off right in front. Check-in was fast, we had a room overlooking the street the entrance of the hotel was on. Since the hotel is off the main streets, it's very quiet. Room was small, but having lived and traveled in Europe it was expected and we weren't there for most of the day anyways. We had breakfast as part of the room price. I think the breakfast was worth having as we would eat a good breakfast in the morning and then spend all day sightseeing and not have to worry about getting hungry. The staff was really helpful with directions to various sights and I will definitely stay at this hotel again when I go back to Barcelona. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: broooce
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights after cruise, taxi from ship cost 15 euros. There were three of us and we had a huge room with massive bed and sofa bed, had a few English speaking channels on tv. Big size bathroom, in room safe and fridge. Front desk staff excellent very god with directions, free wifi in lobby and free sweets for the young ones. Overall a great hotel and will definitely stay here again if we visit Barcelona Centre.

Reviews.Title: “For a city break it was very good”
Reviews.Author: Mazzy9
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise trip for my 60th birthday from my husband and very good it was too. We managed to find the hotel without too much trouble from the town centre. We caught the local bus from the airport. The hotel was in a very good situation for everything and I would stay here again if I came back to Barcelona. The room was a bit small but contained everything we needed and was good for three nights. Didn't use any of the hotel facilities only the restaurant for breakfast which was continental but set us for the busy days ahead. We bought a bus pass for 2 days and used it to travel everywhere around the city - well worth the money and we saw all the sights marked them off on our map and used to bus again to get to them. Loved Barcelona and would love to go back again to visit everything we didn't have time for. Casa Batillo is a must for a very unusual building by Gaudi, fasinating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: Chiamasoto
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an hotel well located in Barcelona, you have found it. Near to the Ramblas and the see, you'll enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Affordable Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: meghan429
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights on a trip through Europe for our anniverary, and I found this hotel to be a pleasant surprise. I wasn’t expecting too much from it (I got a reasonable rate and it was in a good location in the city in July—Superior Room Advanced Purchase and it was in a central location). It was located near Placa Catalunya between Portal de l’Angel and Ramblas (the 2 pedestrian boulevards). I will say, though, that at night I wouldn’t have wanted to walk back to our hotel alone only because the area immediately around it was completely shut down and kind of deserted late, but it was fine. The hotel wished us a happy anniversary upon our arrival (had asked if we were celebrating anything when I booked and I guess they record that for check-in). Our room was very comfortable with a nice sized bathroom, hardwood floors, and we were on a corner, so we had 2 small balconies (they weren’t really big enough to sit on with a chair or anything, but still nice), and the room was very clean. They had put some candies and a bottle of water in our room complementary, as well. The hotel also gave a password for 30 mins of free internet access (only worked in the lobby) every day, as well. My husband asked the desk for a recommendation for tapas, and the place the receptionist recommended was so good that we ended up eating there 4 times while we were there (and therefore didn’t eat much else in all of Barcelona haha). We did look around other places, but this place definitely had the most appealing looking tapas. It was called Ciudad Condal If you follow Ramblas up (away from the water) a block past Placa Catalunya, then when it splits there, stay right for one more block, it is on the corner of Gran Via de les Cortes Catalanes--across both directions of traffic on the right on the corner next to the place called OBAMA (ironically). They had good small pitchers of sangria (makes about 3 glasses), cheap beers and wine, great tapas and specials, etc. The bar gets CROWDED, bu you can also sit, and still get tapas or a selection from the bar (or from the menu--can ask for an English menu if needed). To get bar items for your table, you simply push your way to the bar after getting your table, tell them your table # (get from your server), and point our what you want and they will send it over. In the morning, go down to La Boqueria (the market) on the Ramblas-- on your right if walking in the direction of the water. It is a lot cheaper than the hotel breakfast, and you can get anything you could possibly want from an omelet to fruit salad or juice, a cappuccino, breads, pastries, cheeses and meats, etc, and there was a little area with tables and chairs. We tried Jamon Iberico there (ham from Iberian black pigs that primarily eat acorns). It is delicious, the Spaniards love their ham, but that one is not cheap. 100 grams costs between 7 and 10 euros. We loved it, though. There was a place that had it pre-packaged in 100 gram packages—when you walk into the market itself, go all the way to the wall along the left-hand side and there is a shop that had pretty much all pork, we got I there. We then just got some nice rolls from one of the bakery stands and some cheese from a cheese stand and had a great little picnic breakfast. (Can do the same with Serrano ham for about ½ the price, but if you like ham, try Jamon Iberico at least once.) Barcelona Tips in General (if interested): I found the main sights in Barcelona to be: Gaudi’s sights (Sagrada Familia Church, Casa Mila aka La Pedrera, the Block of Discord, & Park Guell), the Ramblas/the Market, the Barri Gotic/Cathedral, the Picasso Museum, and the beaches. I would say you need a minimum of 2 days and 2 nights in Barcelona to appreciate it (3 would probably be even better). In terms of organizing time, if you stay here (and like to keep moving), on my first day, I would do a walk down the Ramblas in the morning—it is much more enjoyable and less congested in the morning (stopping at the market for breakfast), then take the Drassanes metro stop up to Passeig de Gracia, see the block of discord and walk 3 blocks up to Casa Mila (it is worth the admission to get on the roof, really liked it, and the apartment is interesting, too), then walk back to the Passeig de Gracia Metro stop and take the metro to Sagrada Familia (have to change once, but only 3 stops overall). Then after seeing that, take a taxi to Park Guell and wander around (about 8 euros for the taxi, park is free). I booked Casa Mila ahead, but at least when we were there, there was no major line for it, so it would have been ok to just show up (not sure if that is always the case—it is a bit pricey, but you will never see another roof like that for the rest of your life). I also booked Sagrada Familia ahead (thank God). That was 500% worth it. The line to get in was INSANE when we were there (like had to be 2+ hrs wait at least). There is no way we would have waited in that, no matter how badly we wanted to see it. We cut the entire line to collect our tickets and walk right in (amazing)—if you book ahead, just proceed to the ticket booth (I had my confirmation printed out), we waved it to the person organizing the kiosks and they let us straight into the front. If you want to take an elevator up to the top of the church, though, book it when you pick up your tickets because there will be a wait for that, so you can tour the place and then go to the elevator at your appointed time—it was too long until the next one for us, so we just skipped it. We had booked the audioguide, too, when I ordered our tickets online which I’m glad we did because it helped us to appreciate the place (but you can also just pay for one inside after you collect your ticket if you want it). A taxi is by far the easiest way to get to Park Guell from there, and relatively inexpensive. We hiked all over the park (some great view of the city), and all sorts of interesting Gaudi-esque things staggered throughout the park. Then tapas for dinner (or paella). On Day 2 I would probably go back to the market on the Ramblas for breakfast (if you liked it), then I would walk around the Barri Gotic and visit the cathedral (free until 12:45pm, after 5 euros). And then probably spend some of my day at the beach. The sandy beaches were nice, and fine to relax on a towel. When we were there, for 2 chairs it was 5 euros each and a shared umbrella was 6 euros (all day use, no ½ day price). We just relaxed happily on our towels in the sand for free. You could visit the Picasso museum in the evening or if you had another day. We did not make it there, but it has the most extensive collection of his early, realistic works and an encompassing collection of his different time periods, so if you are a fan, it’s probably a must-see.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: JHFIII
Reviews.Content: Just off Las Ramblas. Nice enough hotel property. The staff were abliging but not overly friendly. Rooms are small but clean. English is generally spoken by someone on staff at all times. It is not a bargain but in central Barcelona such a thing may not exist. The only significant downside is access. This hotel is on a pedestrian walkway. It is only accessable by taxis that have special access privlidges. If you don't happen to be riding in such a cab, you will walk two to three blocks to the property which may be an issue if you have mobility issues or a lot of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the Rambla/Placa de la Catalunya.”
Reviews.Author: Flinster
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in central (touristy bit) Barcelona this hotel is idealy situated just off the Ramblas. It's clean, efficient (as you'd expect from a good hotel chain), and perfectly situated a short walk from everywhere, and quiet. Nice old building but inside don't expect any character. I'm a single guy so they usually fob you off with a broom cupboard over looking a lift shaft but only very gentle persuasion got me a twin bedded room with a street view. I only stayed for a long weekend as part of a wedding party, most of my friends staying in another local hotel, so only really used this as a room and wasn't looking for extras. My friends' room in a nearby hotel was smaller and twice the price. Ok it had much more facilities but we came for a wedding not a gym and a roof terrace. Oh and watch out for pickpockets. Didn't take my wallet out at night, just a card and some cash tucked into my front pocket. Thief proof. So they nicked my phone out of my back pocket....... Restaurant tips: Taller Tapas on Placa St Josep Oriel, and Les Quatre Gats. Both within easy walking distance. The first is less expensive than the second. Money tips: Bring plenty. Nothing is cheap in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Piets
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in June for 4 nights. Its a great location, close to the ramblas but not too close. Hotel is comfortable and rooms are good. I think its good to get a feel for the ramblas etc. Maybe for those who like the beach, you can stay here for a few nights, do the city visits etc and then move to a hotel near the beach. Otherwise good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located hotel with friendly service”
Reviews.Author: SallyMalibu_CA
Reviews.Content: Only a three-minute walk to either La Rambla or the Cathedral make this hotel's location in the Gothic Quarter a major plus for Barcelona visitors. The street is quiet and atmospheric (pedestrian traffic only), many restaurants nearby. While our deluxe room was small by American standards, it was modern but not overly so, spotlessly clean, contained thoughtful amenities and provided a stand-up balcony for soaking up the Latin Quarter's considerable charm. The desk staff was very friendly and always ready to answer questions. The breakfast room was spacious and well-decorated, offering a large selection of foods. The Duc is an excellent value and we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again should we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “good location ,good value”
Reviews.Author: konotop
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 days and it was really a confortable stay..the location is central, you can enjoy the gothic area as well the sea side and you are at 3 minute to the catalunya place.. breakfast was good and staff friendly..jordy at reception very profesional.we will come back... thanks to all the staff to make our holidays unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Gothic area hotel”
Reviews.Author: AriaProf
Reviews.Content: On our return visit to Barcelona after a Mediterranean cruise we stayed at another NH hotel. They exhibit a certain flair and attention to detail, and the staff is friendly to foreigners. This was a more inexpensive hotel than the U232 where we stayed before, therefore the room was smaller, but it was very adequate. We enjoyed being in the Gothic area as we wanted to visit the Picasso museum, the Cathedral and the Barceloneta. It was raining so we were glad to be within walking distance of all the sights. Plan to pay extra for breakfast, but it's worth it if you're out walking around for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Smack dab in the center”
Reviews.Author: Fubar3d
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay where the action is this may be the place; smack in the middle of "old town" Barcelona. Excellent restaurants everywhere but crowded, crowded, crowded. Barcelona, at least the old town, is a twenty-somethings destination based on our observations. Lots of cool old buildings but chucky-full of turistas. Not that there is anything wrong with that. The hotel is one of a Dutch chain and is managed and maintained like one. Everything is clean and functions properly. The rooms are average size for Europe, very small by American standards. It features comfortable beds, windows that keep the noise out and drapes that keep it as dark as you like. Small fridge/minibar with (surprise!) reasonably priced beverages. Free Wi-Fi in the lobby only... pay in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: Happyheart83
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the NH Duc in June. I resaerched a lot of hotels and chose this one for the location right in the centre of the old part of Barcelona. I also liked that it was a business style hotel as many of the hotels in Barcelona seem overly trendy with glass bathrooms and all white decor which I would find a little off putting. I could not have been more pleased with my choice. The location was fantastic we walked everywhere! The room was clean and simple and exactly what I was looking for a short city break. We took the breakfast deal on arrival and were very pleased that we did as we really enjoyed the excellent and plentiful choice of healthy foods which really set us up for the day exploring the sights of Barcelona for which the hotel could not have been more perfectly located. I took the opportunity to seek out the other hotels I had considered while in Barcelona and was glad that I had chosen the NH Duc. definitely recommended- thankyou to all at Trip Advisor for helping to make my trip to Barcelona a great success !

Reviews.Title: “In the shadow of a 13th century cathedral!”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraAnn_11
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel for it's location! It is in the heart of the Gothic Quarter, a quaint but bustling area of Barcelona. We really enjoyed venturing out each day, having breakfast outside at a nice little cafe, right in the shadow of a 13th century cathedral. From there, we could head a short walk to La Rambla, an excellent main walkway through the heart of the city, with shops and restaurants all around. Our little balcony was an added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: SunnyBeach15
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 14-night stay at NH Duc de la Victoria. This hotel is a 2 minute walk to La Rambla and Catalunya station and yet it is extremely quiet! It is clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful. We were not impressed with the Buffet selection but there are so many places to eat nearby, it was not an issue. The standard rooms are very small so we upgraded to a Juniour suite (1 bedroom and 1 sitting area) which was great. No free wi-fi in rooms but you can get coupons in the lobby for hald hour each to use wi-fi in the lobby for free. For beach lovers - taking the 59 bus from La Rambla works well as it stops all along the good beaches and comes by very often. We found that taking the metro to the beach was not faster and required more walking. Not to miss in Barcelona - a flamenco show and if possible see the one at the Palau de la Musica which is an incredible place. Other suggestions - 1. the musical fountain 2. either renting a car or taking the Sarfa bus to Tossa Del Mar (from Estacio du Nord) and spending a day there (it's about 2 hours each way). The beach there is so beautiful (wear good sandals as the beach sand is not soft). Walk around the medieval village and enjoy one of resturants on the boardwalk. 3. One of our favourite things was going to the Dali museum in Figueres which we did though a tour company but it can also eb done independtly - taking the bus there. It is not a museum in the usual sense, it is an exprience! 4. Monserat and 5. Gaudi sites of course.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulou location in heart of Barri Gothic area”
Reviews.Author: michellew28
Reviews.Content: Amazing location . 2 minutes to La Ramblas and to Place de la Catalunya but in a quiet side street. . In street called duc de la victoria but signage only says carrer del duc so be careful you don't miss street. Staff helpful and very clean with comfortable beds. Also 5 mins walko hop-on / hop-off tourist bus and 5 minutes walk to airport buses that come every 10 minutes. Make sure you check which terminal you are going to. Bouqueria markets are a must - only 10 minutes away and closed Sundays. Also Montjuic water fountains at night in Summer are a must. Open Thursdays through to Sundays.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: wewaltz
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with this hotel. The location, as others have noted, is ideal. It is close to the action but in a quiet side street. The staff was most helpful. Indeed, they seemed more 'in the know' than the people working at the official tourist information center. When I asked about bus routes, the official answer was - go to the Transit Office. At this hotel, the person working the front desk pulled out a huge book listing all the bus routes and spent considerable time finding the one I wanted. It was greatly appreciated. The room safe was in a convenient location (not always the case in hotels), although it did suddenly stop responding to our code. Happily, the staff came quickly to reset it. The black-out curtain covering the window is amazing. The room becomes totally dark. Highly recommended. Linda in Delaware, USA

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: hueritacpc
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. Friendly and helpful staftt. Nice, larger rooms and bathroom. Very comfortable. Located on a very quiet street at...night anyway. Active area during the day very close to the cathedral and major streets for transportation access. If we are fortunate enough to stay in Barcelona again, we would book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AnnaScotland
Reviews.Content: There are so many hotels in Barcelona we couldn't decide so chose this one from Tripadvisor reviews and we are so pleased that we did. I can't understand the previous reviewer saying the hotel smelt of stale smoke, our first impression was of a cool, clean lobby with a friendly and helpful receptionist. The location is so good because it is only a couple of minutes walk round the corner to La Ramblas, barely 5 minutes walk to Place Catalunya where the Metro/Renfe station is located, about 10 minutes walk to the harbour area and a 20 minute walk to the North bus station. Although the situation is so central it is very cool and quiet because it is on an old narrow street. Our room was small but had all we needed and having a balcony was a real bonus. The air conditioning was on all the time, even when our keycard was out of the electrical socket so we always came back to a pleasantly cool room. We had a mini bar which we used as a fridge, a free safe, sufficient seating and wardrobe space and extremely comfortable twin beds. The bathroom was also small but spotlessly clean with plentiful toiletries including a toothbrush and sponge. We chose not to eat breakfast although it was offered at 13.90euro a day, perhaps this was a mistake as we tried different cafes with very mixed results, for example one we went to was awful and still cost us 24euro for 2 of us. This was a very comfortable base for a city break and we would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “practical hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: cprm
Reviews.Content: Went there for a three day conference. Already hot in Barcelona, and, obviuosly did not see all that much of the hotel. Downsides: musty smell of smoke (I thought the hotel was no smoking) somewhat dated and stained carpets, cleanliness could be better, no bar in the lobby, only 30 min of free wifi in the lobby. Upsides: GREAT location, close but not too close to the ramblas, well noise isolated, slept great, wonderful breakfast, all in all good value for this category hotel. Within walking distance of extensive shopping, great little bars in the neighborhood (Menage a Trois), and Barrio Gotic. Would consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and will come back!”
Reviews.Author: MeMyszka
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in Mai with one of my friends. We have chosen not to take the breakfast (not on purpose that is not good). Just to have the chance to eat every day some where else. Service: Great service! Stuff very helpful. Good advices on places to go and see or not to see. Room: nice at the side of a street, quite though. I have back problems and found the bed a bit to hard for me but otherwise nothing to complain. The room for two people a bit claustrophobic :-) so I guess next time take a bigger one :-) Surely that depends what you prefer. Location: The hotel is really not far from the Catalunya square so you can walk. Also walking distance to shopping areas (streets) and La Rambla :-) Best: The location The least: There is one thing which I found a bit strange. When we arrived there was a bottle of water. However this hasn't been a habit so next day there wasn't any refreshed bottle. Petty. Not to bad. The WiFi only in the lobby for free for half an hour and you will be charged with amount of 10 Euros if I remember correctly if you use it in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: MaryJB_11
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on trip advisor and it lived up to its good reviews. We stayed for 5 days. It is close to La Ramblas and many of the tourist attractions but in a relatively quiet street that is a pedestrian way. Staff were helpful, breakfasts were very good. The room was comfortable and all in all the whole experience was a good one. And Barcelona is a great place for a holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: missprints
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, on the edge of the Barri Gotic and close to Playa Catalunya and La Rambla. Our room was a good size with lots of storage, as was the bathroom, the bed was comfortable, and we even had a small balcony. It was spotlessly clean and the reception staff were helpful with every enquiry. There is free wifi in reception only - for half an hour at a time - but the chairs and sofas are comfy so it's not bad hanging out there. If you are looking for somewhere to dine nearby, I would recommend Xaloc restaurant (details on TripAdvisor). If I am ever forturnate enough to be back in Barcelona, I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I'm staying here again on my next trip to Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: womantravelerZurich
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in the Gothic Quarter, very close to Playa Catalunya and the Cathedral. Great shopping close by. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast buffet had a great selection. The room was a good size and the bathroom was spacious and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, curtious and convienant”
Reviews.Author: zaxes
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our anniversary trip to Barcelona. It was a pleasure to find the NH duc de la Victoria. The booking was very easy and the staff was very helpful in responding to my email questions. The hotel and the rooms are clean and well maintained. The desk staff were wonderful and were always ready to give information and to provide help in making dinner reservations. The location is wonderful. Just two blocks off the La Rambas yet an easy walk to explore the city on foot or by bus and/or metro.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel except for Reservation Handling”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is part of a chain and we expected better service when booking our reservation. We tried emailing the hotel directly for reservations with no response. We tried faxing the hotel for a reservation with no response. We finally went on the main NH site and placed our reservation request. But again, we did not get any acknowledgment or any confirmation. We were alerted when we were charged the full amount of our stay to our charge account. (Their website clearly states that charges would not be applied at the time of booking.) After two phone calls from the US (totaling $60) we were finally given a confirmation number for our stay. Was it worth it? No, but we were joining a tour and didn't want to hassle with changing hotels. If we hadn't experienced problems with the reservations, I would rate this hotel very good. We had a spacious room with a balcony. The room was clean and somewhat quiet considering the street noise, and the breakfasts were adequate.

Reviews.Title: “In Barcelona, stay HERE.....”
Reviews.Author: W0rcesterW0man
Reviews.Content: Second visit to Barcelona so wanted a central but quiet hotel, and this fitted the bill PERFECTLY. In a fab location in the Barri Gottic - on a very quiet street but 5 mins from Rambla and 2 mins from all the groovy shops. Smart, comfortable, breakfast excellent, service pretty good..... Previous reviewers should be more aware of what you will get when staying in Barcelona. It's not a cheap city and the rooms will always be a bit smaller, but ours was fine with an excellent bathroom (including a full-size bath, bliss). Book directly with the hotel to get a decent rate and breakfast included, but having done so, it will not disappoint - all very fresh and wide choice of most things. Service was fine as far as we saw it, although they hesitated with restaurant recommendations. We had 5 excellent nights' stay here (and we're picky) andwould definitely return and recommend to others. Enjoy....

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Hotel near La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Wahoowa97
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel. We had 2 rooms reserved, one double and one triple. The triple room was a double room with 2 single beds and an additional rollaway bed. The double room had a double bed. Both rooms were small, with the triple room being even more congested. The rooms were outdated but overall clean; the bathroom was small but adequate. The hallway had an unpleasant odor. For the hotel rate, it was WAY Overpriced. The location was very close to La Rambla, which although is a bustling treelined street with many stores, eateries, and street performers can be somewhat seedy. The location is good if you want to be close to this area. There were nice parts of Barcelona as well. We looked at several hotels prior to booking primarily around La Rambla and they all seemed to be within the rate offered by Duc De La Victoria. Internet was free in the lobby and available in the rooms at a rate of 5.6 Euros for 24 hours. There are 2 metro stops in close proximity to the hotel (Liceu and Plaza Catalunya). The best mode of transport to the hotel from the airport is probably by the Aerobus, which costs 5.3 euros one-way and drops off at plaza Catalunya, from which the hotel is about a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with potential”
Reviews.Author: MKane2001
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Barcelona: great city, fantastic trip overall. Hotel is in a great location off La Ramblas but it could benefit from having hotel bar; although WIFI is available free in reception, daily charges for access in rooms was very expensive and should be free. Hotel reception staff always appeared flustered if there were more than one person in the queue.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a centralized location”
Reviews.Author: kmarie_711
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty nice hotel in a really centralized location. The photos on the website definitely made it look more fancy & modern than it actually was, but it was in a really great area being a few blocks off of La Ramblas. (TIP: I would NOT stay on La Ramblas seeing as it is littered with pickpockets & noisy people selling things... aside from that, a cool area to visit non the less) The hotel was clean - they changed the sheets on the bed every day which was nice - and they did a good job helping us at the front desk when we had questions. Really, we didn't have many complaints about it! Not over the top awesome, but definitely nice.

Reviews.Title: “Real gem, though a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Gavail
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location at Barri Gòtic, just 5 min. walk from Plaça de Catalunya. The hotel located just 100 meters from the Rambles, however the place is very quiet. There is a nice square, local bar ("Menage A Trois") and restaurant ("La Taverneta") behind the building. The room was clean and has all the listed amenities. There was a bit strong odor of cleaners it the corridor. We payed ~500 euros for 3 nights, which seems a bit overpriced for me, although it was the "Semana Santa" (Easter Holidays) so may be at the low season the price will be lower.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel , great spot. Fully recommended”
Reviews.Author: arch-tec
Reviews.Content: . The room was very pleasant ,clean, comfortable beds .Room size as usual in europe in the center of the city but we asked for a room with a balcony and had a veiw onto a nice lane. Double glazed windows' wood floor . Lovely modern clean bathroom. The location was fantastic! Quiet but in the middle-north of Barri Gotic , close to Born and 7 minutes from the airport bus . We didn't take breakfast in the hotel as it was expensive and there were many places around to have breakfast at and also at the nearby markets.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Jazz1944
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in March and can honestly say in was worth the cost. The hotel is in the right place for visiting the city. It was quiet and comfortable and the staff were really very helpful. The room was slightly small but as we were out most of the time that didn't matter. The breakfast buffet was really good and if booked at reception was great value. One small criticism would be the lack of English newspapers and although there were 30 odd channels on the TV there was only news broadcasts in English although there were Italian, German and French channels available, maybe an English channel could be added. I will certainly stay there again if I visit Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “After 20+ Visits - What a Find!”
Reviews.Author: AandTYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Just to quantify our review - between us we have made 20+ trips both business and leisure to Barcelona We've stayed at some nice Hotels but for location and value for money this was the best Great Location, comfortable beds and a balcony. and yes for a hotel so close to the action its quiet enough to get a good nights sleep Highly recomended

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, but rooms are no way spacious”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Jetten
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in this hotel for a long weekend 5 years ago, and had kept fond memories of it. So when I finally went back to Barcelona last another, I looked no further and booked this hotel straight away. The "weekend extender" rate made it especially tempting, as it included breakfast, a lazy Sunday checkout (until 17h), and a free fully stocked minibar, all for a very competitive rate. The hotel was pretty much as I remembered it, but taken very litterally: nothing seemed to have changed or been renewed in the past 5 years. Whereas the hotel came across to me as completely refurbished on my previous visit, this time I clearly spotted signs of age and usage. Nothing was broken or in bad shapen, but there were scratches on the furniture, worn spots in the corridor carpet, and more generally a remote feeling that the hotel needs freshing up a little. The other thing that struck me during my second stay was the size of the rooms. Some earlier reviewers mentioned that the rooms are spacious, but if you carefully study the pictures that earlier reviewers have posted you will see for yourself that this is not true, at least not for the standard rooms. I would estimate the size of the room to be 2,5 times the size of the bed. Not cramped, but certainly not spacious either. However, if you arrive early in the afternoon you may be able to upgrade to a junior suite upon check-in for a mere 35 euros extra per night. The suites were sold out by the time I got there, but I saw pictures of it in the reception and it definately seemed like a good deal to me. Other then these two remarks I would fully recommend this hotel for its excellent location, good breakfast, the wooden floors in the rooms, the small balconies, the quiet surroundings (no cars in the streets, and few pedestrians) and the NH style of furniture which - even if slightly ageing - is much nicer than what many other hotels have to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: dollyCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It is in the most perfect location, just a few steps from La Rambla. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean.
