The receptionist that was working the night i arrived was extremely helpful, as i was in need of some help and he went out of his way. The buffet breakfast was very plentiful although the charge a little steep, luckily ours was included in the room rate. They even have sparkling wine on offer for breakfast! Overall this is a great base for a stay in Barcelona and i wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel in good central location”
Reviews.Author: dianeguide
Reviews.Content: Excellent location just round the corner from Las Ramblas but very quiet in the evening so you get a good night's sleep. Modern amenities and friendly reception and cleaning staff. Metro station nearby and buses to and from the airport are 10-15 minutes walk away. Well situated between the old Gothic quarter and not far to walk to the Gaudi houses in the newer part of town so ideal for sightseeing. We will definitely stay here when we next visit Barcelona. Breakfast not included in price but this is the norm in Barcelona and there are some good cafes nearby where you can buy croissants, filled rolls, coffee etc. We would have liked tea/coffee making facilities in the room but I believe that this is not the norm in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Clean in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: kkbrn
Reviews.Content: The NH Duc is right off Las Ramblas near placa de catalunya. Great shopping and eating nearby. It is about 30 Euros for a taxi from the airport. Print a map to the hotel to gove to the cab driver before you go. If you arrive early morning or late evening they can drive all the way in. If you arrive during the day they will have to drop you about 2 blocks away and you have to walk in because they are mostly pedestrian streets. The hotel is clean, modern and cheap for europe standards. The rooms are not big but have adequate storage for clothing and a safe. The beds are clean and comfortable. The bathroom had a tub over shower and nice toiletries. The breakfast was good but expensive at 16 euros. Go to a cafe around the corner near the cathedral for great tapas or breakfast anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find, but worth the effort.”
Reviews.Author: fbswan
Reviews.Content: Once we found it, this hotel was perfect to walk to Las Ramblas, to the public transportation, to the Boqueria Mercat, and general strolling around the area. The staff was very helpful and the hotel itself was clean and modern. I'd recommend this to anyone. If you have a car, parking is nearby and around 15 euro per day. We parked the car and walked or took public transportation everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, convenient, clean and in the heart of it all!!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyskyze
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful 5 days in Barcelona and a great stay at the NH Duc de la Victoria. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling for business and/or pleasure. All reviews were right about the fact that the hotel is on a small street, quiet, and somewhat hard to locate by some cab drivers, but we didn't have any problems being dropped off at La Rambla and walking to the hotel. The plus about it being on a small side street is that it is very quiet, yet you can walk right out into the heart of the Gothic area of the city. It is in a perfect location, conveniently located to the Gothic Area/Cathedral, Placa Catalunya, La Ramblas, near the Boqueria, and there are several metro stops a few steps away. All the reviews mentioned how the hotel breakfast was worth it, but we opted to go to La Boqueria every morning (walking distance), which was delicious. The rooms were clean and moderate room, beds very comfortable and there were many amenities available including wireless in the lobby (free for 30 mins per day), hairdryers, and phone chargers for a nominal fee. The hotel staff spoke good English, and were very helpful suggesting places to go for dinner, flamenco shows, etc and even offered to make reservations for us. This was my second time in Barcelona, and I plan to stay at this hotel every time I go back - it's definitely worth it for the location, convenience, and overall comforts!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for week end”
Reviews.Author: Lelemilano
Reviews.Content: I read all reviews on trip advisor and i haven't found any surprise. The hotel is very good location is perfect cos it's 200 meter from rambla and cathedral but at the same time its very quite place in a nice narrow. Rooms are quite and soundprofed, mine was small but quite nice and clean. We just had a little problem about warmer the first day but than it was solved. Breakfast is perfect like all NH hotels, good quality and great choice. Staff was always kind and collaborative. At the end i suggest this hotel for location, if u have less time, a short week end to visit barcelona that is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: DavidJSmith_10
Reviews.Content: Well positioned near Placa Catalunya and La Rambla, but in a quite location. Clean well maintained rooms and friendly (English speaking) staff. Our superior room had tea and coffee making facilities, bath robes , a balcony and plenty of space. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fermyr
Reviews.Content: A small hotel, in the old city, but in a very quiet street. Walking distance to good restaurants, shopping area, museums, touristic attractions. Our room was small but there was everything we need. Very good breakfast (more continental style). We would stay there again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Two blocks from The Ramblas, Barri Gothic, and Placa de Catalunya -- But Quiet!”
Reviews.Author: jcinpdx
Reviews.Content: Two blocks east of The Ramblas, two west of the Barri Gothic, and two sourth of the Placa de Catalunya, this hotel was ideally situated for us. We walked everywhere we wanted to go, from La Boqueria to Sacrada Familia (a hike, admittedly) to Barceloneta (another hike). Despite its location, it was very quiet, even with the windows wide open. The hotel is often described as a "business" hotel, which correctly describes its common areas, which are comfortable but not especially inviting. Our room was reasonabe in size, and the bed was comfortable. The room and bathroom were well-maintained and clean. The staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: thumper101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 2 families including young children, booked through lastminute.com. The hotel is in a fantastic position just off Las Ramblas, though a little tricky to find at first. Everything was great, the rooms were modern & clean & the staff friendly & helpful. There is no bar in the hotel & we didn't take the breakfast option (seemed a little expensive at 15 euro pp) but there are plent of bars and cafes a short stroll away. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very centrical, clean, and friendly...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very centrical, clean, and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, intimate and friendly, would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: sligosue
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 3 night stay. I did my 'homework' on this website before I booked the hotel and I have to say that it does live up to expectations. It is in a great location, really close to all the action and yet totally peaceful at night. The staff were very welcoming, friendly and helpful. The room was not enormous but had everything we needed and more besides (incl. gorgeously comfy king-size bed) - no panoramic vistas but we didn't expect any. The buffet breakfast is served till 11:30 on weekdays and till 12:00 at weekends - and that's from 07:00! There is everything you could want and more besides, hot and cold and replenished regularly. The room service is not provided by the hotel but from a pizza-type place so we never got round to that side of things - but I can't think that this would help sway someones' choice of hotel(?). During our stay the hotel was very busy with travellers of all nationalities, including lots of senior(ish) citizens and I can't help thinking it is used as a base for cruise-ship passengers starting/ finishing their cruise holidays. They can be pretty demanding customers (rightly so) and if they had no complaints I certainly cannot manufacture any.

Reviews.Title: “great location, quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ikura
Reviews.Content: The rooms were surprisingly quiet, given its location in the heart of the tourist area. The room looked and felt very clean, although there was a slight mildew smell. Very good, full breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SNV
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in September 2010 for 5 days. It was really nice! The location is perfect. It is close to La Rambla but far enough so you can not hear any noise. The hotel is clean, rooms are small but tidy and clean. I liked a small balcony in my room from where you I could see the street. The staff was polite and friendly. We had breakfasts at the hotel. You pay around 15 euro and get a great breakfast. I would give 4* to this hotel and definitely recommend it to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great breakfast, terrific service!”
Reviews.Author: lydiainiowa
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better - far enough off Las Ramblas to be quiet, but close enough to get there in a 3 minute walk. Perfect. The breakfast was a wide variety of options, and the front desk service was excellent. They had many recommendations for us while we were in town. I would have liked our room to be a bit larger, but I think that's par for the course in Europe, for the most part. Otherwise, a great experience and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ReisefreundMUC
Reviews.Content: Not a "WOW"-Place, a Business-like Hotel. Not far from the Catedral, Barri Gotic, shopping, Rambla (don't eat there, only in the "Boqueria"), beach, Placa Catalunya. Although located perfect for sightseeing and "nightstrolling", absolutely quite! Rooms are clean and spacious. Over all a great ratio-performance. No need to book incl. breakfast. Go to any coffee-place or the "Boqueria" @ the Rambla!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Mian82
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night before our Mediterranean Cruise and really enjoyed this hotel. The location is excellent and the staff very friendly. Our room was spacious and clean and even had a small balcony towards the street. Breakfast was good with lots to choose from. Very affordable!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with the best breakfast ever”
Reviews.Author: HawkMD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH Sept. 2009 on a trip to Barcelona and Paris. The NH has a central location in the middle of the Old Town. It is tucked down a quiet street in a safe and well lit area. The rooms were adequate in size with well functioning air conditioners. The one thing that stands out about the NH in Barcelona was the incredible breakfast. When I first saw it I was floored. They had champagne, many made to order items (essentially whatever you wanted), pastries, 10 different types of fresh fruit, cold cuts, cheeses, breads, eggs, and all the water you wanted to drink. There was more than what I've listed. I would highly recommend the NH just for the breakfast alone. We have been to other NH properties and they are good but not as good as this one!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: MisterO
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in early May after completion of a Transatlantic Repositioning Cruise. Taxi from cruise port to hotel was easy (about 30 minutes) and cost about 30 Euros. However taxi left us on the Le Ramblas and said that they could not go down that side street. The hotel was only about 2 short blocks off the Le Ramblas and was easy to get to. Upon departure however we did order a taxi for the trip to the airport, and it came right to the door. When we arrived at the hotel, at about 10:30am, the room wasn't ready so we were able to store our luggage in a locked room and went to eat and begin sightseeing. Reception personnel were very helpful and courteous at all times. Breakfast was very good, and in fact when we checked out, we left before the restaurant opened, and so the front desk had arranged for a bag breakfast for us to take with us. A very kind gesture. Our room faced on a little central alcove, which therefore cut down on the city noise which can often detract from a good nights sleep. The bed was great and therefore we slept well, and truly enjoyed our stay there. The location of the hotel is perfect. Numerous restaurants in the immediate area. Walk down some of the sidestreets and check out the quaint little restaurants - there are some real gems there. We would highly recommend the NH Duc de la Victoria to anyone travelling to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, decent business style hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: oregongirl2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a tour group. A clean, efficient business style hotel with excellent location on a quiet street, just a couple blocks off La Rambla. Easy walk to all the big sites. Free 30 minutes per day of wifi in the lobby (hard to figure out with iPhone, but eventually it worked). Breakfast buffet was massive compared to others in Spain, and although I didn't pay for it, seemed a decent value. Rooms were on the small side but comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Ela_Rijeka
Reviews.Content: It is nice hotel with good service, but its best is the location. Just a little bit off La Rambla, couple of minutes walking distance from Plaza Catalunya -Barcelona's central square, you can have most of Barcelona at walking distance . Employees are very professional and helpful. Maybe one little minus - if you want to use your laptop in your room - you have to pay and cost too much.For a quick check hotel offers free of charge wireless only in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location, nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: vagaSanFrancisco_CA
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in quiet alley off of Las Ramblas. If taking Aerobus (which is inexpensive and convenient at 5 Euros per person), check map beforehand. Bus stops at Plaza Catalunya. From there, it's easier to enter via street parallel to Las Ramblas. About 3 short blocks. We'd just arrived from Paris staying at very efficient, but small Hotel Muguet. In comparison, the NH seemed large (more like a Marriott) with a fair sized lobby and very friendly, efficient staff. I was a little leary because I did not have a hotel confirmation to reflect my triple status. I had intially booked a double and called to upgrade to triple Since they do not have a triple category, they upgraded me to suite (with sofa pullout) for an extra 35 Euros a night. I was pleasantly surprised when they pulled up reservation which accurately reflected what I was told over the phone. My room was actually very large and included a sliding door separating the single sofabed and bedroom area. Room had 3 phones and was extremely clean and comfortable. Nice closet too. Hotel had restaurant but we did not eat there. We did order Pizza in which was easy. There are many dining selections near hotel. In terms of staff, they were great. Reception was friendly and efficient. Staff was accomodating and reacted quickly to opening safe when hubby forgot PIN; maid staff was attentive to cleaning our room despite the fact that we accidentally left 'do not disturb' sign. About 5 minutes after walking in and removing the doorsign, we received call asking if we wanted maid service! Nice toiletries which were refilled everyday. They even give you sanitizer! In terms of location, it is near Las Ramblas. I do not care for that particular street other than to visit La Boquetaria market. However, you can exit through the other main street and head out to Passeig de Gracia for a different type of ambiance (less cheesy). Shops galore all around this area. I'd recommend eateries off the side streets versus Las Ramblas. These alleyways are lined with great coffee shops, tapas, and shops, shops and more shops. In terms of sites, make sure you buy tix to Music Hall in advance. This is a fantastic piece of architecture nestled in the alleyways of Barcelona. Tickets for tours were sold out for 7 days and I was crushed I could not get in. The Hop On/Hop Off Bus great if your feet are weary from having walked Paris. Also visting the Gaudi designed homes is a must for folks who appreciate novelty and architecture. Did I mention shopping? Check out Pont & Roma for quality clothing at decent prices. I'd definitely recommend this NH property and would stay here when returning to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in prime location”
Reviews.Author: babbington
Reviews.Content: The rooms fall on the small side, but they're clean, comfortable and quiet. The euro-mod business decor is sparse but still warm and pleasant. The folks at the front desk speak good English (and what sounded like pretty good French and German). I heard no noise whatever from outside, despite staying in a room that faced streetward. I heard a door close once or twice, but never while I was trying to sleep. As for the beds, they were good but not spectacular. This isn't one of those hotels where the bed is considerably nicer than what anyone has at home, but they're not uncomfortable either. Bathroom: Spectacular water pressure.

Reviews.Title: “great little place”
Reviews.Author: kaiandjacksmom
Reviews.Content: I loved this little place, we were given a corner unit above the lobby, with windows closed, it was silent and because the street in front is mostly pedestrian if was rather quiet with windows open. the 30 minutes free internet are to be used all at once, so a little annoying... but all in all, loved the location...i would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: SKDLondon
Reviews.Content: The NH Duc de La Victoria is a no frills business hotel - its great selling point is the location between Las Ramblas and the Cathedral in the Barri Gotic - but it is on a small pedestrianised side street making it pretty quiet. We had a standard double room on 4th floor - room was comfortable - and large enough with a good bathroom and well-cleaned each day. We overlooked the light well so no view (but there wouldn't really be one from the front either) but that meant we got a good night's sleep. The hotel has a restaurant but no bar - with so many places to choose from outside we never ate in the hotel - I think the breakfast was fairly expensive - there is a local cafe just down the street (though be warned it does permit smoking cafe). Free wi-fi was available in the lobby though not the rooms. If you are planning to spend your days exploring Barcelona but want somewhere comfortable for a good night's sleep this hotel is a more than reasonable choice. We found we could walk almost everywhere from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lal42105
Reviews.Content: We stayed her on our trip to Spain last week. We took a cab there from the airport , but after learning how close it was to the Aerobus stop I wished we saved our money. We choose this hotel because we wanted to be close to La Rambla without all the noise. The location was perfect. We were easily able to walk to Bario Gothic, La Rambla and the shopping district. We even were able to walk to La Segrada Familia it was a bit longer but a nice walk. When we arrived to the hotel we were a bit jet lagged. However, we were able to sleep without disruption during the day. We headed back toward Barcelona before we left Spain and decided to book this hotel again as we were so happy with the location. The only thing that was a negative was that there was not a free WiFi in the hotel. They gave you a free 1/2 hour for the stay but that was it. They had a computer in the lobby but we would of had to pay if we wanted to use the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, great location”
Reviews.Author: worldwanderlust
Reviews.Content: We had our 3 year old with us and a cot was provided for free. Clean, good service, quiet, nice rooms, EXCELLENT location! You could walk everywhere. We will stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Rooms, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ExpatVol
Reviews.Content: You can't miss with the NH hotels in Barcelona... The NH Calederon is nice too!!! My only negative would be the front desk sent us to an awful resturant... La Gavina near the water... Ugh!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: typhoonsurf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a colleague for a major tradeshow and had some real mixed feelings about this place: Negatives - - do not get a room here to share with a work colleague unless you want to basically be crashing into them everywhere you walk - what is up with the heat, even turned all the way down it puts you in the sahara, you have to open the windows and then get to listen to street noise Positives - - all staff are extremely nice especially front desk and security - clean room, house keeping do a great job - location is great right near las ramblas and the catalunya metro stop - decent breakfast buffet All in all, if traveling for work ALONE here, I would stay again. Just not again with 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, stones throw from Las Ramblas!!”
Reviews.Author: corcaigh2010
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay in the NH Duc de la Victoria. Location was superb, we walked everywhere, only 2 min walk from las ramblas. Rooms were comfy and served their purrpose. Breakfast, one of the best i've had, great start to the day. Quite noisy at night though, as passers by walking past the hotel until the early hours so ear plugs needed!! otherwise a very enjoyable stay at this hotel, staff very pleasant, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and value”
Reviews.Author: AuldCom
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel in a very quiet small street, minutes away by foot from Ramblas, Plaza Catalunya, shopping area and Old Town. Our room was quite small but nice and clean. We would definitely stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the Tripadvisor ratings.”
Reviews.Author: GeeNorthumberlandUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with two friends for 3 nights, a classic weekend break. Ideal location 150 metres or so from Las Ramblas 200 or 300 metres from Cataluyna Square. Quiet side street location, do not be put off by the Google street cam pictures. Clean and welcoming, rooms were one up from the basic, spacious, bathroom a little larger than the basic and very good. Loads of piping hot water and a bath that you can actually get into. Breakfast was a little sneaky, not very clear when you book whether or not it was included, it was not and was quite pricey @15 euros, but having said that choice was huge and pretty good quality. Don't book your airport taxi to pick you up at the hotel, we spent a good 15 minutes in our Taxi following the rubbish collection wagon down the narrow streets. Walk up to Cataluyna Square instead.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - pretty good hotel, well located.”
Reviews.Author: FaithsGrandma
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night city break in Barcelona. This hotel was well located in a quiet street just off la ramblas. We booked British Airways flights and hotel deal combined with Lastminute.com and overall we were pleased with the deal. We only had a standard room, and although quiet small, was clean and adequate with a good sized double bed. The bathroom was perfectly serviceable, although as you stepped out of the bath, there was a pillar stuck in the way, directly in front of the loo, which made it a bit awkward. We had a mini bar in our room, which we didn't use. The restaurant was only open Mon-Fri, which we were not told about at check in. We ate breakfast at a couple of local cafe's - I would recommend choosing a busy bustling cafe that the locals use - you'll get better service and food. We tried one of the restaurants towards the end of la ramblas that did a deal of 3 tapas, paella and sangria for ten euros - you get what you pay for! The food was ok and the sangria watered down but it was our first evening there and we were hungry! We also tried a pizza place on la ramblas - again fine - nothing special. Our most fun evening was dinner in Hard Rock Cafe - not very barcelonian - but at least you know what you're getting in there and it was a good atmosphere with friendly staff. We used the bus to Parc Guell and the metro quite a lot. We went to Camp Nou for a football match - a great experience - even I enjoyed it and I don't like football! We got the metro to Monjuic and after asking directions in the cable car place, we walked ten minutes along the road for the other cable car along the port only to find it closed for the winter! So that was a bit disappointing. We did the usual Gaudi attractions, the unfinished cathedral - which we thought was expensive 11 euros to get in plus another 2.50 if you wanted to take the lift up to the top of the spire - we didn't as there was a 90 minute queue. The Pedrera was probably my favourite gaudi building - that cost about 10 euro each but there was an extra exhibition which made it a bit better value. We also ate in an all you eat buffet, which wasn't very nice and wouldn't recommend. A good cup of tea was hard to come by, coffee is more popular but its very strong. We tried the hot chocolate - nice but very rich. We used the aerobus for airport transfers at 5 euros each, each way and we also brought a T10 travel card from the machines in the underground station which were about 7.70 euro for 10 journeys and you can share it. We also went to the magic fountains - this was good - with stunning views across the city at night. Unfortunately, it was quite cold and showery when we were there - we had a good time - but I think it would be a better place to visit in warmer months. Would recommend the hotel as its perfect for access to the entire city, close to all sorts of eating places and shops. The bouqueria market was good to look round. Barcelona was good to visit once, but I wouldn't go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great position”
Reviews.Author: SmartMoney
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good standard (as you would expect from the nh chain) and in a great position close to La Rambla and on the edge of the Gothic quarter close to restaurants and bars. We stayed in a 'Superior' room (No. 319) which was spacious, quiet and comfortable. We ate at a number of good restaurants locally, notably (on recommendation from the front desk) Els Quatre Gats which we loved (good food, service ambiance and history). The only thing to watch out for is the cost of the hotel breakfast buffet at 30 euros - try and get a bed and breakfast deal!

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: zohar2111
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell: The hotel is perfectly located in a small steet in the gothic quarter, 50m from La Rambla and a 100m from placa Catalunya, very close to the old Cathedral and shopping areas. The rooms were fine. not very big, but clean. Be sure to book rooms that are wathcing the street and not the inner court, which is not very nice. The staff was very freindly and helpful, and breakfasts are superb, much more than tou could usually expect in a 3 star hotel. All in all - highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Malaklaze
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, friendly staff pointed me to extraordinary restaurants. Only bad thing is that I left the hotel in a rush and didn't notice they'd charged an inexistent mini-bar consumption.

Reviews.Title: “Frankly, it was embarrassing”
Reviews.Author: LondonLozzza
Reviews.Content: I don't know how this place can call itself a business hotel just because it had an internet connection. There's no trouser press in the room and there is no iron available. Well actually there is but there's no ironing board you have to, and I quote 'lay a towel on the floor'. Other sentences in this conversation included, 'You have to come down and collect it yourself' and 'Well you either want it or you don't.' Nice service. There're no tea or coffee making facilities in the room and they don't do room service for this sort of thing but helpfully you can order a selection of Pizzas from their restaurant. So picture the scene, you arrive for a business meeting, you have a couple of hours before it starts and you want to give your shirt a quick press and grab a quick cup of coffee. No worries you're staying in a 'business hotel' after all... I wasn't actually here on business, I was here for pleasure but nevertheless I still wanted to go out relatively uncreased and I still wanted a coffee or tea in the morning (and not between the hours of 5am and 7am when it was free in reception) I actually felt embarrassed for the staff who either didn't care or were far too dim to realise the basic needs any traveller - business or otherwise. It is a great location but it's not cheap and to be honest you could pay less, get more and still only be 10 minutes away from the Ramblers. I think this is a classic case of a small inexperienced chain trying to rub shoulders with the big boys and only grazing the crotch. Laughable.

Reviews.Title: “Book now”
Reviews.Author: Tocklocks
Reviews.Content: Quiet street off La Ramblas near Bari Gothic, just round corner from Cathedral so central for everything - including aerobus & bus tours. Not a better location in our view! Room was modern and clean with balcony. Breakfast was great - buffet style with lots of choice. Plus could order additional items such as poached eggs. Staff friendly, efficient and helpful. Perfect stay - would definitely recommend! Recommend going to match at Neu Camp if you can !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Price, Value”
Reviews.Author: NewportDino74
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 129, one room away from elevator, back side of Hotel, ultra quiet. Our first visit to Barcelona, wonderful city. You can go anowhere from the Catalunya Plaza, 3 short blocks from hotel. We stayed 11 nights, split by 3 days; day one Carccassonne, day 2 in Cadaques and day 3 in a b&b 57euros! in Pubol. Great to get back and hang out in the Bari-Gothic and have dinner at 4 Cats. You will find easy walks to many activities, watch your purse and wallet!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: tennisbird
Reviews.Content: Every night the air conditioning automatically got turned off at 2 AM. My travel alarm clock has a thermometer built in, and the temperature in the room rose to 76 degrees by early morning. We tried opening the window, but it did not help. When you are a woman in your 50's, you are hot all the time as it is. Needless to say, I did not sleep for the four consecutive nights we were there. When I tried to mention the problem to the front desk, they said, "this is normal." They never admitted that it got turned off every night. The first room we were in was tiny. It had a very long, useless corridor, that led to a very small bedroom. The corridor was totally useless space. The bathroom had a hand-held shower, but no kind of door or partial glass. Each day we got a sliver of soap approximately 1" square. After two nights, we asked for a different room, with two windows, hoping that we would be able to get more fresh air at night. We were readily moved to a larger room (without the long corridor) but when we opened the windows at night, there were significant noises in the street outside that kept us awake anyway. Other than that, the hotel was fine. But it is hard to enjoy a vacation when you start out jet lagged and can't sleep every night.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: ec205
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights prior to cruise. After much research on TA, decided to stay at this hotel mainly for location and value (found online deal with breakfast for 91E/nt). Hotel is located on a quiet side street off La Rambla. Requested a high floor and ended up with 2 of the 3 rooms with balconies on the 6th floor. Staff very helpful. Rooms were modern, small (some larger than others depending on where in the building which is U shaped) but adequate. Very convenient to walk to Place de Catalunya for HOHO bus or metro. Buffet breakfast included hot and cold selections, but did not justify the 20E price tag (i think as breakfast was included and did not look @ the price) Would highly recommend and DEFINITELY stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a first-time visit”
Reviews.Author: audubon461
Reviews.Content: Lovely small hotel, beautifully located in a pedestrian zone a short walk from La Rambla. We were able to walk or take the Metro all over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: JAM9929
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of the excellent reviews and it lived up to its excellent rating. The hotel is situated 2 minutes walk from La Rambla so basically the main street is just around the corner. However, the hotel location is very quiet at night. We found the room to be very clean, modern and comfortable - exactly what we hoped for. The staff were very friendly and keen to assist with any enquiries we had. We found a great cocktail bar just up the street called Patagonia, small bar, friendly staff and reasonably priced drinks and food. Loved the Mojitas! This is one of the best hotels I've stayed in, in terms of being excellent value, comfortable, spotlessly clean, centrally located and yet quiet. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “great location but”
Reviews.Author: paultheman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in September. The location is fantastic being in the Gothic quarter and right off the Ramblas. But the room was a pretty tight-average size and very little bureau space for clothes. I would classify the hotel as being a business hotel in character. Not much in ambiance. The staff were very good and helpful. For location, you cannot beat this place but for comfort-average.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could live in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mokate17
Reviews.Content: While we expected this hotel to just be a quick stop before boarding a cruise, we wish we had booked more days there! This hotel deserves a much higher rating on here (especially since we also stayed at one of the top hotels ranked on here and it paled in comparison to the Duc). We arrived early and we able to check in by 11am. We received a corner room (request this!) which had two French doors opening to small balconies. The hotel is down a small side street, really with no traffic, so we were able to open the french doors, let the quiet breeze roll in, and take a siesta! Bed was comfortable, bathroom was clean and modern, and we even received room service of fruit and water, at no charge and to our surprise, soon after we arrived. When we later stayed at another hotel we seriously considered checking out to come back to Duc de la Victoria we loved it so much.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay in only THIS HOTEL when visiting Barcelona in the future”
Reviews.Author: duncanatupton
Reviews.Content: Main feature is the friendly and helpful staff.. also great location, room while not overly large was very clean, nice wooden floor and couple of nice touches, with brandy being delivered to room complimentry. Also on leaving we left something in safe, they sent it by taxi to the port withing 20mins great honest service.

Reviews.Title: “YOU HAVE TO STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: Nichole315
Reviews.Content: OMG I traveled all around Europe for 3 weeks and this was by far my favorite hotel. It really should be a four star hotel. You could not ask for a better location. It is right in the middle of everything, but also on a quiet street. If you are traveling to Barcelona, you have to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, close to everywhere, and cheep”
Reviews.Author: solanna
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, close to the centre, walking distance from Las Ramblas, the Cathedral, Born area where all the nice restarands are, bvut also in a quiet street, very safe and clean, the staff very helpfull , small but cute rooms and in general an esxellent choice for a short visit in Barcellona!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central location in Barcelona. Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: ExPatriate2009
Reviews.Content: I chose the Victoria based off of previous reviews here on Trip Advisor. I thought I would return the favor and leave a few comments myself after having stayed here. The hotel is perfectly located right around the corner from Plaza de Catalunya. I stayed in Barcelona for 5 days and I didn't use a taxi once (besides getting to and from the airport of course). I prefer walking the city, it is by far the best way to take in the atmosphere and the culture, as opposed to taking the taxi/bus from one tourist attraction to the next. I even walked to Parc Guell on the other side of the city, and it was only about 30-45 minutes. The staff at the front desk were great. Very helpful. They answered all of my questions perfectly and politely. The room was very simple, but very clean and neat. All of your basic amenities are there: decent bed, television with several international stations, bathroom with shower/tub. No frills, but all the basic necessities. If you're like me, the room is just a place to sleep, and that's it. And if that's all you need it for, it's perfect. There's staff at the front desk around the clock. So even if you come into the hotel in the middle of the night (after enjoying the wonderful Barcelona nightlife) there is someone there to let you in. All and all, it was a great stay. I would definitely stay here again if I visit Barcelona again, and I would certainly recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: ellep
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the NH Duc de la Victoria for 4 nights and we were very pleased with the hotel throughout our stay. The one downside was that we requested a single king-size bed but we were given two single beds pushed together instead. Our room was very spacious and clean however. Since the hotel is located on a side street off La Rambla, it is very quiet at night. We felt very safe walking back to the hotel at night and it is super close to La Rambla, which was great. We even walked down to the beach areas, which took about 25 mins. It was really easy to get to the hotel from the airport, we took the Aerobus (4.5 euro) to Placa Catalunya and the hotel is about a 10 minute walk from there.

Reviews.Title: “Location ,location...”
Reviews.Author: Alianaii
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a good holiday in august 09 barcelona .Location of hotel is excellent .very central and access to rambla (most famous street of barcelona) , only 3 minutes.Rooms are cleaned every day normally .Sheets are not changed every day but they are ok .We did not have breakfast in hotel ,it is a little bit expensuive compared to the other nearby places .you can have breakfast in nearby cafe for 5 or 6 euro maybe less.Don't forget to use touristic bus to see barcelona.It is easiest way to see all part of barcelona.Buy 2 days ticket ,it is better way ( 1 day: 21 euro , 2 days : 27 euro).Barcelona has several shopping area but don't spend much time for it .Nice beach,try it .In August ,it is hot .For coming from air port to this hotel ,Use aerobus.Chippest and easiest way to come.You 'll be in pl catalona square and from there ,It takes about 5 minutes walking to go to hotel /ticket price is :4.25 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: KazMeath
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in July. We arrived at the hotel at about 11am and we where able to check in no problems. Our room was spacious with air-conditioning. The location of the hotel is great, it is situated on a side street off the main La Rambla. The bus service from the airport is a great service, we ended up using the metro to get to the hotel but on our way home we got the air bus, it goes from outside El Corte Ingles at Catalunya sq. I had read several reviews of this hotel on Trip Advisor and choose it based on excellent reviews. The Breakfast at the hotel is also excellent and well worth getting up for and it runs till 11am at the weekend, which is an added bonus. Enjoy your stay at this hotel, you will not be disappointed. On Barcelona itself it is a fab city but you do need to be careful of pick pockets and also other unsavoury characters, although this would not put me off visiting the city again. The best meal for value for money was The Hard Rock Cafe at Catalyuna Sq. Some places along the La Rambla are overpriced and not great value for money. Down by the Harbour there is some restaurants and there is an all you can eat place, called Al Fresco I think which is good. The Bus tour is also great and I would recommend that. It is hop on and off and again you can catch it & buy your tickets at Catalunya Sq.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good service.”
Reviews.Author: roblod6513
Reviews.Content: I just recently spent five nights in this hotel and i loved it and will stay here again. As has been stated before the location is excellent, the hotel is right off the Ramblas, close to the Playa Catalunya, and adjacent to the barri gotic on a small side street. There is a little super market right down from the hotel on a intersecting street that came in handy time and again. The hotel is nice and the rooms have really comfortable beds. The Breakfast buffet is good and will get you going to start your day.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely oasis in old town”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveler_9
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Barcelona and first stay in an NH hotel. Trip Advisor has become my preferred guide to selecting a hotel in a new (to me) city and this one did not disappoint. The hotel facade and lobby was a cool oasis of dark wood, green marble and friendly faces. Lobby furniture was a little worn but comfy and well used by the assemblies of tourist lounging there. Our tidy room had two single beds when we requested a double bed. Next morning, the switch was made with no fuss. Considering how packed the pedestrian streets were in the neighborhood, it was an amazingly quiet hotel. Lovely little toiletries in the bathroom, a nearly empty dining room we tried to dine in one night, but overall, a very good intro to Barcelona. Location was superb, walk everywhere and easy to get to and from the airport bus stop. Steps away from the cathedral plaza and Sardane folk dancing Saturday and Sunday was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great retreat at the end of the day!”
Reviews.Author: thelatraveler
Reviews.Content: Great location - just off Las Ramblas, close to the Metro (we arrived by Metro to the hotel b/c the taxi would not bring us to the hotel from the train station) Friendly staff - helped us locate different places in the city and allowed us to push back our check-out time Rooms - Very nice, clean, hairdyer, nice decor, slept 3 comfortably but not very spacious (which was expected and ok b/c we were not in the room very much) Cons - they would not allow us to cancel 1 night when we could not get a train to Barcelona. They said if we would have booked through the hotel directly and not the hotel's website, we could have cancelled it. Also, there was some noise in the room but nothing out of the unusual for a hotel. Just won't get to sleep in if that is what you desire. No free internet. You would think in a nice hotel like this one, it would be included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “a descent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kg26
Reviews.Content: a ok hotel in a very good location right in the city center. is a clean and safe hotel. rooms are a bit outdated and contained a very old TV. hotel is expensive for the quality of its rooms but is very central. the service was fine. walls are very thin so could sometimes hear talking outside. overall no real problems with the hotel but nothing too great about it either.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and central -an ideal city hotel”
Reviews.Author: devoncat7
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for 3 day stay in July based on Trip Advisor reveiws. Wanted central location, air con because it was July and quiet at night. This hotel delivered all 3 and more for a very reasonable Euro110 per night per room. Location is 2 minutes walk from La Rambla and on pedestrian street so no traffic noise. Rooms small but very clean and all mod cons. Good Grohe shower over bath and air con coped well with 30C plus temps. Our room had small balcony with opening doors onto front entrance. Beds were firm but comfortable. Breakfast room is small, cheerful and ok buffet but lots of cafes within walking distance for great coffee and pastries. Also a Starbucks if you are with Americans! We caught Aerobus from airport to Catalunya Plaza and hotel was 10 minute walk with wheely luggage. A breeze. One desktop in hotel lobby and you get 15 minutes per day per room free. Reception staff speak very good English and are helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: agnostmanila
Reviews.Content: Form what I have seen so far, NH Hotels are simple. No bellboys to tae your luggage for you. But the room that I stayed in in this NH Hotel was spacious and clean. The location is fabulous at it is in the heart of the shopping area. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Babydeey
Reviews.Content: We went there in our honeymoon and we had a pleasant stay. The room was clean, the bathroom so big and the breakfast wonderful. The hotel is very good located, near Placa Catalunya and 10 min away from the Port.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but there are problems with certain rooms”
Reviews.Author: garry_to
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall is not bad. It depends what room they give you in the hotel. It looks like some rooms have not been cleaned properly. Good things about hotel: - very good location (close to Ramblas, metro stations) - the hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful. They are always there to assist you. - safe box is available in the room Bad things about hotel: - one room i have stayed had so many flies in the room. it was horrible experience. However, another room i have stayed was better. - the air conditioner/ventilation system of the room looked quite dirty - the sheets in the room were not changed during the stay (although it looks like they were changed before check in/after check out) - sometimes an extra soap was not provided to a second guest - the internet is not free. You get only 15 mins of free internet. A lot of hotels provide free wifi or free cable internet to guests, but this hotel does not. - some items in certain rooms looked quite old and dirty, e.g. bottle opener

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel with fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Elion
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel located very close to Rambla and Pl. Catalunya. 5 mins walk to the airport-express-bus. Location is ideal for those who want to stay in the middle of everything that Barcelona has to offer. Very quiet at night, no cars allowed to drive in the neighbourhood. Very friendly and pleasant service in the reception Guard 24 hours. This will definitely be the hotel for our next stay in lovely Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the NH Duc de la Victoria”
Reviews.Author: NYCRuth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel when we arrived in Barcelona before embarking on a hiking trip to the COsta Brava . We were so impressed by the location, staff, cleanliness and quiet of the room, that we cancelled a reservation at one of the top luxury hotels (for our days following the hiking trip) to book the same room we had our first night We were so glad to come back to this Hotel - it is an ideal location, close to all of the action, but wonderfully quiet at night and in the AM - we did have a balcony on the fifth floor that opened onto a quiet back street - we did not have breakfast but chose to get coffee and eats on the street. We loved the insane energy of Barcelon - the Gaudi buildings are not to be missed; we enjoyed the Picasso Museum and even walked to the Park Gruell one morning to see Gaudi's whimsical touches. Barcelona has great architecture, food, wine and people watching . We did go for a evening drink at the Hotel we had cancelled - nice rooftop lounge but we were so pleased to have saved almost $250 by deciding to return to our original Hotel - excellent choice

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jock19
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights having read the other reviews on the site. The location is really good for the Gothic Quarter. The old Catedral is only a few minutes walk away as is the Plcac De Sant Jaume. Between here and Placa de Santa Maria del Mar are a warren of little streets with great tapas, reataurants and bars. It's really worth spending some time in the latter just soaking in the atmosphere on a Saturday afternoon. The hotel is also about 5 minutes from Placa de Catalunya where the airport bus drops off and picks up and where the sightseeing buses start, has a tube train station and where the main tourist office is. The Ramblas is only 5 minutes in the other direction but you wouldn't know it. The hotel itself is on a really quiet side street so there was no noise at night but unlike some posts it never felt intimidatingly so. Things really didn't get noisy in the morning either. There is also a little general store on Carrer de la Carruda around the corner where you can pick up drinks, snacks etc, which is a bit cheaper than the mini bar. We were on the first floor in a superior room which had a balcony. This was really just a big ledge but it was nice to be able to stand out and watch the world go by. The room itself was spacious clean and cool. Staff were friendly and helpful as well. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel and just found some local bakeries for something to eat in the morning. There was plenty of choice and I'm sure it was a lot cheaper! This is a little gem of a hotel, a very quiet location but very well located. We'd definietly considr staying there again. One tip about the sightseeing buses. We'd recommed the red route as that covers most of the main sites and people do get on and off a lot so if you "hop off" you can get back on. We did the blue route which wasn't as interesting and was less frequent. As a result not many people got off the bus and at most stops there were big queues that just couldn't get back on the bus and were waiting a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Early Checkin; cool location”
Reviews.Author: JBT
Reviews.Content: I used Trip Advisor to select this hotel and it paid off. If you have an overnight flight into Barcelona and want to get into your room early, this hotel is the best choice in Barcelona. We got into our room at 11:30am. We used this hotel prior to a cruise. Two days are recommended to stay in town before the cruise to see Barcelona. One issue is luggage. But get the right cab at the airport and it will take you to the front door. The hotel is on a blocked street with no traffic. A cab will take you from the front door to the pier. The room was quiet and small. The location is great in the Gothic quarter with attractions walkable and the main tourist street "La Rambla" a quick walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: maggiemay2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 15th till 19th June. Great location, close to La Rambla but still very quiet at night. Found hotel very easily after getting off aerobus in Plaza Cataluyna. Just take first left off La Rambla onto Calle del la Canuda, then left again and hotel is right there. Hotel room good size and clean. Breakfast wasn't included in price, which at 129 euros a night was not really great value but worth it for location. Breakfast can be bought locally for a few euros and you can get lovely fruit from La Boqueria market on La Rambla. Recommend bus tours as they take you to all the tourist sites - Parc Guell, Montjuic, Port Vell, Mount Tibidabo, La Sagradia Familia etc.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Duc.”
Reviews.Author: FredLynda
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, together with seven other people, stayed at the Duc prior to a cruise. We had a room on the second foor, with a small balcony, overlooking Carrer del Duc. The room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel is in a pedestrian area but our mini bus driver was able to drive us right to the door. The barriers preventing vehicles entering the are are obviously controlled from a central and the driver used an intercom at the entrance to the area to have them lowered, which was an interesting feature I hadn't come across before. The hotel's location in the Gothic area is very handy. Lots of sights within easy walking distance, and the metro and bus stops at Placa Catalunya are only a five minute walk away. We paid 85 euros (plus 11.60 euros tax) per night. As this included an excellent breakfast I found this to be an excellent rate. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden location in Gothic Quarter”
Reviews.Author: megmar
Reviews.Content: This hotel was hard to find and even the cab driver was not sure about it. He dropped us off on La Ramblis and we got lost looking for it in the spiderweb of Gothic streets. So get your directions down before venturing here. It was fine for the two nights we stayed here prior to our cruise. No view but the location is perfect for exploring the gothic area and strolling to all the cafes and Cathedrals. The complimentary internet in the lobby was a huge plus for us to check emails and communicate with family since we had no international phone. No complimentary breakfast but they do have a restaurant. We opted for a cafe instead. Overall just fine for a couple nights, but not more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Katarina06
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel at the end of May - it was in a great location just off Las Ramblas but in quiet street with no noise at night. It is a 5 min stroll from Placa Catalunya where the airport bus runs to and from. Would definitely recommend this hotel for any visit to Barcelona - also if you want a good but reasonably price meal it is worth queuing at Les Quinze Nits (in Placa Reial) - food is fab and prices even better! P.S I loved Barcelona - food, weather, people were all lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: DougProvidence
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Barcelona for our 25th anniversary with some very close old friends, and we all loved the Duc de la Victoria. Fabulous location in the Gothic Quarter, and actually very close to La Rambla, but extremely quiet. Tasteful decor, all modern conveniences, and a friendly, efficient staff. Our rate was 116 euros without breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for me”
Reviews.Author: Patti417
Reviews.Content: Just got back today and I loved the NH Duc. I was able to check in at 9 am which was great after an overnight flight. As expected, being a single traveler, the first room I was given was small with no view. Since I was staying for 7 nights, I asked for something a little nicer, expecting some attitude, but I was very pleasantly given a corner room with a terrace, floor to ceiling window and a view. I'm pretty independent so I didn't have much interaction with the desk people but when I did they were fine. I wasn't looking for best friends. The maids always had a smile and a greeting and the room was always made up promptly. I thought the location was perfect. I don't think I would have preferred to be anywhere else. This is not a super luxury hotel but nowhere near a budget. Great pillows, comfortable bed, a good size...I had relatives staying at the MonteCarlo and I was not jealous. By the way, breakfast can be had anywhere in the neighborhood within minutes for 3.25 euros I don't know what accommodations previous posters are used to but it seems as though they are searching for something not to like.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel, very well located and very quiet”
Reviews.Author: carinaBucharest
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from 12th until 17th of May 2009 and it was a very pleasant experience. The hotel is indeed very quiet, clean and extremely well located. It is only a few minutes away from Las Ramblas, the famous street of the old city. I recomend this hotel to everyone who wants to enjoy Barcelona as it really is: a city full of life, colourfull, but staying in a quiet place, which allows you a good night sleep :) The prices are a little too high, for a hotel only 3 stars, but the location is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Not great...just average.”
Reviews.Author: Telodigoluego
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location, steps away from the Cathedral of Barcelona in the historic center of this wonderful spaniard city. My wife and I stayed in a junior suite, hence it was a very spacious room with a nice bathroom. The room furniture, carpet and curtains needed some remodeling. The TV programming was ridiculous to say the least. Breakfast is good, in fact very good, but at 16 euros per person is way too expensive. There are some places where you can eat breakfast, lunch or dinner very close to the hotel, and for less. Check in and check out are done without hastle. The street of this hotel will give a bad impression, specially at night; it looks somber and dirty; but there is nothing to worry about. We didn't have any trouble walking around the area at any time, even very late at night. Something got my attention: This hotel doesn't seem to have a soul. It feels that it doesn't have a life of its own. Everyone is walking around like a robot, and service is rendered in a automat way. It gives you a weird impression to see that there is no warmth in the service...it is almost like the personnel was trained to follow the process mechanically, period. Not to excel, no extra mile, not a clear smile (just a smirk). They do have wireless internet, but you have to pay for it at a rate of 5.8 euros an hour or more than 17 euros a day (both expires within 24 hours period). I found this outrageous. There is nothing really good about this hotel, specially for the price you pay (just the location, but then there are plenty of hotels around the area). I don't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but not so special and extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: paccacuregge
Reviews.Content: the hotel is good but i didn't understand all the amazing comments and the excellent reviews , it's a clean hotel with a nice staff with a good location, nothing extraordinary and a little pricey if you try you can find others hotels with a better value for money

Reviews.Title: “A++++”
Reviews.Author: masss11
Reviews.Content: A stunning hotel in the most perfect location on the La Rambla street. Stayed there for 8 nights while attending the Formula 1 race and a subsequent FC Barcelona game at Nou Camp. The hotel was in a quiet street just one block off the Rambla, ultra clean, ultra cozy and had everything i was looking for in a hotel. The internet is not free at the room, but you can use it for free in the reception lounge. Breakfast was for 15 Euros but i always ended up eating at the fabulous Bouqueria market which is just 1 minute away. Hotel staff were very helpful especially Laura, and they all spoke perfect english and some german. If i go back to Barcelona, i will stay there again. Highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “well placed excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsJLancashire
Reviews.Content: My mum and I spent 3 nights at this hotel which we chose because of the good reviews. We found it was in an excellent location for the main sights and metro, it was on a very peaceful and quiet street in the gothic quarter. The room was a good size with a nice bathroom and all we needed. We booked through Travel Republic and got a bed and breakfast deal so we enjoyed the superb buffet breakfast which is served from 7am - 11am every day. We would recommmend the Cafe de l'Opera on La Rambla for superb hot chocolate and cakes and the 4 Gats restaurant , at Montsio 3 for wonderful atmosphere and food.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: paul1962Belfast
Reviews.Content: dont look any further. just back from 3 night stay in barcelona. this hotel cannot be beaten for location and vfm. a short stroll to plaza de catalunya so easy to get to from the airport (aerobus at 4.25 euro). clean fresh good sized rooms with mini bar and modern bathroom. we did not eat there but the breakfast and dinner looked good but we dont usually eat in the hotel. although check in was 3pm, we arrived at 11 am and the manager cheerily let us have a room!!. we would recommed this hotel for anyone planning a short break to barcelona... cannot find any faults with it

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: BelfastJules
Reviews.Content: Mu husband and I have just returned from a 5 day trip to Barcelona staying at this hotel. We would highly recommend it to others. It is very close to Las Ramblas, Placa Catalunya the Cathedral, shops and many other attractions. It is very quiet at night even though it is so close to all the action! The breakfast in the hotel is very good with lots to choose from, hot & cold and as much as you want for 16 Eur each. The rooms are very clean not overly large but big enough for 2 people, with a mini fridge and a spacious clean bathroom with shower. There is a safe in the wardrobe (which you are not charged for the use of) and the bed is comfortable. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The only downside is that there is no bar as such to have a drink in at night especially at the weekend - maybe this is not the case in high season, but there are plently of other tapas bars in the area. All in all I would recommend this hotel, it is not overly expensive and the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel in the heart of bustling Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Jackbear
Reviews.Content: You could not ask for a better location for your stay in Barcelona. The NH Duc de la Victoria is just a few minutes walk to Las Ramblas, the Barcelona Cathedral, museums, shopping, nightlife and so much more. It was a rare luxury to stay in a hotel that was so well located that I could return to the hotel easily anytime I wished. It is near several metro stations making it an all around great choice. The room was modern and luxurious. It had a small refigerator and mini bar but no coffee/tea making option. I listed this hotel as a good value because I got a fantastic price using Priceline's Name Your Own Price option. It was an incredible treat to get a room in such an luxurious hotel at the price I chose. The normal nightly rate would have been beyond my budget so I was particularly happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 2muchfun4us
Reviews.Content: After much research decided on this hotel and really enjoyed staying there. The location is very convenient and the rooms and staff are great. Only negative NH charges $15 for breakfast. That seems to be in all NH hotels. However there is coffee set up in room and many nice pastry shops around corner. I would stay here again any time because of great location. The hotel is in a walking zone and therefore very quiet but close to cathedral and other attractions like The Ramblas. Computer access is free for 15 min. at a time and right in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in daytime but not at night!”
Reviews.Author: neuville
Reviews.Content: Hi just returned from this hotel,great amenities very clean room a little small but no noise from outside. Bad point,only 150mtrs from las ramblas which was great through the day as there were lots of people around, but at night it is a little scary as you have to walk where it is quite dark to get to the hotel. Best to get back around 10 to 10.30pm.Would not want to go to Barcelona again been there done that.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: TeerthaG
Reviews.Content: After staying for four nights during middle of March 2009, I have a mixed feeling for this hotel. On the positive side: The hotel has a very good location. Near to Placa Catalunya and Ramblas. A lot of major attractions are within walking distance. All types of transportation are easily available. Though inside Barri Gotic, the area near to the hotel felt safe. Being in such a position everything is easily available near to the hotel. Lot of restaurants nearby and a big branch of El Corte Ingles is three minutes walk away. Also there is a small supermarket very near to the hotel but it stays close on Sundays. Staff behaviour and attitude were very helpful and friendly. Most of them spoke good English and even when some of them did not they remained very cooperative. Breakfast quality and variety was really nice. One of the best we enjoyed during our Spain tour of twenty days. Room size was good though not very big. Even after putting in an extra bed for my son we had room to move around. Quality of bed was also good. On the not so positive side: We were given a 1st floor room when we checked in. We found a cockroach after entering the room. After a long flight we did not want to make an issue out of it and got rid of it on our own. But on the second day after coming back to the room in the evening we found another big one moving around. Upon complaining to the reception people they promptly shifted us to a fifth floor room, where we did not have any problem for the rest of our stay. My suggestion is if you are staying in this hotel avoid the 1st floor as the hotel has its breakfast room on the same floor, which may have caused our problem. Lack of room service, particularly during the weekend caused us some problems but as there are lot of options nearby it should not be a problem until and unless you are very tired and do not want to leave the room. We would have also appreciated a little higher level of cleanliness. The hotel was not dirty in any sense but can do better with a little bit of effort.

Reviews.Title: “A return stay”
Reviews.Author: dunnoh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 18 months ago. Nothing to add to that review (generally excellent) apart from that we stayed in a Superior room. Well worth the extra couple of quid - two balconies and views over the roof tops on the fifth floor. The room wasnt as clean as I found before - the next day it was spotless though. Little things to note - they provide toothbrushes, razors and shower gels so if you are flying from Britain you dont need to check your liquids in at the airport. Looking forward to going back

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarenatHastings
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. Thank you to all of those people, because could not fault the hotel. Hotel was in a fabulous location - close to tourist attractions, metro, aerobus, restaurants and bars - but with no noise!! Our room was spotless and the hotel staff could not have been more polite and helpful. Able to get a drink until 11.45pm in their bar area - coffee reasonably priced. Was able to use their internet facility for fifteen minutes free of charge. Did not have breakfast at the hotel, but MOKA cafe, close by in Las Ramblas was very reasonable and good quality for a croissant and a coffee. Visited a local Tapas bar near by in Carrer de la Palla called Xaloc. Best meal we had in Barcelona by a long way. Great service, reasonable prices and very tasty food. Would also recommend a great local bar at the bottom of hotel road called El Pinar. Great atmosphere, although closed at 10.00pm when we were there on a Wednesday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet area, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: shans
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated, as before just a few minutes walk from the airport bus stop. (4.5 euros pp). We managed to get a deal which included breakfast, and NH always do good breakfasts. There was cooked, as well as cold meats, cheese, fruit etc. try the little filled rolls brilliant. We didn't use the bar so can't comment on that, but if you go on the Rambla there is a great Carrefor which had great wine at really cheap prices. The rooms were very clean and comfy. There was no noise at night, and we had two light sleepers in our party and they slept really well. Restaurants we tried were ATN which is from the hotel door take a left then a left aqain past the sports shop, there is a square where they are working on Roman Ruins and its on the corner underneath what we thought was the Music Museum. They do 2 set menus of 21 euros and 25 euros which include bread and wine and also an a la carte menu. Not huge meals but well cooked and great quiet atmosphere. On the other end of the block is Living Barcelona, great menu but try the paella, fab. You are on a few minutes walk to the top of the Ramblas from here. All I can say is enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Central location with a good nights sleep on a really comfy bed!”
Reviews.Author: dannyboy39
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights last week and are so glad we did our homework on trip advisor beforehand. Getting to the hotel was really easy. The aerobus (appx 4E) dropped us off in Placa de Catalunya (the heart of the city) and it only took 5mins to walk to the hotel. It is located in the gothic quarter and all the little streets there are so full of character. We arrived appx 8pm and immediately took a stroll on la Rambla. This is when most people eat dinner which can be quite expensive now that euro/sterling exchange rates are not so good. However, we found a lovely restaurant (the attic) on the Rambla near the street down to our hotel. We didn't eat hotel's breakfast - it looked very good but 15E each - i don't think so! Our room ( a superior) had tea & coffee making facilities so at night we bought a filled baquette and put it in mini-bar fridge and had that with fruit (from the nearby market)in our room - there is a good bagel shop (left out of hotel and left again) and numerous places for breakfast nearby. I really enjoyed our stay here - it was really central yet so quiet and we felt really safe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accomodation In Central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: CamillaMichael
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at NH Duc De La Victoria. We had a standard room with a double bed, which was clean and nice. What we really enjoyed was the breakfast lots of local meat and bread with fresh squeezed orange juice. The Hotel is just a few hundred metres away from La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, well-priced choice with ideal location in historic district of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ambough
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the NH Duc de la Victoria in mid-January 2009. I wanted a centrally-located, mid-priced hotel within easy walking distance to major sights, restaurants & shopping. This hotel was a great choice & I would definitely stay there again, which is the reason for my 5 star award. 5 stars in this case does not meet luxury, but rather a combination of value, location & amenities. Our standard double room was perfectly clean, of average size with adequate storage, and had international TV channels on the flat screen TV, very comfortable bedding and a decent-sized bathroom. Basic toiletry items were provided, which was nice with current airline restrictions that limit liquids. Its location on a quiet side street was only a 5 min. walk from the Placa Catalunya square where you can catch the Aerobus that goes directly to the airport. Many shops & cafes are nearby on surrounding streets, so it was easy to sightsee or stroll on La Ramblas and then return to the hotel. We had absolutely no street noise at night, and in fact, no sleep-interrupting noise either, from inside the hotel. We did not use the hotel's internet service, eat breakfast on-site, or ask front desk staff for advice, so I cannot comment except to say that staff members were adequate & professional. However, we did order room service for dinner. The food was good & service was prompt. The hotel is part of the NH chain, so it had little historic character but that was not important to us. The great value it offered for its central location was the main appeal.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal & Great location!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleJb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at "the Duc" ealier this month for six nights. Taxi took us right fom airport to Hotel. It's two blocks off of the Ramblas twords the North end. Three minute walk to Catlunya square and Bus Turistic. One of the biggest shopping areas is the other direction (parallel to the Ramblas) and even closer! GREAT location for first timers!! Hotel has an intimate feel. Bed was King-size and sooooo comfortable. I have a bad back and this is most imortant to me. Jordi the manager at the front desk was very helpful with maps and suggestions for all of our questions. Coffee at breakfast was terrible. Thankfully there was a Starbucks four minutes away. Coffee all-over Spain is horrid. The room was quiet and gave us the opportunity for a good rest. Open the window and it was very loud. We are well travelled and have never seen such large crowds (throngs) in our lives. Barcelona has lots to see, great art, and it's beautiful. I chose the "Duc" after reading the reviews here. Glad I did. I booked directly thru NH hotels Spain on the internet about one month before we left and got a really good deal. The price was very reasonable. This is a good three and-a-half star Hotel for around $100 US per night. You can't beat it........One more thing - there is alot of things written about pick-pockets in Barcelona. Myabe in the Summer when it's harder to hide your wallet. NOT in the Winter. Btw the the room had a safe, just in-case......Enjoy Barcelona. We did.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the NH Duc de la Victoria”
Reviews.Author: Jorge_Almonzo
Reviews.Content: Staying at the NH Duc de la Victoria was an excellent experience. Unusually for a hotel in a large, touristy European city, this hotel seemed to offer more value for the money than expected! The location is wonderful (albeit a bit hard to find, with its entrance off a side-street). The Ramblas is steps away, as are transportation options at the Placa de Catalunya. Moreover, the entire Barrio Gotico is right out the door. After booking a "superior" room at the reservation, I was checked into a Junior Suite on arrival for my five night stay. The suite was genuinely exceptional - a large bedroom with a comfortable king bed separated from a sitting room by a closing door (it would work very well for a family). The spacious sitting room (with couch, desk, refrigerator, etc) accessed a balcony with lovely views over the city. The room was quiet and extremely comfortable. Breakfast in the hotel is delicious. My only complaint is the price for high-speed internet access in the room - its unacceptably high.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: barneyUk
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 2 nights at the NH Duc de la Victoria and the location is ideal. Very close to las Ramblas and the city is right on your doorstep meaning you can explore on foot. The hotel itself is of nice decor and the staff friendly and attentive. We had a corner room on the third floor which was of a decent size and was quiet. The slight negatives relate to the bed which was two singles pushed together - a common thing in Spain and not normally a problem but these two beds kept rolling apart so you would wake with a large gap inbetween. Also the bathroom was somewhat cramped which made having a shower a tricky experience. For the money we paid though not a bad choice for a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: bluerocks13
Reviews.Content: NH Duc de la Victoria is an great hotel and most perfect for my 5-day stay while visiting Barcelona. The location is great and the customer service is wonderful. One of the nights I witnessed excellent customer service from their front desk staff when a few people who did not stay at this hotel came in to use their restroom and asked for directions. I love that the hotel allow guests to use their computer for 15 minutes free of charge per day. I gave this review a 4 instead of a perfect 5 because our room was rather tiny and I did not like our 'queen' bed which was two twins pushed together, not very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kdodia
Reviews.Content: We just stayed there for a weekend. Great Location, nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Duc de la Victoria”
Reviews.Author: guyb6489
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for five days and loved every minute of it. We accepted the offer of an upgrade to a Junior Suite for a price and were glad we did. The suite had an enormous bedroom with a king bed with an attached sitting room with lounge, bar fridge and second TV. The bathroom was large with bath/shower decorated in marble with all of the expected amenities. Our room overlooked the central courtyard, not offering views but was extremely quiet. The air conditioning functioned as it should and was extremely quiet. The room was spotless on arrival and was kept this way for our entire stay. The breakfast area was well appointed and the staff very helpfull. The breakfast itself had everything a traveller could ask for. We had a car and were very pleased that the hotel had parking in a parking station within a two minute walk. We had a small problem with an attempted robbery whilst driving into Barcelona with some resultant minor damage to our vehicle. The hotel front desk staff could not have done more to help us resolve this issue. The location of the hotel could not have been better. In the old heart of the city only moments away from all the attractions this wonderfull city has to offer and in a pedestrian precinct so no problems with traffic or noise. La Rambla is only a 200 metre stroll from the front door offering many wonderfull restaurants and attractions and all forms of transport are equally close by. We will go back to this amazing city and stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely WONDERFUL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aroundtheworld59
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed 3 nights at Duc de la Victoria and the hotel was absolutely wonderful. FANTASTIC. The location is great, next to la Rambla and the pedestrian street where all the markets, shops, etc...are. THANK YOU TRIP ADVISOR!!! I booked the hotel after reading the reviews and now, everytime i go to Bracelona, i will stay at Duc de la Victoria. Very nice staff, beautiful rooms. We booked a superior and it was spotless, had great aminities (tootbrush, paste, hairbrush, nice brand of shampoo and shower gel). The hotel is environement countious, so that was a plus!! You can come back as late as you want, the location is so safe, in the center of everything...it's great!! Again, this hotel is a absolutely great choice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Recomended”
Reviews.Author: BobHadden
Reviews.Content: Efficent friendly staff, clean modern rooms, great location. A good hotel to explore Barcelona from.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: thehotelgirl
Reviews.Content: Over-rated or over-priced? It’s one or the other. NH is the Spanish equivalent to Hilton Hotels.
