They’re relatively modern in terms of amenities and pretty standard relative to each other. They generally have a modern aesthetic, which helps them appear clean. We booked this hotel for the central location (which really is great) and presumptive 4-star quality. It was perfectly fine – no real frills – but the room was TINY and the price was not. When I saw the quoted price (over $500 USD / night) I told my travel companion that it needed to be among the 5 best hotels I’d ever stayed at to justify the price. Of course, it was not. We checked in late and were shown to a room that was so small there was nowhere to open luggage (we had ordered an extra bed). We tried to upgrade to a larger room, but were told we would have to do it in the morning when they had the staff to move the extra bed. We made the room work by rearranging most of the furniture, but it was certainly the most cramped room we stayed in while in Spain. Another bummer was that the bathroom did not have a vent. Overall, it was perfectly fine – just nowhere near worth the price. We would have been better off looking for simpler accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy here”
Reviews.Author: felicia-toronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel had all the necessary qulifications for a very pleasant stay. It was in an amazing location, clean, quiet, well decorated, roomy, and had helpful and friendly staff. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with great location near La Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Anne Wright
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent value for money. It is clean and modern and is situated very close to La Ramblas, so you are near everything but it is a quiet hotel so you do not have to be worried about noise at night. The breakfast buffet is superb. The staff are extremely helpful. I cannot fault this hotel at all and would stay there again if I was visiting Barcelona. There is a great restaurant called Lactuca where you can have all you can eat for 8.95 Euros (before 8 p.m.) and 10.95 Euros (after 8 p.m.). The amount of choice is wonderful and the quality of the food very good. This even includes drinks as well. For people on a budget and not wishing to spend too much, it is ideal. It is situated just off of the main square, about 5 minutes walk from the hotel, and is on the red bus route. Take a ride on the red and the blue open top buses, it is well worth it and a ticket allows you to get on and off as many times as you like throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: DBL_M_CANADA
Reviews.Content: We stepped it up and booked a superior room. Well worth it! Dark hardwood floors, corner unit, huge comfortable bed. Our bathroom was huge for a hotel bathroom, with very modern touches. Spacious room with coffee, tea, and a tv. Nice balcony as well. The staff was terrific. They spoke english well and were very helpful...Ordering a taxi directly to the hotel lobby. YES CARS ARE ALLOWED!! The location is amazing! Close to La Ramblas, which is a very neat and safe spot. About a 15 mins walk to the beach. This was one of the best spots during our stay in Europe!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Midlifecouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights beginning August. Hotel is on a pedestrian street and conveniently located : close to Ramblas - Placa Catalunya - Barri Gotic - Passeig de Gracia - all withing walking distance. Nice hotel room, though bathroom was relatively small. Friendly & helpful staff. Good price/quality. Excellent breakfast. Insist with taxi drivers to drop you off in front of hotel - they will !

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expections- brilliant”
Reviews.Author: EssexNatalie
Reviews.Content: Me and some friends came here on a four day break . The location was brilliant and only a short stroll to las ramblas and plaza catalunya etc. Contrary to a previous review our taxi dropped us off outside the hotel.The staff were friendly and helpful, suggesting places of interest as it was our first time here. The rooms were spotless and much bigger than i thought, considering the price. Toiletries were restocked every day, they thought of everything- toothpaste down to lip balm. Only downside was there was no bar in the hotel, however this isn't a problem because as soon as you leave the hotel you are spoilt for choice. I would definately use this hotel and others in the chain again- A+

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jenny8
Reviews.Content: Just come back from Barcelona and had a great weekend staying at the Duc de la Victoria. I went with a group of girls for a special birthday celebration. The hotel was 5 minutes walk from the Catalyuna square were the Aerobus drops you off. We were able to check in straight away 1.00pm. The staff were pleasant and the rooms were clean and ideal for a city break. The location of the hotel is fantastic as you are just 2mins walk from Las Ramblas. We were bed and breakfast which is well worth it as the breakfast was great, fresh fruit, yoghurt, breads, cereals, hot ham etc., and you can order poached eggs or boiled eggs. Breakfast was on till 12.00 of a weekend. On checking out which is normally 12.00 I asked if we could keep our room longer because our flight was not till the nightime, they obliged till 3.00pm and let us leave our luggage to collect before departure. I would definitely recommend this hotel and if I went back to Barcelona, would definitely stay at the Duc de la Victoria. Great Break!!

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed”
Reviews.Author: AnnaBelfast
Reviews.Content: Minus side - No coffee/tea facilities in room, no bar, restaurant closed at weekends, building work going on outside, bell ringing going on from dawn, bathroom supplies not restocked each day when used, had to walk from lLa Ramblas with our luggage as vehicles cannot access tthe hotel. Plus side - Room was nice, breakfast was nice, staff were ok, La Ramblas within walking distance, Love coffee in my hotel room but we couldn't even buy from the hotel restaurant as it was closed! Took ages finding a shop which does takeaway coffee as they couldn't understand us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: suttysid
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, in a quiet street near la Rambla but when you come out of the hotel and turn the corner there are loads of great little shops and cafes and within 2 minutes you can get to the Cathedral or the shopping area or Gothic Quarter. The standard of the hotel was excellent too- very clean with comfortable beds and helpful staff. Only thing they do not do is include breakfast in the price, but it was cheaper to find a cafe and to be honest there were lots nearby anyway. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie013
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our holiday in Spain and spent our last four nights at this hotel in Barcelona. A great choice. The location is fantastic. Located between the Cathedral and Las Ramblas and a few minutes walk from Placa de Catalunya. We caught the airport bus to the last stop at Placa de Catalunya and walked to the hotel. The hotel is located on a quite pedestrian street that looks a bit shabby when the shops are closed but behind the graffiti roller shutters are some great shops during the day. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel but walked down to La Boqueria market for fruit salad. The tea and coffee facilities in the room were much appreciated as this is not common in Europe but always provided in Australia. 15 minutes of free internet access per day was also a great bonus. The hotel is very clean, the staff very friendly and helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet, good value”
Reviews.Author: Marlin1
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel since the evaluations were quite favorable. and stayed onyl for one night before a mediterrean cruise and were quite impressed. Located in the Barri Gothis on a little side street off the Ramblas (pedestrian zone) it is close to the cathedral and the Paulau de la Musica. Friendly (english speaking) staff, clean well furnished rooms and quiet nights what else can you ask for in a downtown hotel, Only problem was the taxi which dropped us off (with all our luggage) at the Ramblas so that we had to ask for directions to get to the place.

Reviews.Title: “Vastly exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler1945
Reviews.Content: I can't remember the TA rating # of this hotel now but in my estimation should be in the top 10 places to stay in Barcelona. Great location, friendly staff, clean comfortable rooms and competitive price justify this recommendation. I hope to return to Barcelona one day soon as we spent just 2 nights there and will definitely stay at the NH.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Allison85
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the NH Duc in Barcelona before leaving on a cruise, and would recommend it to anyone! The location was right around the corner from Las Ramblas, close to the main areas and touristy spots. We were a little wary of staying so close to Las Ramblas because there were quite a few comments on tripadvisor about the noise when you book a hotel in this area, however the NH Duc is about 1-2 blocks off of the main street, and we were never bothered from the noise at all. The room was very clean, and spacious. We had a superior room with a king sized bed, and found the room and the washroom to be a nice size, and recently renovated. While it wasnt a bargain to stay here, at approx $250 US per night, it was definitely a nice place. If you are looking to see a lot of sites within a couple of days, I would definitely recommend purchasing the 'hop on hop off' double decker bus tickets, we were able to see so much of Barcelona in a short time, and it was very easy and stree free. Narrated explanations of all the sites in a variety of languages make it very tourist-friendly. The main pick-up/drop-off area for these buses were only a couple blocks away. The only thing I would recommend against is purchasing breakfast from the hotel. It was 15 euros per person, and only provided a small buffet of cold dishes. Perhaps I am just not used to European breakfast tastes, but I did not find it was good value for the cost. About 3 minutes away there are many little cafes and restaurants along the Ramblas that offer much better value, and even a couple who served traditional hot English breakfasts with eggs, etc for half the price. Overall, great experience from the NH Duc, I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Agree, it has a good location”
Reviews.Author: lmn2
Reviews.Content: My husband was traveling to Barcelona for business and I had the priviledge of coming along. The hotels that his work had recomended didn't look appealing to me so I found this along with 2 or 3 others in tripadvisor. I left it up to his work to make the reservation hence the choice. It is funny how some things will bother one person and not another. The church bells that we hear from the distance are driving my husband crazy. For me, why is it in a day and age of satelites I am stuck with CNN from London as my only english language TV choice? Silly I know but other than that, I agree that the rooms are small but they are immaculate. Apparently it has been unseasonably warm here so the air conditioning has not been turned on yet. To keep it temperate here on the sixth floor we have had to sleep with the window open since we arrived. When we inquired about the warm temperature in the room, we were told the AC is going on next week. It is a drag to need another shower after your shower never mind your makeup melting before you finish putting it on. Another thing to be aware about is that don't discard the envelope that your room keys come in. You need it to gain entrance to the hotel restaurant despite what appears to be a list of guests and their corresponding room numbers.The restaurant staff are short of obsessive in seeing it to let you in in the morning. One morning, my husband showed his license with the room key and you could see them starting to stress about it. Needless to say I got another one (without an issue). It just seems strange when we have come in at varying times at night and no one is at the desk although I am sure we are on a camera/video somehwere but are OCD about breakfast. But it does have a good location once you get oriented. We are right behind La Rambla behind the Citidines hotel. If you are a shopaholic then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice and location...”
Reviews.Author: NIStrach
Reviews.Content: Just back after spending 3 nights at the Duc. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Barcelona. The hotel was superb and the staff extremely friendly / helpful. On arrival we did request a different room as they had provided a twin room and not a double as we had requested. This was resolved and we got a larger room on the 4th floor with a Queen size bed. You also get an abundance of toiletries which I have never seen in other hotels.. The minibar is very reasonable and the TV has Sky News if you really care what's happening at home. We paid for breakfast and could not complain at the choice and variety on offer. It was a buffet service and you could choose to have a cooked breakfast or selection of cold pastries and fruit. When visiting Barcelona do the bus tour first. It provides a great perspective of the city and highlighted to us many of the places we would like to revisit. You also receive a discount booklet for a lot of the most popular sites in the city as well as the cable car up to the castle. We bought a 2-day subway ticket (which also covers the funicular railway up Montjuic) It was a great way to get around the city when you aren't walking. We ate out in the Gothic quarter which has massive choice of quality restaurants. The Rambla is fine but it's catering primarily for tourists and as such is a lot more expensive as well as being extremely busy. 12€ for a large beer!! It only happened once. Personally, I am looking forward to returning to Barcelona. As well as being a remarkable city it's extremely beautiful and I will certainly return to Duc De La Victoria.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RScharfer9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH Duc de la Victoria during a spring vaction week. We paid 164 euros per night. Maybe a bit pricey for a 3 star hotel, but it was really a 3+. We felt that the hotel's many positives made it a very good value. The rooms and lobby are not very fancy, but neat, very functional, new and/or refurbished, very clean and well kept. The Location is the best in Barcelona. It is a very short walk to la Ramble and a five minute walk to Placa de Catalunya - the major square of the city, and not more than a 5 minute walk to 2 metro stops. It is located in the Old Town, minutes from major sights and museums, shopping, and restaurants. It is very quiet. It is located on a pedestrian street. Our room had double glazed windows. You hear very little, if any street noise. (and Barcelona has a lot of street noise.) Although small, (we had a standard room), the room was probably slightly larger than that of the average 3 star European hotel. The only negative was minimal space for clothes: a small closet and three shelves. However, there was enough floor space for suitcases, and we had ample space for our 6 day stay. The room had a safe and a minibar, which we used to store some juice and yougart. The twin beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was very modern, and spotless. It had a bidet. The shower was excellent. Lots of toiletries were supplied daily. The staff was very effiecient and helpful. We notified them of an early arrival, and a room was ready for us at 10:30 am. They called out airline twice for us at no extra charge. Other pluses include a security guard on duty 24 hours, elevators that worked very well - never had to wait very long, and free newspapers in the lobby. Barclona is a fabulous city with numerous fascinating sights. Our favaorite was the Park Guell - a must see. If you like gelato and waffles, we strongly recommend "Sweet Gaufre", a five minute walk from the hotel. It is located on la Ramble, about a block north of the Gran Teatre del Liceu, on the same side of the street. A large ice cream cone is very visible at the front end of the shop. We tried several ice cream shops/stands, and this was shop was absolutely the best. Everything is home made, from the waffle batter to the ice cream ingredients. The staff is very friendly, and on our last day they gave us free waffles. Do not use the change places to exchange money. The rate during our stay was about 1.59 US dollars for 1 euro. They charged almost 2 US dollars for 1 euro. Use ATMs or your credit card. The best way to get from the airport to the hotel , is the aerobus. It is about a 40 minute ride and the cost is about 4 euros. It drops you off at the Placa del Catalunya, about a 5 minute walk to the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Upbeat Digs in Gothic Setting”
Reviews.Author: seaviewer39
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights prior to a cruise and were delighted. Ours was a spacious 6th floor, non-smoking room, with rooftop views and a balcony. For us "quiet" is a must and the pedestrian only street ensured it, while close enough to the lively Ramblas, the Cathedral and other tourist attractions. The staff were attentive and the breakfast a great spread of fruits, juices, breads, pastries and hot dishes, that kept us going all day on the on-off tour bus. We'd certainly think of the Duc for another Barcelona holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Expereience”
Reviews.Author: Robslee
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the hotel and would have to say it was an enjoyable experience. I chose the hotel having read other reviews on this site and was not disappointed. We booked a superior corner room , No 419, as advised in a earlier review it was a decent size for Europe with 2no balconies which gave a lovely through draft. The rooms are clean , the bathrooms are adequate with ample toiletries, complimentry shaving kits, combs, etc. One slight bad point no English language tv channels, but not missed. The location of the hotel is perfect for la ramblas , old town, shopping and metro system. as reported in other reviews the breakfast is 15euros , but we believe well worth the money with the buffet table containg everything, cereals,fruit juices,all types of breads,pastries,cold meats, bacon, sausages, etc Although you could get cheaper elsewhere you could not get the same amount and variety in such a lovely environment. The staff are helpful if required. Ideal base for a Barca break. Would definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: felipeordonez
Reviews.Content: Barcelona has no shortage of hotels, yet decent accommodation can be very expensive. It is easy to pay a lot of money for a rubbish hotel, even one sporting four or five stars. NH Hotels is an expanding Spanish chain with more than 300 hotels in Europe and Latin America. They are generally 3+ or 4 star properties with modern, elegant quasi-minimalist interiors and slick bathrooms. I've stayed in a number both in Europe and Argentina, and have always found the service to be first-rate. The NH Duc de la Victoria is no exception. The building looks a little like a Florentine palazzo from the street. Its location is a great feature: in a quiet, pedestrian street between Las Ramblas and the cathedral, the hotel is within easy walking distance of the metro, buses, the downtown sights, as well as restaurants and the joys of Barcelona shopping. Rooms are comfortable though not large -- it is worth paying a little extra for a "superior" room -- and bathrooms have deep tubs and powerful showers. The restaurant serves reasonably-priced if unadventurous meals, although most guests will be eating out at the hundreds of restaurants in the area. Staff are multilingual, unfailingly polite and attentive. My only criticism of the hotel is the pricing of the lobby internet terminal, which after a "free" 15 minutes rockets up to €20/hour! In-room Wi-Fi is available on a daily tariff that is much more reasonable. If you haven't brought your lap-top and don't fancy paying through the nose for the lobby terminal, staff will direct you to a nearby "locutorio" where you pay €1.20/hour. I really liked the Duc de la Victoria and would happily stay there again: it's comfortable, reliable, in a terrific location, and reasonably priced for Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could ask for on a short break!”
Reviews.Author: sakani
Reviews.Content: This hotel was practically around the corner from ramblas. Was a little worried about this hotel not being on ramblas, however I feel if we had of stayed on Ramblas we may not have ventured down the side streets. This is where all the magic happens. Some lovely little tapas bars around here and great bagel bar around the corner. Didnt attempt brekfast as it was a bit pricey however loads of options literally outside the door of the hotel! Foyer of hotel was small but had internet access and daily papers and front desk was covered at all times by friendly and very helpful staff. Couldnt have helped more and had great english. Welcome pack was provided on check in which had plenty info on things to do in the area and the staff were obliging to help further. A short stroll to the Plaza de Cataluña, which is where all the hop on/off bus tours start/finish. If your on a short break i'd definately reccomend taking these (€26 for 2 days). You get to see all the main attractions and buses drop off and collect every few mins. hotel just beside the barcelona cathedral. Room was nice, clean and well serviced. Beds were comfy and fresh towels each day. Could have left my oversized toiletry bag at home....Shampoo/conditioner/shower gel/ soap toothbrush and toothpaste/comb/ hairdryer and razor and shaving gel all provided in bathroom! Minibar had only 2 bottles of beer however was reasonably priced. Our Room had a balcony and was on the 5th floor. Beautiful in the morning. Restraunt/bar was a bit deceiving. Bar was the restraunt and perhaps its just the culture there.... but noone went to the bar for drinking only. Menu looked good though. Nice little bar around the corner... and for a more lively evening the hard rock cafe is just minutes walk away! Sat morning Markets across la ramblas was an experience. Never seen as much seafood in one place in my life! €25 for a taxi to/from the airport... but its the only taxi you'll need for your stay cause everything else is so central! Plenty of shops and a 5 min walk to the courte ingleas. I was well warned about the pick pocketers in Barcelona, but never had any encounters with them. Street feel very safe at all times of day and night and always people walking around. Couldnt have asked for a better hotel for a short break. Perfect in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: tinaj07
Reviews.Content: I had researched a lot of hotels in the Las Ramblas area and was very pleased to find the NH Duc de la Victoria. It met our standards very well and would stay there again for another trip to Barcelona. We (3 people) had requested a quiet, top floor room, which is worth the extra few euros- b/c it was completely renovated, beautiful, had a balcony, and had dual-pane windows, so the minute you shut the windows, it was quiet in the room. The bed was comfortable- a little soft, but supportive. Expect small European rooms- which is ok b/c we were hardly in the room. It's walking distance to everything, esp Las Ramblas, Playa Catalunya, and even to La Pedrera which we walked in 15 minutes. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very nice. We took a 20 euro taxi ride to the main train station. The only 2 non-ideal things were that depending on the staff, they did not seem to know that much about where to eat locally in the area. Also, we were there over Christmas/New Year's, and the bar/restaurant was not open during this time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay no matter what the travel books say”
Reviews.Author: ChefJoyceS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the new year holiday, for starters I booked this hotel in July so I would get what I wanted and it would be done right. We arrived at 5 pm and were told there we no rooms left that we had requested so they gave us a two twin beds in a small room facing the sports store that the hotel encircles. Ok so we decided to put that behind us and have fun anyways. Day two I showered first and it seemed that there was something wrong with the water, then when my boyfriend went to shower there was nothing, NOTHING no water then there was just cold and they said we needed to deal with it. A soaped up man freezing in the shower tell him that reception desk. Day three that same thing!!!! The hotel was very reluctant to do anything to compensate us for not being able to shower I wasn't staying at a damn hostal I was paying 200Euro a night. My recommendation it to not stay here the services and accomidations aside from the water issues where not worth it the best part was the hand soap.

Reviews.Title: “Some rooms nice, some small”
Reviews.Author: bobblsc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel the nights of November 29, 30 and December 1, 2007 before a Transatlantic cruise December 2. While there were several positive aspects for our stay, there was particularity one which was quite negative.. I will save this till later. The hotel does have a very nice location, as mentioned by several others. Also, I received timely responses to several e-mails concerning taxi directions, etc. The second room we had, 422 was fairly large, for Europe, and the bath excellent. We arrived at the hotel about noon on November 29. We had tickets for Aida at the Liceu Opera for that evening. I had e-mailed asking that, if possible, we be allowed in our room early so we could rest a bit prior to attending the opera. To the hotel's credit, we were given a room shortly after our arrival. We did indeed nap a bit that afternoon, and thus enjoyed the opera much more than we could have had we been dead tired from our overnight plane trip. The production was really outstanding. The problem was the room, number 420, size and layout. It was, as we saw on the posted floor plan, and later verified, only a bit more than one-half the size of other rooms. When the space taken by the twin beds is subtracted, that meant the remaining area was indeed minimal. The bath fixtures were fine, but here again the bathroom was tiny,. The door would open only about 90 degrees before hitting the toilet. I had to squeeze into the bathroom, and I am average size. I happened to see two young ladies checking out of room 422 the next morning, and immediately requested that we be changed to that room. My request was granted. I later spoke with the desk clerk, and then the manager, to inform them that I thought it ridiculous that both rooms had the same €140 rate,, that 420 should have had at least a bit less rate. Neither person seemed able to understand this. Since our final two nights were on a weekend, our rate for 422 was only €120. I am sure 420 was the same rate. So don't stay in 420, 320, or any other 20 if you want a decent size room for a decent price. Another minor irritation was that we were not allowed to purchase a morning cup of coffee in the dining room. We could buy coffee, but only if it were to be delivered to the hotel lobby. The Bagel Shop, turn left out the door, then left again at the street, is great for breakfast, but not open Sundays. It is across from the park in the middle of the block. Finally, I confirm dunnoh's July 28 comments about the small bar and café Babia. We went to Babia, and she was totally correct . Rollo remember her and served us a very, very good meal, with a nice wine. This is a really great little place.

Reviews.Title: “Very central at "La Rambla" and calm”
Reviews.Author: ckonstan
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very central near "La Rambla", but really quiet in a smaller street. Room is okay and clean, bed is a bit too soft and the room a bit dark. Really fast roomservice. Service is a bit "neutral", but they do their job. All rooms have wireless lan access (via swisscomm with costs), but you can use pc and printer every day 15 min free. You cant drive directly before the hotel, because it´s in a pedestrian zone, but only some meters to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GloriaJC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH Duc de la Victoria to three nights and were extremely happy with our hotel choice. The staff was very helpful, the location is perfect, and the room (with balcony) was great. The front desk made excellent recommendations for dinner. The taxis can come up to the front of the hotel for drop-off and pick-up, so don't let the driver tell you that he can only drop you off at the Ramblas. I highly recommend the walking tour of the Gothic Quarter that leaves from the information center at Plaza Catalunya as well as the hop-on/hop-off bus. The department store, Cortes Ingles, has a cafeteria on the top floor and is good for an inexpensive lunch. We found most restaurants in Barcelona have English language menus which we were grateful for at the start of our 3 week vacation in Spain. I would definitely stay at his hotel again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Competent but soulless”
Reviews.Author: Briquenay
Reviews.Content: Good points: comfortable bed, lavish breakfast, very quiet area, but right in the middle of things. Less good points: not cheap - we paid about 170 Euros a night, our room was cold and needed a fan heater as the central system didn't work, the bathroom was rather poky, staff weren't cheery though did their jobs OK.

Reviews.Title: “excellent base”
Reviews.Author: zzzYorks
Reviews.Content: Probably aimed at business people but in fact very convenient for tourists. Arrived by airport bus in Catalunia Square and 5 minutes easy walk to hotel. 2 minutes from Ramblas and on edge of Gothic Quarter yet sufficiently quiet to sleep with window open. Standard room very comfortable and clean (and extra blankets and choice of pillows). All staff met were v helpful and pleasant. Excellent extensive buffet breakfast and excellent dinner one evening when heavy downpour convinced us not to venture out. Plan to use this as base on next visit. .

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Magicats
Reviews.Content: On our way to a Mediterranean cruise we stayed over night in Barcelona and at the Nh Duc de la Victoria. What a great hotel. It's located just off Las Ramblas off a pedestrian alley. Our driver was able to drive us right to the front of the hotel but warned us that some cabbies will not venture to the hotel. If you are forced to walk from Ramblas it is only about 150 metres or less. Check in was easy and the front desk staff friendly, helpful and spoke very good english. The rooms were uber clean and the washroom was supplied with toothbrush, razor, shampoo and conditioner which was great if you didn't want to root through your luggage looking for those items. The only negative we found was the bathtub/shower was very high so if you have trouble lifting you legs high you will have trouble getting into the shower. Breakfast was amazing with an assortment of hot and cold dishes served buffet style. Although we only were in this hotel for one night, we would definately stay longer if we come back to barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hobbes79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply superb! It is located just off Las Ramblas and is within easy walking distance to the subway and taxi ranks. The outside and reception area of the hotel look really nice and clean and the reception staff are really nice and speak fluent English.Make sure that you look carefully on a map to find out where it is before setting off as it is located down a side street. The room were were allocated was on the second floor. We were facing onto another hotel, but the room itself more than made up for it. It was well furnished, with an electronic safe located in the wardrobe (although watch your fingers on the wardrobe's sliding doors, they slide like the castors are on ice... made for a few sore fingers!). We did not try the restaurant due to the sheer choice of food on Las Ramblas. But what a really nice hotel, it would be my first choice when I go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: bubuLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is sandwiched between the main Las Ramblas street and a major shopping street. Truly a great location. The street on which the hotel is actually located is not really picturesque and appears quite dodgy at night, but most of the streets in Barcelona are like that. However, you are seriously well placed to explore Barcelona -- about 2 mins from the main streets and 5 mins to the Plaza Catalunya (where the metro and airport buses go!) The rooms were clean and reasonably well decorated. Our room (301) faced into a central courtyard with a glass dome (which turned out to be above a sports shop in the same building as the hotel). Good because there is no noise from pedestrians, bad because there is no view. We did leave the window open at night as the air-con was pretty strong when switched on. This was fine until the people in the opposite side started cooking dinner :) I was not really happy about the soundproofing between our room door and the corridor. Every morning I could hear the other guests shutting their doors, and at night as people came back to their rooms I could hear their conversations very clearly. Hotel staff were extremely helpful and spoke decent English.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the NH Duc de la Victoria”
Reviews.Author: Richard80
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NH Duc de la Victoria at the end of October '07. Was a fantastic hotel with lovely rooms! Staff were really helpful and made our stay really enjoyable. In Barca, location is key and NH Duc de la Victoria is in a fantastic location right in the middle of Barri Gotic. Actually upgraded to a superior room which was definetely worth the extra Euros... Overall, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: MollyBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duc de la Victoria 4 nights. It is in the "Old City", but is close to the Placa de Catalunya, where the Tourist Information Office is located, as well as to Las Ramblas. After reading Trip Advisor reviews, we asked for a room on the 4th or 5th floor, and got one on the 4th. The room had a very modern marble bath, and Queen Bed, very comfortable. Loved the hotel. Only had the breakfast buffet one morning (14 euros pp). It provides a good selection, but there are other places nearby which are less expensive. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: londonaustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duc de Victoria by accident having been moved from another NH hotel following a problem with our booking. Having suffered some really poor service in the previous NH hotel, we had low expectations. However, we were extremely pleasantly suprised and would thoroughly recommend the hotel. Our room was large and spacious with a seperate seating area with a sliding door which could separate out the bedroom area and seating area if you wished. Breakfast was included in our rate and was fantastic with a huge choice of hot and cold food and even cava. Overall we couldn't fault the hotel and would thoroughly recommend it. It goes without saying that the location is superb and the hotel is a stone's throw from La Rambla and the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “No need for taxis”
Reviews.Author: TJCountyDown
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute and it's probably a little more expensive than our usual choice, but worth it to be right in the centre of the city. Walking distance to everything and only 2 minutes from Placa Catalunya, for the airport buses and tourist buses. Excellent choice at the buffet breakfast. We stayed there during the Barcelona Merce festival, which takes place around 24th September, which meant open air concerts in every square, lots of parades and masses of people. Great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Duc De La Victoria is very good”
Reviews.Author: Tom099
Reviews.Content: Good location. It is a short 10 minute walk from the aeroport bus stop and a stone's throw from Las Ramblas. Good staff, The hotel staff were very friendly and allowed us to swap to a room with a single double bed instead of two single beds which most other hotels in europe have. Decent breakfast. The continental breakfast was decent and very welcomed considering some of the other breakfasts we had in europe. I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Duc de la Victoria hotel was great.”
Reviews.Author: nftexas
Reviews.Content: Booked through Delta Airlines which included breakfast which was delightful in a beautiful dining room. On our first stay we had a room on the street with balcony. Wonderful and very quiet at night. The second stay had inside room which was larger and was fine. The staff couldn't have been nicer and more helpful. The hotel is a little hard to find at first but you figure it out. It is convenient to Las Ramblas, and Catalunya Plaza where all the tour busses leave from and the tourist bureau is located. The Mediterranean is within walking distance Watch out at the Barcelona airport for pickpockets and wallet grabbers. Keep you wallets deep in your purse or for men in your front pocket with your hand in it. It was terrible!! At the airport police station there were 6 other people who had had their wallets stolen. Beware of young blonde good looking women (according to one of our tour guides).

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great - for many reasons”
Reviews.Author: ilbaldini
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the mainly positive reviews on this website, I decided to stay in Duc de la Victoria during my 4-day stay in Barcelona. I made the right choice!! The hotel is situated right in the centre of Barcelona, at a 2 min walk from Las Ramblas, in a pedestrianised area. Clearly the advantage is that there is no Spanish traffic to cope with (often not so tame) and it’s a quiet street too – I’ll deal with the disadvantage later. The hotel itself is very clean, and relatively new. The entrance is adequate, and the reception staff are friendly and with good English abilities. The rooms were of decent size, and also very clean. You get a good range of products in the (very clean) bathroom, and also a pretty good international range of TV channels. Breakfast (which was served until 12h) is a grand buffet, with all the standard foods, but you can order eggs/ sausages to be freshly done the way you want them for free. My only slightly negative point goes back to arriving at the hotel. It is in a pedestrianised area, and you can’t reach it by car, meaning that once you find a parking place (difficult in such a busy area of Barcelona) you have to walk 5 min with your luggage to the hotel. The hotel does offer parking capabilities (20€/ day), but it’s not next to the hotel, and you have to check in before arriving there with your car. For people arriving by any other means, this doesn’t pose much of a problem. As far as my experience goes, this is a typical NH hotel and is representative of what I expect from this chain – a good hotel with great service and value for money - perfect for western tastes and expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Zuson
Reviews.Content: We just spend a few days in this hotel in Barcelona and where really happy with it. The number one bonus of this hotel is its quite location. Although in the centre of Barcelona right next to the Ramblas, its located in a pedestrian area with no bars or shops next to it. So there is no noise whatsoever and you can sleep with your window or balcony door open. We had a room on the 6th floor with a little balcony and a view over the roofs, which was nice. The room itself was nice with modern furniture, with a good comfortable bed, but a bit small. Aircondition working, safe in the room but no coffee making facilities. The bathroom was big compared to the room but a little old around the edges. The hotel and room was very clean and staff was friendly enough. All in all, a perfect joice for people who like to stay right in the center but without all the noise. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Conniecph
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel which fulfilled all of our needs. What we maybe appreaciated most was the absolutely perfect location. Situated in the beautiful gothic area, only a few minutes walk from the Ramblas, but in a very quiet street, and also in close walking distance to two different metro stations and the bus stop to and from the airport. The staff at the hotel was friendly and efficient and the room (we did have a corner room) was quite big for a city hotel room and the bathroom really, really nice with a nice assortment of soaps, shampoos, toothpasta and toothbrushes. The cleaning of the room was impeccable. The room had also a safe and a minifridge.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Apeks
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. Location is perfect, cant be beaten. Staff very positive and helpsome.Our room was big, nice and clean as a whistle. Bathroom had a massage shower, shaving equipment and all kinds of soaps. Breakfast buffet is the best we have ever seen at a hotel. Regarding value for money you cant find anything better in the centre of Barcelona. Will stay again, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Good Accomodations in a Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Visitors4
Reviews.Content: Hotel provides good accomodations on a quiet side street, but in the center of the city. It is convenient to Metro and walkable to many sights and conveniences. It was great that we could walk out the door and be in the heart of the Gothic quarter of Barcelona, which was our favorite walks. The rooms were comfortable, and importantly, clean. Do visit the Musee Picasso. It's very manageable in size, and excellent exhibits of Picasso's history of work. About a 15-20 minute walk from the hotel that takes you through the Gothic quarter and a very nice walk.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel...nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Willforth
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is comfortable and clean. Staff are pleasant and efficient and the rooms have all the basic comforts. The Hotel is 2 mins walk off the Ramblas. The street it is on is a little bit difficult to find and not all taxis know how to get to the Hotel. But if you want to be close to La Ramblas and do not want the associated noise at night, this Hotel is a great choice. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very quiet”
Reviews.Author: bob462
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Duc de la Victoria for 3 nights in May. Couldn't fault the hotel itself - very clean, ok size rooms, nice queen size beds, good sized bathroom and working air-con. The view from the room wasn't much to write home about (looking along a narrow street), but you don't go to Barcelona to stay in the hotel room admiring the view. The location of the hotel is ideal, just a couple of minutes walk from La Ramblas. Even though the hotel is very central, it is on a quiet pedestrianised street, so you don't get any of the noise as with most hotels in this busy city. Overall - very pleasant stay and would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very central and yet very quiet”
Reviews.Author: bridgerobe
Reviews.Content: Ups:- very central and yet very quiet, facing a narrow street closed to private traffic. -room modern and "warm". Tea facilities. -staff was very helpful and attentive. Check in and check out absolutely smooth. They let me stay until 03.00pm. Downs: - 160 euro for a single room without breakfast. You judge, to me is not a bargain. - the bathroom is the only weak point. Not up to the standard of the hotel. Don't misundertand me, it is OK anyway. Overall, I would go back

Reviews.Title: “great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: themaw
Reviews.Content: we booked direct with hotel having read favourable reviews on tripadvisor. modern, clean, fabulous position, excellent buffet breakfast if you feel like a large breakfast otherwise just have breakfast at one of the many little cafes around the hotel. we were a party of women and we booked the superior rooms and asked for a balcony if possible. all 3 of our rooms had balconies, were a decent size and absolutely spotlessly clean with bedlinen etc changed daily. Liked the laminate flooring as is cleaner than carpets i feel. had no reason to use reception as we had done all our own research re restaurants, shopping etc however they were very pleasant whenever we did speak to them. a few steps away from the ramblas, good shopping and the Cathedral in the heart of the Barri Gotic which for me is the best area to stay in. just under £100 per night for the room. will recommend hotel and will use again and that is the opinion of our whole party.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: lunadream
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very chic and modern, it was worth the price, situated in Las Ramblas, in a small street nearby, not in the main center but lovely! The room was good, an ammenities too. The bathroom was very nice! Excellent service. Nearby Tour buses, and everything! wWe would stay there again. we stayed from 11-13 March, 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Splintergroup
Reviews.Content: Have just spent a long weekend in Barcelona staying at the Duc de la Victoria having read previous reviews on Trip Advisor! What a great little hotel, excellent quiet location, smallish but very clean rooms, nice clean bathrooms, in fact, everything you could wish for for a short break! Some nice little cafes for breakfast close by but the hotel restuarant looked really nice! Do use the hop on hop off tourist buses as they were great. Also, when arriving at the airport, get a bus into the centre of Barcelona as it only costs about 3 Euros each and is much better than a taxi!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, unexciting room”
Reviews.Author: PortoPorto
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Barcelona where I stayed for three nights in this hotel. I had been at another NH in Barcelona several years before and chose this one because of the excellent reviews. However, this is a 3-star hotel and the reviews must be understood starting from this fact. No free lunches as some would say. The air conditioning is not really controlled by the customer. I thought I was at the peak of summer in Africa with no chances but opening the window to control the temperature. The room's size was acceptable (3-star hotel, remember) and apart from that I would stand out the excellent/perfect location (even the airport express bus is 2 mins walking from the hotel) and the usual NH business-standard fully equipped toilets. At the end of the day, don't pay a premium to stay here over other several alternatives in town.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ranger5322
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the previous comments that this hotel is in an superb location. Only 2 mins walk away from Las Ramblas and Place de Catelunya and hidden in a tiny back street so no noise or crowds. The room was clean but on the smallish side and the service on the Saturday and Sunday in the breakfast room was good, but come Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday, more staff than visitors and we found it average, as they just stood around rather than asking you if you wanted any drinks or clearing away your used plates etc. But please don't let that put you off, that could have been a one off and hopefully it was, as the hotel was very good for a city hotel, we couldn't fault anything except the breakfast service on those 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: irlhelen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a short break in November 2006. We enjoyed the location as it was quiet but very near the buzz of Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas. The beds were comfortable and the staff very friendly. The location is right between major shopping streets so there are lots of people out and about. However, the actual street where the hotel is located is a bit deserted if you go back after about 10 pm. Didn't try the breakfast so I don't know if it was good or not.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Duc de la Victoria”
Reviews.Author: lily8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duc de la Victoria after a very disappointing experience with another hotel in the Barri Gotic, (the hotel Raco del Pi), who had given our room away when we arrived and turned out to be nothing like the advertised features on the web site. We explained our situation to the very courteous staff at the Duc, and for the same price were given a quiet, beautiful room on the top floor with a large balcony, wonderful views and very comfortable inner sprung bed. The room was spacious, newly appointed, very clean and very user-friendly. The staff were great, and the breakfast room and buffet breakfast looked good, although we chose to eat out in the little caffes. The Barri Gotic is a great location with most attractions within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Bright and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: chocodung
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a night in December. Hotel is in a small street off Carre Canuda, may need some time to locate it. Room is bright, clean, comfort and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chatnoir28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at the end of September. The public areas of the hotel were very clean and bright and check-in was quick and easy. Our room was a double on the third floor and it was a fair size, but a little dark. The air conditioning was fine and room was very quite. The bed was a good size and very comfortable. Although on arrival there was only three pillows, a quick called to reception soon rectified this situation. There was plenty of hanging space and safe was very easy to operate. There was a TV in the room and a mini-bar with room to add your own drinks. The bathroom was internal but still bright and fresh. There were plenty of towels and toiletries provided. The bath was a fair size and the shower had great pressure and plenty of hot water. The breakfast was nice but a little on the pricy side if it is not included in the package price. The location was good for sightseeing. I really enjoyed the Casa Batlló. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter02
Reviews.Content: The location was the best thing about this hotel - about a 2 min walk from the Ramblas. It's also a short walk from all the main shopping areas, markets, and the barri gotic area, and very close to the subway station at Placa de Catalunya (to get to major tourist sights and the Sants & Franca train stations). The room was very well air-conditioned and extremely clean! The bathroom included amenities: shampoo, soap, toothbrush, razor, etc. The receptionist was also extremely helpful. One morning, we had a minor leak from the ceiling of the bathroom...we notified the front desk and left to sightsee. When we came back in a few hours, the problem was already taken care of. The beds were very comfortable, and they include a mini bar (which of course you have to pay for). They also show your room bill on the TV in your room, on a private hotel channel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Blackcat2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for La Merce and found the location to be spot on. Our room was quite small but perfect for our needs with a good hot shower and in room safe. For the price we paid €77 a night it could not be faulted. My advice would be to book early to get the best rate.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: Kroma
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 5-night stay at the NH Duc de la Victoria and found it to be the perfect choice. We read reviews of so many Barcelona hotels here and this appeared to be the best balance of quality and value - the reviews were correct! As others have said, the location is perfect for walking from the airport bus and for being a generally central location. Our room was clean and comfortable with A/C and a TV (Sky News for us). The bathroom was clean, bright and the shower was powerful. The free toiletries were plentiful and smelt nice! The windows must have been very thick as they blocked out the sounds of the city extremely well and we had a nice peaceful stay. The free safe was good for our peace of mind. Breakfast was included in our holiday and the food was varied and plentiful. The only thing which wasn't to our taste was the very strong coffee but we filled up with fruit juices and the delicious food. Like other reviewers, we'd recommend the Bus Touristic (you may as well go for the 2 day ticket as it costs barely more than a 1-day pass). We'd also suggest avoiding weekends in Barcelona as the city is markedly busier (I assume all the Spanish sightseers are around at weekends). We saw a couple of pickpockets at work but if you are sensible with your belongings (rucksacks held to the SIDE with a covering arm and use body belts for cash) they should pose no threat at all. Highlight of our stay was the magic fountain at the Placa d'Espana. The Happy Bar&Grill on the Rambla Di Catalunya which served a mixture of Spanish and non-Spanish food and the La Perla Nera (Italian) on Via Layetana were our restuarants of choice. Good food and very good value. For desserts, one of the many ice cream stalls near the cathedral sufficed thank you very much! The perfect hotel in a great city. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: cocapeddle
Reviews.Content: For the price and the location, this hotel is great value considering some of the hotels you could end up in near the Ramblas but I would advise booking on the NH Hotels website for a good rate. The room wasn't huge but you had plenty of room, which was my initial worry when I booked as we were staying here for a week. I didn't have a problem with the staff at all, one of the receptionists even booked a restaurant for us one night and the rooms were very clean and well maintained. You can't fault the location either; at the end of the street is one of the main shopping streets in Barcelona. A 2 minute walk in one direction takes you to The Ramblas, in the other direction it takes you to the Cathedral and 5 - 10 minutes walk is the up and coming Born district which has lots of nice boutiques and restaurants too. One of the major finds was the Barcelona guide book supplied in each room of the hotel. We managed to eat VERY well thanks to this book and I would really recommend a glance if only to avoid all the over priced places in The Ramblas. Well worth a try is the restaurant VISIT which is in the Pulitzer hotel c/Bergara just off of Plaza Catalunya - everything about this restaurant was excellent! Also there are a couple of great restaurants along the seafront by Port Olympic such as Shoko & Bestial & they are only a 5 minute taxi ride (€5) from the bottom of The Ramblas. Barcelona is a great city, it was my 3rd visit here and I still love it - don't let talk of pickpockets put you off. That can happen in any city!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Madjock
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, as per other reviews, location is perfect being right off la ramlas and only a couple of mins walk to the nearest underground station. Hotel staff were very friendly, showed us an alternative room when we asked about the small road works outside (we decided to stay put as it didn't effect us due to the weekend). Couple of small issues, safe was locked when we arrived, took a day and three requests to get it opened and the billing on the TV didn't update to show our bill over the four nights. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: DorotaK
Reviews.Content: We only stayed there for one night so maybe it was not enough to appreciate the hotel, but I really do not understand why it gets such a high rating. That is true that location is great, but there is so many other hotels within the area (Barri Ghotic, La Rambla). We had 2 rooms (6th floor), doubbles, and both were very small with small bathrooms. The decor was very typical to North-American chain hotels like Days Inn or Holidays Inn, so with zero character nor charm, just borring. Also front desk staff was lacking any "charm or character", very plain and "official". Overall there was nothing wrong with the hotel and I would probably recommend to stay there, but without any huge expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: planetearth
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in a great location just off the top end of Las Ramblas near to Placa de Catalunya. The minute you walk into the reception area you know you have made the right choice. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona. The food in Barcelona is probably the best we have tried, on our far travels throughout Europe. A visit to St Josephs market on Las Ramblas is a must the size of the fish, veg and meat stalls is the largest i have ever seen and would love one like this in Glasgow. We also visited the Nou Camp stadium and to be honest from the outside it looks an ugly building but the football arena itself was magnificent. We als loloved the Gaudi architecture. For some reason we did not use the metro that much but on the occasion we did it was not a good experience far to hot .

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: B&J144
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the marvelous NH Duc de la Victoria in Barcelona for a four-day vacation, and I cannot say enough positive things about it. My two main qualifications in chosing a hotel are location and noise level, and it is often difficult to find a quiet hotel near the sights. Duc de la Victoria was an exception-- We were two blocks from Las Ramblas and walking distance to everything we wanted to see plus three metro stations, but the hotel itself was virtually silent. We had no trouble sleeping! The room was small but adequate, with a comfy bed and private bathroom. If I visit Barcelona again in the future, I will only stay at the NH Duc de la Victoria! Helpful hint: Try the Rick Steves guide to Spain & Portugal, especially his tours and restaurant recomendations.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; average but clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: jim6irl
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous comments is that this hotel is in an excellent location. Only 2 mins away from Las Ramblas and Place de Catelunya but without the noise and crowds. The room was clean but on the smallish side and the service was average.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel But be wary of Spanish taxes”
Reviews.Author: snoopy79
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel with an amazing location. Las Ramblas is literally a 2 minute walk. The parc de catalunya is again 2 minutes away where you will find loads of taxis (the taxis are very reasonable). The rooms are not a bad size, huge bed, desk, tv and a fridge (very handy! Even the mini bar prices were reasonable). The air conditioning was excellent and the bathroom was clean and the free products were excellent. Also, the hotel was either very quiet or the walls very thick - we were quite near the elevators and heard nothing! The staff were very helpful and most of them spoke perfect English (the others were near perfect!). We didn't try out the restaurant but we did notice the room service was quite reasonably priced and served until midnight. Just be wary of two things in Barcelona: 1. Impuesto (?) tax. The site we booked our hotel through said 99 euros a night but then this surcharge was added as we checked out. It was only about 7 euros a night but if you aren't prepared then you could be out of pocket - especially on a long stay! 2. People begging for money. Yes you have no doubt been warned about beggars, pick pockets but I haven't heard of the experience we went through. A young man starts walking with you, asking you questions, when you tell him you aren't giving him any money he starts hurling abuse. When he did this I decided to pay further attention to him - just in case he did try to rob us. His teeth were really rotted away and it was only when he began shouting I realised this. Furthermore, he was "working" with another girl. I feel this is definitely a way to get people to bring out wallets/purses and then rob them, pass it to the girl and escape. When I started shouting back he left - he didn't want any negative attention. My advice is if you feel something rather dodgy is going on shout, scream - make noise - people will notice. They might not do anything but these people do not want their faces recognised so that they can pull another "job" later. For a great meal - there is a restaurant on Mont Juic that looks out on to the whole of Barcelona - it even has a revolving floor. Outside it says Restaurant - nothing more, but it is absolutely wonderful. Montjuic el xalet - Tel. [--] to book. (its a little pricey but well worth it - prob about 40 euros per person for a 2 course+ drinks) The only other tip for a good meal was Los Caracoles (C. dels Escudellers 14) - which is just off the Ramblas - it has roast chickens in the windows and is absolutely wonderful (they have a framed picture of Robert De Niro eating there so not a bad advert!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: kbriffa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located just a few block away from Plaza de Catalunya. You can easily get to the hotel from the airport with the Aerobus that stops in Plaza Catalunya (even if you're not using backpacks) and walk from there. The staff need to be a bit more cheerful but are nonetheless helpful. I must say that I was a bit worried at seeing a security gurad patrolling the lobby - if he's there then it means he's been needed - but Barcelona is as safe a city as any other European city. The rooms were contemporary finished and airy and comfortable and had air-conditioning. We didn't bother with breakfast - a cheaper option is Mokka - 5 minutes away on the upper part of the Ramblas. Don't just stick to the Ramblas in Barcelona - try going into the up and coming El Raval district or enjoy some sun and sea in Barceloneta. If your looking for nightlife I recommend the area around Francesc Maria square and La Terrazza in Poble Espanyol.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mandy645
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the hotel and would highly recommend it. I spent quite some time researching peoples views of various hotels to ensure that the location and accommodation would be good. The hotel is centrally located, just a 5 minute walk from La Ramblas. The hotel room was of an adequate size and extremely clean (which I can be quite particular about!). I requested a top floor room so that we would not have to endure lots of noise at night when trying to sleep (didn't have a particularly scenic view from the balcony but not a problem because we were out most of the day). We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. When we found that the volume on our TV did not work, we reported it to Reception and it was sorted out promptly. Overall, an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great silence”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed at this hotel in June for several nights. It was clean, comfortable and QUIET. The breakfasts were wonderful: fruit, eggs, meat, cereal, etc and champagne! It is not a place where people fawn over you (which is good in my opinion) and it has a little lobby BUT it is in the gothic quarter and close to las ramblas and away from the noise. Amazingly quiet. Recommend without reservation!

Reviews.Title: “nice and great location!”
Reviews.Author: chicagoot
Reviews.Content: Much as others have said, this is a nice dependable hotel in a great location. The rooms are relatively large, very clean, well air conditioned (we actually needed blankets at night), and with very comfortable beds. As two females staying here we were quite happy with the location- just a minute or two walk from La Rambla so no winding down dark side streets, but very quiet at night. The front desk staff spoke wonderful English (not necessary, but helpful!) and were very friendly. It's also easily accesible to several Metro stops, including the Placa de Catalunya with several different lines. For walking it was easy to walk to both the ocean and to several of the Gaudi houses. Overall very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Really Like This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tmccaleb
Reviews.Content: We really do like this hotel. We stayed here for 3 days in May 2005, for 3 days again in May 2006, and for 3 days in June 2006. We wouldn't keep coming back if we didn't love Barcelona and this hotel. The exterior of the building is old, but the interior is all new. We have had 3 different rooms: two were small by American standards but average or better by European standards, each with a queen-sized bed. The third room was large by European standards with 2 twin beds. In each case, the bathrooms were larger than average, and adequate for 2 people to operate in at the same time. The rooms are very nicely appointed: all tile in baths, wood floors and furniture in bedrooms. Beds are very comfortable; I like a very firm bed, my wife likes a soft bed, we sleep on the same bed in this hotel and neither of us complains. The location is exceptional: in the Barri Gotic, 3 blocks to Placa Catalunya, 2 blocks to the Ramblas, on a narrow quiet street. If you have wheeled luggage, you can easily walk from the Aerobus stop at Placa Catalunya to the hotel (5 minutes, maybe). We have only eaten breakfast there once; the buffet was large with lots of variety and very tasty, although perhaps a bit pricey (13 euros per person). We have paid varying rates for different days, but the rates run approximately 125-150 euros per night--not a bargain, but good value for the money. The front desk staff is helpful, housekeeping is excellent. When we return to Barcelona, this will be our first choice among hotels.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: jessica1
Reviews.Content: Taxi from airport 25euro, dropped off at hotel door. Smallish but adequate reception, quick check in. Room fine, nice comfortable beds, clean, modern, good decor, mini bar/fridge, nice bathroom. Resteraunt/bar looked very nice, however we never find time to eat or drink there as we were out and about. The location was super, 1 min from Ramblas, giving us a nice quiet room for sleeping. There is shops, bars & dining everywhere. Our hotel road was very pituresque with the old tall buildings with balconies. No complaints at all. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3* hotel - nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Gastronauta
Reviews.Content: As already flagged by others, the main plus is the excellent location: close to the Ramblas but far from the noise. Rooms ok and nice bathroom but mine was a bit dark. Smart and relatively new furnishings. Breakfast room: I gave up as it was so crowded but seemed average. Non-existent common areas (cost of location I suppose) and front desk seemed pretty surly to me. Overall, OK hotel but nothing special. Worth it if under €150 only.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: etz5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during a recent swing through Barcelona. The location was great, as it was just off La Rambla, (about a block away), and within easy walking distance to all the sights, and the subway. It should be noted, that you'll want to stay OFF La Rambla, because it will be quieter. As far as the room goes, I'd say it was pretty average. Neat, clean, and with no real view. The service was okay. The front desk staff was kind, although they didn't speak English too well, and we didn't speak Spanish too well, so we had problems communicating with them. Overall, a good stay, and for the price, it can't be beat. I would also add, if you are going to Barcelona, and you're English, you'll have a great time at two different restaurants. We loved: El Xampanyet - A Tapas Bar, off the beaten path, which oozes with character. Its not touristy and was full of locals. Tapioles 53 - That's the address! It doesn't have a name, and has no menus. The Australian chef comes by your table and says, "here's what I have tonight', and "here's what's fresh". You take your pick of two meals she's prepared. It was a wonderful experience, and great for the price. It was like having dinner at a friend's house, as it's in one of Barcelona's residential districts. I would recommend reservations though, because she only has four tables. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: lh6938
Reviews.Content: Belive the fantastic reviews! I stayed here with two teens in February and we were very impressed. The staff was helpful and curtious, the rooms were clean and lovely, the bathroom was wonderful and the beds very comfortable. We asked for two beds and got two twins pushed together. This was fine for us but I understand this is the norm so if you want to sleep together with out the crack in the middle, be sure you get a real king. We were very pleased with the location - walking distance to everything and great for catching the tourist bus to the sites. Try out the restaurants on the side streets - the ones facing Las Ramblas are more pricey and more touristy. Here's the real story on the taxi coming to the front door - I asked the cab driver before I left from the airport if he would be OK with driving up to the front door and he very graciously said yes so I had no prblem. I would not recommend waiting to find out if your driver says no when he gets to Las Ramblas - it's not a terribly long walk (two long blocks) but something I'd rather not do at night with luggage especially when its not necessary. We had no probelm getting taxis on 3 different occassions to pick us up at the door and drop us off at night when we went to restaurants. I think the warnings helped me to be prepared to head this off so I had no problem and neither should you! I recommend taking the taxi to the airport unless you have very little luggage. The convenience is worth the extra euros and I'm very budget minded. The bagel shop a few doors down is terrific for breakfast but don't miss the market on Saturday like we did. Everyone recommends going there for breakfast and we planned it for Sunday morning and they are closed on Sunday! I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again. For a budget priced hotel it was very classy! I went on to Granada and the NH there was lovely as well and a great location but I did not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: conguero
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days in March 2006 and this hotel was such a great deal. It was an in an excellent location very close to the Ramblas and Bari Gotic area and minutes away from the Metro station. The best part of the hotel was being in a very quiet but safe street in a busy area. The only downside was that the staff wasn't very helpful except for the gentleman working in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Great for shopping, eating, and drinking!”
Reviews.Author: agentbeige
Reviews.Content: After spending some European city breaks in some rather small, tatty rooms in the past, this was a refreshing change. The hotel is quite new and has been designed in a contemporary style. The room we stayed in had plenty of storage/hanging space, laminate flooring, a very comfortable bed (without chintzy bedspread), a desk (and a large TV that we didn't use), and a decent size bathroom with shower, bath, toilet, sink and bidet. They provide toothbrushes, combs, razors, shampoo, shower gel and soap from their own range of products which smell of grapefruit! The rooms were clean and tidy and were kept to that standard during our stay. We didn't have much contact with the staff as we didn't eat here at all, but most of them seemed fairly friendly. The woman that checked us in wasn't exactly all smiles, but she wasn't what I would describe as rude either. The hotel is, as other members have mentioned, in an excellent location for traversing the city, but it is also right next to some busy shopping streets, and is joined to other residential/business properties, so don't expect to be in a quiet area if you book this hotel. On the Friday night that we were here, I heard a party going on through the walls (but this city has a busy nightlife so you can't really come here and then complain about noise!). Apart from that, the location is perfect for shopping and eating. There are many restaurants, bars and shops that you will come across if you simply wander around the narrow streets near the hotel, or on La Rambla. However, as with many cities, the busy areas can also be the dirtier parts to the city. The streets in this area are a bit grubbier than the historic parts of the city, so don't be surprised if you see rubbish, dog poo or men weeing in allyways! If you want a more luxury area, you may want to try another part of the city. The Gaudi sights such as Park Guell, Casa Mila and the Sagrada Familia are not within walking distance, but we took a tube to Park Guell which was only a few stops away, and managed to see the other two sights on the way back in the same morning, so nothing is too far away. The tube service offers the equivalent of a London tube one-day travelcard for zone 1, which covers all major sites(and it's cheaper than London). We enjoyed the area near the Picasso museum most of all. The area has cobbled streets and is very well kept. The food we ate in a cafe called 'Origen' served great local cuisine, but many other places looked equally nice. This area was also easy to get to from the hotel. Overall, the hotel was good, and I would definitely recommend it to others. It was most suitable for young people or travellers who wish to be in the busier part of town. It was worth the rates we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jonathan020
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very convenient location on a side street off La Rambla and only a 2-3 minute walk from Placa de Catalunya (where the Airport shuttle bus arrives and departs). Our room was well looked after and clean with a nice bathroom and large safe. Complimentary smints on your bedside, chocolates on your pillow and toiletries were all great touches and not what you would expect for a hotel of only 3 stars. At checkout the front desk held our luggage without a problem in a secure room until we were ready to come back and collect ready for our return flight. Did not get a chance to sample the dining but I should imagine it would be up to the same excellent standards experienced throughout the hotel. When I return to Barcelona I shall certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danny Boy 123
Reviews.Content: This hotel enjoys an excellent location - 150 meters from Las Ramblas and 200 meters from Place Catalunya. It is in a pedestrianised side turning which means that your taxi won't be able to drop you outside the hotel, but if you print ouit a large scale map of the Barri Gothic (Gothic Quarter) from the internet you will easily be able to find the hotel. Our taxi dropped us on Las Ramblas. The hotel itself is above a branch of the Decathlon sports shop. Interestingly, taxis do come all the way to the hotel to collect you. The rooms were clean and very quiet, and like most city centre hotels quite small. Breakfast is not included but the all you can eat buffet from the hotel restaurant costs 13 euros. Hotel staff were extremely friendly and willing to put themselves out to make the stay enjoyable. The restaurant in the evenings was closed, but there are numerous good eating places close by and within a 10 minute walk. When I go back to Barcelona I will definitely stay at the NH Duc de la Victoria

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bristol_UKGuy
Reviews.Content: First time to Barcelona stayed at this hotel Feb 9th - 12th, after reading the reviews and can't say anymore then great location, rooms, and easy get around as the 3 metro stations right around the corner, or the tourist bus. Easy to get to from the airport get on a 'aerobus' for 3.75 (euros) outside the terminal, makes three stops last one being the placa catylunya. Then about 100meter to the hotel instead of paying for a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Happy New Year”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Ryders
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH Duc de la Victoria in Barcelona over the New Year period and thoroughly enjoyed our trip. The hotel is in a great location, close to Las Ramblas and Placa de Catalunya, but not too near to be bothered by noise. Our room was large, clean & warm and the marble bathroom was wonderful. The extensive breakfast included in our rate was one of the highlights. We recommend the day tickets for the Tourist bus so you can tour the city at your own pace. A visit to La Sagrada Familia (the Gaudi Cathedral) is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend at NH Duc de la Victoria. Great hotel, spotlessly clean, modern rooms, ideal location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2005 based on TripAdvisor reviews and were not disappointed! My emails were always answered within 24 hours. The location could not be better, rooms are small but clean. The shower pressure was wonderful which I know sounds like a small thing but means a lot to us. Three things that were inconvenient but would not prevent us from staying there again: no irons, the only English speaking station was CNN and the staff does not take messages for guests (we had friends that tried to reach us while we were out of our room and were told they would just have to call back). Overall, I don't think you could find better hotel for the price and location. We can't wait to go back! Oh, we loved the soaps and shampoos as others have stated :)

Reviews.Title: “Everything was fine!”
Reviews.Author: lore31
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine!

Reviews.Title: “well well well!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having booked my first holiday in 6 years to Salou ....and finding it closed over new year period,my partner and I managed to escape on a train to the magical city of Barcelona and with the very efficient help of the tourist office a short walk away from the hotel this wonderfully located oasis was like heaven personified!...Lovely,clean,quality accomodation, at an affordable price.
