Very comfortable rooms,just loved the quality of the furnishings and decor,in particular the attention to detail such as a personal greeting on the T.V.the audio sound system being included in the bathroom,the card entry system leaving all preset lighting to the same settings as when you left, upon your return and the attention to detail was excellent. Was there a downside?.....The very solid,luxury room doors were very noisy when being closed by early rising guests. Rarely can you find such wonderful surroundings and be so centrally located in the superb Hotel as this is. We shall return to the City soon.....and hopefully to NH Victoria if not fully booked!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Really nice, clean hotel in a perfect location. Stayed there the week of New Year's with my girlfriend and we both loved it. Staff was friendly enough, and perfectly acceptable by Spanish standards. Stay here, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “ideal spot”
Reviews.Author: lucyamartin
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the NH Duc le la Victoria for 3 nights around Xmas. The hotel was every bit as good as it has been reported on tripadvisor. It was extremely good value, in a terrific location and was clean and attractive. The breakfast buffet was not included but was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: TJL75
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a 3-night stay here with friends between Christmas and New Year. The hotel has an excellent central location in a quiet pedestrian street just off Las Ramblas, where we were dropped by our taxi, which resulted in a short walk to the hotel. It is possible to drive to the hotel entrance but not many drivers are willing to do so. On arrival, the staff were not particularly welcoming but were efficient and helpful whenever we had a query. We had requested a room on the 4th or 5th floors but despite this were allocated rooms on the 2nd floor. On inspection, all of our rooms were suitable being adequately sized and overlooked the street. They were clean, had laminate flooring and twin beds pushed together and included a safe, mini-bar, sliding door wardrobes and a good shower over the bath. The rooms were always well cleaned each day. The main downside of the hotel is the lack of a lounge area (there were some sofas in reception) and bar. On our first morning we had breakfast in the hotel, which was disappointing and not worth the 12.5 Euros price. The dining area was bright, clean and spacious and there was a reasonable selection of cereals, bread, pastries, fruit juice; cheese, yoghurts but the scrambled egg and bacon were cold. On the following mornings we walked up to Placa Catalunya (5 minutes walk) and had breakfast in the Beer and Coffee Café (next to Cort del Ingles), which is much more welcoming and costs far less. Our recommendations for restaurants include La Fonda in Carrer dels Escudellers, which does not open until 2030 and frequently has long queues, as it is so popular. Fortunately it seats 240 on 3 floors and so the wait is usually short and worth it as the food is good and modestly priced. Another favourite was Trobador at the top of Carrer de Ferran, which is much smaller than La Fonda, a little more expensive but has great food and an excellent atmosphere. We ate here on 2 evenings as on our last night we were booked into the Attic on Las Ramblas but on arrival they had no knowledge of our reservation, despite it being made personally the day before and written down by reception. Despite the Trobador being full, they still managed to fit us in with a short wait, which gave us time to have an aperitif. The staff are very helpful and the service was always excellent. Another recommendation is a small intimate restaurant named Sedna along from Monument a Colom on Passeig de Colom, which we came across by accident on our way back to Las Ramblas from the Port area on a lunchtime. We had the 9 Euro menu of the day, which was very good with excellent paella. Overall, we had a great time in Barcelona, would certainly visit again and can recommend the Nh Duc de la Victoria hotel for its location, cleanliness and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: elerem2002
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel, and used it as our base to explore Barcelona. The rooms were small but spotless, and very nice, and the staff were very helpful. This is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: avourlid
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Victoria. Room was on top floor, recently renovated, very clean, with minibar and tv and reasonable view of the city. The only downside was that the room was rather small but didn't affect us as we only used it for sleep. The location of this hotel is amazing-very convenient and near all the sites, yet very quiet at least when I visited (and of course December is not the busiest time to visit Barcelona). Front desk spoke English and were helpful everytime we asked something. Overall I would recommend it and definitively stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very comfortable and right in the middle of old Barcelona. Our room was small but nice. The breakfast buffet was overpriced (which seemed to be the case throughout Spain) but excellent. When we checked out they asked if we wanted to pay in US dollars or Euros. The staff was business-like -- not particularly friendly but not surly. Our experience began on a sour note with the taxi driver dropping us on the Rambla and saying he couldn't drive on the street to the hotel. He pointed in the direction of the hotel and we wandered around for at least 15 minutes (with our bags) before stumbling upon the hotel. Later that day we helped a couple who had had the same thing happen. Not the hotel's fault ... but I'm not sure how anyone could preclude this happening to them. The hotel is located on a short narrow street without a lot of foot traffic -- we were a little uncomfortable with being out late at night. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for a woman traveling alone just because of the isolated alley that it's located on. Otherwise, the location was excellent -- close to all of the action but quiet because it wasn't right on the main drags. When we left, the hotel called a taxi that came right up to the door and then had to inch out through the hordes of holiday shoppers! Barcelona is a city I want to return to and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location and great price.”
Reviews.Author: sarahog
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the nh Duc de la Victoria for 4 days (3nights). We found the hotel to be very friendly. They had allocated us a room with 2 single beds and changed it to a double room with no problems. The room was spacious and the bathroom was very clean and smart. The toiletries provided were lovely. There is a safe in the room which is great and also a very useful information book about barcelona. The reception staff were always friendly and helped us find a few places to go. We booked about 1 1/2 months in advance through the hotels website for 70 euros per night plus tax, not including breakfast which is a bargain. You can find lovely places for breakfast nearby so theres not really any need to have breakfast in the hotel for 12 euros. Location is about 2 blocks from La Rambla and you probably won't find another hotel like this, with this location for such a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Nat1
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, reasonably priced. Rooms are modern, clean and spacious. Location is superb - in the heart of Barcelona, but in a quiet street that allows you to get away from the hustle and bustle. Would definately stay here again for leisure, probably not great for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: aine24
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a perfect location, just off las ramblas. The taxi from the airport took us right to the door of the hotel. Staff were efficient if a little unfriendly. Room wasnt the biggest but perfectly adequate although it was a litte dark. But then again we were hardly ever in the room. Looking forward to staying here again on my next trip. Its a great city

Reviews.Title: “Watch your Bag!”
Reviews.Author: Pinchy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Victoria hotel, location in the Gothic quarter was excellent, very quiet and pedestrianised. Room very clean and quiet, beds were really comfortable. Didn't try the breakast as we thought the previous reviews weren't too good. Air con wasn't a problem, we just opened the windows. If you turned right out of the hotel, right again, through the arch at the Citidines hotel, you were right on the Ramblas. We walked down to the port, and I'm very careful with my bag, but someone behind me still managed to open 2 zips on my bag! Luckily I heard the noise and turned around, but they thieves ran off, luckily for me I heard them in time. Try the La Fonda restaurant not far from the main square, excellent deal for food, even if you have to queue!

Reviews.Title: “near to ideal”
Reviews.Author: kattinger
Reviews.Content: We booked mostly based on the reviews here and were not disappointed. There are many strong points and a few weaker ones, which fortunately did not concern us. Yes the taxi driver let us out at the Ramblas because the hotel is in a pedestrian zone and we had to walk some 200m and there are no big signs indicating the hotel. As we had only hand-luggage trolleys for a 4 days stay and a good map this was not a problem. The room was not very big but nicely and efficiently furnished, there is a safety box in the room, there is enough space in the bathroom beside the sink to put two people´s stuff, courtesy tooth brush, razors etc. If one of us had impaired movebility we might have had problems with stepping into the tub to take a shower though. The room was quiet, no noise from the outside nor from within the hotel. Breakfast is relatively sumptous (lots of choice, cava (= spanish champaign) included), the supposedly "hot" items are lukewarm at the most though and the coffee was rather unimpressive. Staff was friendly and helpful - when the safety box did not work at first somebody was at our room to fix it within 5 minutes - but also a little bit helpless (e.g. they have never heard of restaurant "cinc sentits" and I had to direct them to the internet in order to get directions about the location). The location of the hotel simply is exellent, many sights and nice locations within walking distance, taxis and "bus touristic"-stop available at Placa Catalunya, within 5 minutes walking distance. As a whole, the hotel was near to ideal for a few days stay as a tourist, we paid 430 Euros for a double for three nights, breakfast included and considered it good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Duc de La Victoria and would book it again without hesitation. The location was perfect....just a short walk from the airport bus (which saved on taxis), La Ramblas (which I didn't like but still an experience to walk down it), El Cortes Ingles, the Gracia district, cathederal etc. etc. We had a standard room (price wise) but found it perfect size wise and with the added advantage of having a corner room with 2 windows and balconies. The bathroom was very clean and well stocked with toiletries and we found the staff helpful. Our deal didn't include breakfast but instead we eat out each morning in one of the local cafes (or even tapas bars) and found we could dine for about 6 - 8 euros for the 2 of us. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of credit card rip-off!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was far too expensive for what was on offer; it's difficult to believe all the hype on this website after staying here for three nights. The room was very small, and it wasn't adequately sound-proofed. It was hot and stuffy with the air-conditioner on - even in December! There was a problem with the sound on the TV, but this was not fixed, despite being reported to the reception. If having to pay an extra €12.5 for breakfast on top of the €140 a night room price was bad enough, when you pay your bill with a credit card, they automatically bill it to you in your own currency with a 2.5% mark-up! The receipt even has the nerve to state that "you have been given the choice of currencies, the conversion rate and final amount", when in fact the receptionists do no such thing! I moved over to the Barceló Hotel Sants for €100 a night and much preferred the stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler227
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great choice based on location and cost. It's right in the Gothic Quarter and near Las Ramblas. The airport shuttle was really convenient and dropped you off a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Our room was extremely clean and the area appeared very safe, even late at night. It's definitely a great choice if you want to stay in the heart of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Room okay for right price, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: EC_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I reserved for 5 nights via the NH site after reading the many positive reviews here. When booking the room the terms and conditions stated that the rate included breakfast. Upon checking in I asked for confirmation of the rate and the inclusion of breakfast. I was very abruptly told that breakfast was not included. It was not a big deal as I thought that I would ask again when the day staff was manning the front desk. I asked the following day if they would please check their records and was very rudely told that breakfast was not included. I wish to stress that I was not asking them to give me anything, only to verify the reservation terms. I was scolded as if I were trying to steal from them. The room was okay, the bathroom clean, the carpet needed replacing, and the heat in the room was a bit stifling even in November. I would stay here again only if the rate offered were heavily discounted. In all of our many, many trips to Europe I've never been treated as rudely as at the front desk of the NH Hotel Duc de la Victoria. If you don't need to deal with the front desk, the rest of the staff were quite pleasant. Barcelona is a lovely and fascinating city, stay elsewhere when you visit it.

Reviews.Title: “Rather overrated”
Reviews.Author: titchy1
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a seven-night stay based on the gushing reviews here. Cheap it most certainly wasn't - £668.25 from Last minute booked over six weeks in advance is hardly a steal. True, the hotel is central, and you don't have to walk more than five minutes from Ramblas, but there are loads of hotels similarly situated. There was no problem with our booking and we were given a quiet, small room facing an inner courtyard. No revelry from the streets then, but the door is poorly insulated - you can hear everyone staggering back and fumbling for their key card after their festivities end at 3 a.m. The breakfast buffet IS sumptuous, but very expensive at €25 on top of the room. The room is well cleaned, and the bathroom immaculate. The staff are courteous and friendly, although they barely speak English. WLAN Internet access is another "extra" at €6 an hour or €14 a day. I think the hotel was fine, but not the amazing bargain everyone seems to go on about.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: alimac23
Reviews.Content: Had a great 4 day stay here. The hotel has an excelllent location, 2 mins walk from the cathedral, Plaza Catalunya (grat for bus tours and transport to and from airport) and Las Ramblas. It is on a quiet side street but is so close to the busier streets around that this is not a problem. The room was clean and the complimentary toiletries a great touch. My only complaint was that the room was too hot and the air conditioning didn't work very well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobMcFad
Reviews.Content: I booked three twin rooms in this hotel for an early work Christmas trip and couldn't have been happier. The rooms were clean and well decorated and come with toothbrush and tooth paste as well as a shaving kit. Breakfast was excellent with a wonderful choice to suit all tastes, there was even champagne if you like to start your day with a bucks fizz. When it comes to location you couldn't hope for a better spot. Less than a two minute stroll off La Rambla and you're there and yet when the time comes to retire for the night all is peacefull outside so don't worry about the noise. To sum up I could't recommend this hotel highly enough, its great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent NH Duc de la Victoria”
Reviews.Author: life43
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days in October with my daughter in this nice hotel and if we return to Barcelona surely choose it again. We loved the Barrio Gotic, where the hotel is. It has everything: nice boutiques, Internet, groceries, restaurants, etc. El Corte Inglés (first apartment store in Spain)is a few blocks from the hotel, in front of Plaza Catalunya, where there is a turistic bus stop too. One block from there is a metro. Two blocks away from the hotel are Las Ramblas, a quite funny avenue. The room was nice and clean, the beds very good and a great detail: a tray with a water boiler, two cups, tea and coffee. It overlooked the street but was very silent. The room isn´t huge but it was standard. I guess superior are bigger. Nevertheless, it was confortable. The bathroom was spotless and very luminous, with a good variety of amenities. The breakfast was not included in the price but we prefered to pay for it because it was great. I do recommend NH Duc de la Victoria!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: klotezooi
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days/3 nights; The location of the hotel is excellent as read before. In the centre but without the noise of the centre and the terrible Ramblas with its homeless, gypsies and pickpockets. Room is oke and looks good. Not that big but big enough. No carpet so it looks cleaner than it is.. The maid had 3 offdays or she just don't clean to well, because for 3 days there was a cap of a bottle in a corner on the floor that wasn't cleaned up... Breakfast was good. Plenty of choice and from 7 till 11 am. Overall a good hotel on an excellent location. Thumbs up !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Dedris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a week holiday in Spain. We sent three nights at the NH Duc de la Victoria, before flying to Lugo in Northern Spain. The hotel is conveniently located, in the heart of the Bari Gotic. Even though the hotel in surrounded by busy pedestrian ways, the hotel location and the rooms afford a quiet and comfortable stay. NH Duc de la Victoria, is part of a large chain of Spanish hotels. The room was well appointed, clean and comfortable. The view from the bedroom into the courtyard was not worth drawing the curtains. The charge of 12 euro for breakfast encourages us to walk the five minutes to the Plaza Catalunya, where there are several cafes; all give relaxed and pleasant service. Sit and eat a croissants whilst watching the locals hurry about their daily business. Even though we arrived late in the evening, the staff were efficient and business like. The staff spoke excellent English, so I did not have to speak my very poor Spanish. Barcelona is a vibrant and beautiful city. The tourist busses are worth the cost. A two day pass is marginally more expensive than a one day, and is necessary if you want to see all of the city in a few days.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: pamtutor
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend to Barcelona and stayed at the Duc De La Victoria. We used the Aerobus from the Airport to the Placa Catalunya and a short walk took us to the hotel. I had booked 2 rooms one for myself and hubby and one for our friends (hubby and wife). We were upgraded to a superior room which turned out to be slightly bigger than our friends, with 2 balconies and tea and coffee making facilities. We were surprised at how quiet the rooms were and yet so near to La Ramblas. When booking the hotel I had emailed ahead that we were celebrating our 25 wedding anniversary. The hotel kindly supplied both rooms with a lovely plate of fresh fruit and a bottle of wine. As mentioned in other reviews, lovely toiletries provided in the room, together with bathrobes and slippers. There was a mini bar but we did not use it. We had not booked breakfast at the hotel so cannot comment on this. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for its comfort, location and good size rooms.

Reviews.Title: “OK, handy location”
Reviews.Author: Bollinge
Reviews.Content: No porterage service, so if you are not travelling light, you might have a problem. It is situated in a back street in a pedestrian area just off the Ramblas, so don't expect any nice views from the windows. Rooms are fine with nice bathroms and plenty of amenities. Staff are friendly. Breakfast buffet is good, but cheap orange "nectar" is served rather than orange juice. There is red wine on the buffet, if you fancy that at eight in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Nice enough rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel choice in Barcelona for my wife and I. The room was small, but clean and quiet. Soap, shampoo, razor, toothbrush, shower gel, comb and other amenities were provided. The breakfast was excellent with very many hot and cold options. What really stood out, though, was the location in the old town and the ease of getting to the hotel from the airport bus stop at Placa Catalunya. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WhiteKnight64
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights, Mon-Fri on B&B basis. We were a party of four and were allocated adjacent very clean, spacious and quiet rooms on 5th floor. Air con worked well and great supply of toiletries in bathroom, including combs, daily razor & shaving cream. Very good buffet breakfast, fantastic choice- cold meats, cheese, fresh fruit, juices, melon, hot English (but usually only warm, scrambled egg, sausages, tomato, mushrooms). Also yogurt, soya milk cartons, bread rolls,selection of very fresh pastries, and more. Even a small choice of items that could be freshly cooked for you such as poached eggs.There was a problem on the last morning when tea/coffee was only available in large flasks on a self service basis instead of the usual system of ordering your choice from a waiter, and some food had run out. Despite this the hotel still gets an "excellant" rating from us due to its good position, helpful staff, cleanliness and reasonable price- 81 euros per night including flights from London Luton. We used the bus to get from/to the airport. Cost was 3.60 euros each and the stop in Catalunya Square was only a short walk down La Rambla then a block or so to the left. Really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic city hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: coolinarrig
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the reviews already given by previous writers to this site. And I was not disappointed! It was perfect... Booked the hotel and when we arrived (my husband, myself and my dughter) were put into a room with only one bed (extremely large I might add but still only one). I went down stairs to explain and was immediately given an alternative room, much nicer than the original. The food is lovely there, we had our breakfast each of the 3 mornings, but didn't eat there for dinner, too much on offer elsewhere! The location is ideal, you could not ask for better in the centre of Barcelona. The city is magnificent and on the first day we did the tour, it was worth every penny. The taxi only cost €19 from the airport for the 3 of us, we went back with another coule staying at the hotel and for the five of us, cost only €30. I know the train system can do equally a good job but we came across two different couples who had their wallets stolen, so we decided to go the safer option. Everyone seems to mention the Bagel shop, would have loved to try it but it was always full, I suppose that's a good sign!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is THE PERFECT place to stay for a visit to Barcelona. Just a block or so off the Ramblas. It's on one of the small streets in the old Gothic part of town. The hotel area is quiet, but very easy direct access to all of the energy of Barcelona. We took the airport train to Placa de Catalunya. This worked out well, but on hindsight, the Airport Bus may have been easier. The Placa de Catalunya metro station is very large and a little confusing to determine which exit to take up to street level. We took one wrong turn until we determined we were heading in the wrong direction, and then simply had to turn around and head back in the right direction. The hotel is about a 5 to 10 minute walk from this area. We had decided to not take the bus in order to avoid any rush hour traffic. If you're not arriving at rush hour time, the bus would be easier. The rooms were clean and well furnished. The staff answered our questions and helped us to get a taxi to the port. Taxis CAN come directly to the hotel door. The staff would not give us an estimate on the taxi ride to the cruise ship terminal, and we forgot to ask the driver up front for a price. (many of the taxis actually have meters now, but this one did not)... so we ended up getting screwed with a 25 euro cab fare for a 2 kilometer ride. We loved Barcelona and the Duc de la Victoria was a perfect location within the Barri Gothic and Ramblas area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: UKNato
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during Barcelona's La Mercè festival in late September, an annual festival attracting thousands (more) visitors to this fantastic city. The location of this hotel is superb, close (but also far enough) from La Rambla, and well situated an easy stroll south from Placa de Catalunya. The real positive of this hotel is that the location avoids much of the busy pedestrian traffic and associated noise (no vehicle traffic either) common to many parts of Barcelona. This is important if you want/need some shut eye! The hotel rooms are well appointed with modern furnishings, adequate size and in our view good value at approx. £85.00 per night (no b/fast). We had no reason to contact the hotel staff other than check-in and out which is usually a good sign. Having said that our check-out staff member couldn't manage a smile buy hey, working on a festival weekend would make me a bit surly! This 3* Hotel does the simple things well, and puts many higher rated (4 & 5*) hotels to shame. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Other reviewers can't be wrong”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are still hesitating on which hotel to choose in Barcelona. Stop and book this hotel. We arrived last wednesday in the afternoon. We took the Airbus from the airport (3,6 euro/person one way) which took 3/4h to Placa de Catalunya. From there its just a 10 minute stroll. As people arrive throughout the day check-in is swiftly. We got room 116 right next to the restaurant/breakfast-room. As we booked a 'quite room' I returned to the desk. There was no discussion at all, they rebooked me immediatly to room 501. This room was ok: spacious and clean. We do regret struggling with the airconditioning. 2 of our 3 nights it did not do its thing at night (the room kept warming instead of cooling of). After two remarks (each morning) to the desk it got fixed. It's true that they are just doing their job, but for me that's ok. The location can't hardly be beaten. Right in the centre off where you want to be: close to sights & shopping. And all this in a quite sidestreet! A real plus. We loved on day one: The Ramblas and the fish-restaurants of Barcelonetta. On day two: the guided tour to Barri Gotic and the shopping line (notably shopping centre L'Illa Diagonal). On day three: the Bus Turistic (we stopped at Segrada Familia, Parc Guell, FC Barcelona)and a part of La Routa Modernista on foot (with a visit to La Padrera, with fine audio tour). On day four: la Boqueria and the Bus Turistic (we stopped at Fundacio Joan Miro, don't take the dull audio tour). We loved eating at Taxidermista, Placa Reial. You'll see the long line at Les Quinze Nits (which we visited a day after and does a better prize than quality, we had bad wine). We would have liked the tapas of Cal Pep if not it was packed with people every time we passed. This gives us an opportunity to return. In short Barcelona is top and this hotel is gonna make it supertop! Have a nice trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LGDP
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Lovely modern room, which was spacious. Very central location, but also quiet. Very comfortable bed and dark curtains.

Reviews.Title: “Stop searching and book it!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovehols
Reviews.Content: If you want somewhere central, quiet, clean, brill value and safe then look no further. We paid about 70ish Euros I think for a double room because they had a deal on in August. We asked for a high floor and got it. It had a lovely little varanda which we stood out on and sipped our Cava (dead cheap from a little shop right by hotel). Bathroom was big and had lovely toilettries. Room clean, room service efficient and never heard any noise. Reception staff dead helpful when asked, pointing out places on maps and ordering taxis etc. No problems at all. Would stay again at drop of a hat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location, nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: JoKnits
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference. I read the reviews in advance and the hotel was as the positive reviews indicated. My room was very quiet, and the hotel in general is on a quiet side-street. The only drawback of the location is as a single female traveler one of the blocks was perhaps a little too quiet to walk down alone late at night. But the other pathway to the hotel was well-lit and traveled enough to feel safe. The location is unbelievably good. It's just off the main Placa Catalunya (sp?), so I took the airport bus as was suggested by previous reviewers. It would be a bit hard for a taxi to find it. The hotel is a stone's throw from all the sights of the Gothic Quarter and quick walk into the neighborhood with the Gaudi sights. However, it's not a noisy location, as my colleagues who stayed on Las Ramblas complained about their locations! The service was fine, and the room was in good condition (although small for U.S. standards - typical for Europe). The price was fabulous for such a good-quality room and good location. Colleagues spent much more for poorer quality rooms and more distant locations. I would stay there again, most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Tammy72
Reviews.Content: As Europeans ourselves I guess we're a little more used to the perceived rudeness of our mainland continental friends (I'll excuse us Brits on this occasion!). However, I cannot fault the staff at this hotel - they were helpful, friendly without being intrusive and very professional. The hotel itself was ideal - its location being the highlight. This made it very good value and the perfect place from which to explore this city. Walking is the way to see Barcelona so my real advice is, leave your suitcases behind, put on your comfortable shoes, and wander about as much as you can. One tip - to avoid looking too much like a tourist pop into one of the Caixa (banks) you'll find on almost every corner in order to look at your map then walk around with the confidence of a local!

Reviews.Title: “Great little place, just don't have thin skin”
Reviews.Author: Sonerila
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my son for two nights before we left for a 12 night Med. cruise. We took the airport shuttle to a drop off point near the hotel, but carrying 7 suitcases, we looked desperately for a cab to take us the rest of the way, even if it were for just a few blocks. This was my first experience in Europe at which time I quickly realized our culture in the U.S. is completely different. We heard 3 responses to our plea for a cab, one telling us the hotel was in the opposite direction it actually was in, another telling us it was "that way" giving ambiguous directions and two more cabbies who said vehicles were not allowed on the street and that we needed to walk. After about an hour of total frustration, exhausted from the 11 hr flight, jet lag, and toting our heavy luggage around in heat and humidity we weren't used to, I sat on our luggage in the plaza and almost started to cry while my son took directions from people and walked around in circles only to return to me shaking his head. Each person we talked to pointed in a different direction to our hotel. Finally, I found one lovely woman who drew me a map with street names and arrows. We followed the map and found we were actually only 5 min. away the entire time, but the Gothic Quarter is a maze of narrow cobblestone alleyways that don't seem to go in any logical pattern. When we finally collapsed into the hotel lobby, I told the desk clerk how difficult it had been for us to find it and how happy we were to finally arrive. She asked for my booking info and proceeded to, very efficiently, book me into our room. No comments whatsoever about my dilemma. Very professional, that was all and no help getting the luggage to our room. This was the way we were treated by all staff there. The hotel was lovely, the breakfast buffet was one of the best I've ever had, but the staff were cold and distant. I realize this is their culture and that Spaniards aren’t the "Hey, how ya doin'?" type; no, "Have a nice day," here. In fact, that was the way it was all over Europe. Very to the point, very professional, but if you were to drop dead, they'd sweep you aside to make space for the next person. I found this attitude, along with being ripped off by high-priced merchants, (10.00 Euro for a glass of ice tea, 17.50 for a cappuccino which included a "sitting fee", 154.00 for a water taxi to the airport in Venice) and cabbies enough to end my fascination with Europe. As far as the hotel, though, if I were ever to go back to Barcelona, which I really did find fascinating and the women beautiful, I would definitely stay at this hotel. The room safe wasn't working when we arrived and they repaired it within a few hours. We needed to store our luggage after checkout and before the ship arrived and there was absolutely no question that they would keep it in their safe. They treated us very well, the hotel room was beautiful and fabulously clean. The buffet was amazing. I will pass on their name and recommend them to anyone. Just beware, you can get very lost if you don't know your way around. Also note: taxi's are allowed onto the streets to deliver you to your hotel, I just think there isn't enough money in it for them because it's a short distance. Also note that if you're from the states, the hotel staff are going to seem unfriendly to the point of rudeness, but I think that is just their way. That attitude continued all throughout Europe. I would have given this hotel 5 stars, but it was relatively expensive and the buffet was not included in the price; that was an additional 12.50 euros pp, I think.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a fantastic location in the Gothic Quarter on a quiet street. I've visited Barcelona and number of times and stayed in different hotels and this was by far the best (and good value for money). Our room was beautifully decorated, immaculately clean and had a huge bathroom complete with every kind of complimentary toiletry. I'll be back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted with Hotel & will return in the future”
Reviews.Author: logonmar
Reviews.Content: Having chosen this hotel based on previous reviews its now my turn to comment. In a nutshell we were very pleased. Location is tremendous as it is less than a 5 minute walk to the main tourist action in Barcelona (Las Ramblas). Hotel was quiet, rooms clean, air conditioning etc. When we arrived (and throughout our stay) we found the staff to be very helpful and encountered none of the negative aspects (rude staff etc) referred to by other reviewers. We were asked if we wanted a twin or a room with a double bed. The room we got was quite small and there was no view from the window but hadn't expected one. Intention was to use our room as a base of operations and this it fulfilled extremely well. Would definitely stay there again next time we visit Barcelona and am happy to recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location Clean Hotel and pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights. Very clean hotel, pleasant staff and a wonderful location just off the Ramblas. Would recommend this hotel and would use again when visiting Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: waggy
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel,quiet location just off la Ramblas.Efficient and friendly staff.Spotlessly clean. Watch out for the pickpockets, and gypsies carrying babies !They will put a newspaper on the table and pick up anything under it !!! Dont get caught on the pea under the cup trick ! Its a big scam by an organised gang.The only winners are part of the gang themselves !!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED our stay at NH Duc Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: EmilyNYC
Reviews.Content: LOVED our stay here at the NH Duc Barcelona. We stayed in comparable hotels (not NH) in Madrid, Bordeaux, and Toulouse, and this was our absolute favorite. Beautiful hardwood floors, spacious rooms, courteous staff (all of whom spoke excellent English). The bathrooms were huge and very nice--Grohe showers with tremendous water pressure. Everything was absolutely spotless. The window was average-sized; we faced inward, so the view wasn't anything special, but things were generally very quiet. Location was amazing--just off the Rambla and a few minutes to a subway stop. There were also great shops all around. The only negatives: Internet access wasn't free (we brought our laptop, but for wireless access, you had to pay 6 euros an hour or 12 euros for a day), and then there was the twin beds theme that seems to prevail in Spain: instead of a full or queen or king sized bed, we got two twins pushed together. Since they were on rollers or something, they moved around quite a bit, so we ended up sleeping just on one of the twin beds. If they could fix this situation, this hotel would be near-perfect. We got a pot of coffee and a pot of milk from the restaurant that we brought up to our room for 1,80 euro each morning--a little thing, but something we very much appreciated because we drank a lot of coffee on our trip and felt we always paid too much. . . . We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Barcelona, especially if we can get the same rate of 70,09 euro per night. This room would easily go for well over $200 (probably $250) in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Exploring Barcelona !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in July. On arrival at the airport, caught the A1 Aerobus from outside the terminal for a 40 mins journey to Placa De Catalunya. Price 3.60 euros each, and stops outside the department store El Cortes Ingles. Can be a bit of a scramble to board the bus with cases, bags, etc, but they come along so frequently its not a problem if the first couple are full. The hotel is just a 5-7 minute walk walk from the bus stop and is ideally situated for exploring Barcelona. It is set just off Les Rambles so as to be very quiet at night, yet close to everything that Barcelona has to offer. Good buffet breakfast with choice of tea/coffee, fruit juices, cereals, pastries, meat, cheese, etc. Didn't have much need to deal with reception staff but found them to be polite and efficient on arrival and upon checking out. Room was clean & tidy as was the bathroom. Towels changed daily & lots of bathroom toiletries. Tea & coffee making facility would have been nice and only one english speaking channel on the tv. Bought a two day pass for the bus turistic (17 euros each for 1 day, or 21 euros each for two days - must be conscecutive days). Children aged 4-12 charged 10 Euros & 13 Euros respectively, under 4 are free. Once bought, you can get on & off the bus as many times as you like within the day, or two days. Its a great way to see everything that Barcelona has to offer. Two routes operate North (red) and South (blue) with a couple of transfer points from one route to the other along the way. The tour of barcelona Football club is a must for any football fan (red route) and you can get some great views of the city of Barcelona from the MNAC - Museu Nacional d'Art de Catalunya (blue route). You can buy tickets at the respective bus stops and although there may be lots of people queuing, its very well organised and the buses are very frequent. Its great to walk up & down Les Rambles - lots of human statues, artists, bird sellers, flower stalls, restaurants. Better still, visit the Attic restaurant for dinner (120 Les Rambles). Arrive early 6.45pm - 7.15pm and have a window seat overlooking Les Rambles and watch the world go by. If you prefer eating later would advise booking. Food is very good & extremely well presented, although don't expect it to be piled up on your plate. Cost approx 16 Euros per person for a main meal & dessert. If you like Italian, try Gino's which is situated at the port end of the Les Rambles, behind the shopping centre. If you want beefburgers there's always the Hard Rock Cafe on the Main Placa de Catalunya. Would definitely stay again !!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Epicurious_Travelers
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights last week and really enjoyed it. The location is perfect - walking distance to all the neighborhoods you want to visit and it is very clean with large rooms and bathrooms, especially for Europe. I am a pretty jaded traveller and found the hotel refreshing, reasonably priced and very clean. I will definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Phantomjww
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights prior to a cruise and returned for 3 nights after. They hotel is about a 5-10 minute walk to Plaza Cataluna, 4 minutes to La Ramblas, 5 minutes from the Cathedrel. So, its a great location. Our first 2 nights we had a nice sized room, large bed, sitting area. On our return, the room was 1/2 the size, 2 twins pushed together and no view at all. Funny, the price was the same per night? Never figured that one out. When we asked they said a room similiar to our first visit was not available. Like previous writers, we noticed an attitude at the front desk. I don't want to say they were rude, and we are not picky Americans, (we travel a lot). It was just that they were not too interested in advice, or even trying very hard with the language barriers. In fact, I speak a little spanish, they spoke a little english, but were not very interested in trying to communicate. Its a small boutique hotel with a very small lobby with a sitting area area, front desk and 3 small elevators. It might be me, but usually on our travels, when you enter a small space and return at the end of the day you are usually welcomed with a hello, or hola or something. Here they often did not even look up or come out of the back room. Would I stay there again. YES! Do I think its a great location, Absolutely! Do I think it could be a better hotel with a little customer service, TOTALLY! When you think about it and read the other reviews, customer service should not be the primary complaint of a hotel guests. If they have location, price, convienience and other essentials, management should insure that customer service is taken care of too.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, value for money but front office unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: edinburghers
Reviews.Content: nice rooms with good furnishing, good value for money. comfortable, modern and clean. then again I guess you pay for what you get, no business centre, told to go internet cafe...well one usually wouldn't need the computer on a holiday but then again. Front desk staff rude and most unhelpful, reluctant to help with directions, ferry tickets etc. then again if you want to pay the min for a nice, comfy room and don't expect 5 star service it is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel but rude front desk”
Reviews.Author: ava
Reviews.Content: Spent first two nights of a longer trip here. Rooms themselves are fine. First assigned to room with a view of airshaft but when we asked for a move they did move us to an exterior room. (Why not start off that way to begin with?) Buffet breakfasts great, especially if you are American. Overall would give this hotel much higher rating except for deplorable front desk staff. Always in the back room chatting. Gal at front ignored us when we first arrived. Just kept chatting on phone with her friend...at length. During our stay the range of attitudes of staff here swung from indifference to insolence. Also cab driver insisted he could not drive on the street here (This was not true.) and dropped us off a few blocks away. Location is excelllent however for walking and being near the Gothic Qtr. and Ramblas. For the price I would NOT stay again just because of front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: enzo_bisconti
Reviews.Content: I was in Barcelona with my wife from 25 to 29 june and we have had a big surprise living in the Hotel NH Duc de la Victoria. It's in the center of the city (Barri Gotic), nearest the Catalunya Place (where there are the Turistics Buses) and The Rambla Street. The Hotel is clean, modern and the rooms has all accessories that needs in a long permanence. Also the restaurants room offer a very interessant and complete breakfast choice. We want to thanks the Borsì Viaggi of Palermo for the opinions about our trip and for the choice for us of the NH Duc de la Victoria of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and not too expensive”
Reviews.Author: alannjune
Reviews.Content: My wife and I where staying in Santa Susanna, further along the coast. We wanted to have a couple of days in Barcelona to do the open deck bus tours and the Ramblas. With the help of the Aquamarina Hotel reception staff, we booked the NH Duc de la Victoria. It took us about an hour by train to get to Barcelona, Placa de Catalunya station. Unlike the person that was ripped off by one taxi driver, we went for a taxi because it was raining but the guy in the taxi gave us directions and said just to walk it, it would only take 5 minutes. He was right, so they're not all bad guys. The Hotel and staff were first class, the location could not be better. On our second day, although checked out, the staff kept our luggage until approx 20.00hrs when we were organising to go back to Santa Susanna. Again, because we knew our way about a bit (almost natives by now) we walked to the train station in approx 5 minutes. NH Duc de la Victoria...Brilliant. Barcelona...Fantastic. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jsuspect
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH for three nights. After we checked in, my girlfriend and I noticed that we had 2 single beds, so she checked with the clerk and we were upgraded (along with a wink from the clerk) to the top floor, with a balcony with views of the Cathedral and Montjuic. Definately great service! I agree with another reviewer about the taxis taking advantage of tourists. We were a bit tired getting into Barcelona and did not realize how close the hotel was to Placa Catalyuna, so we grabbed a taxi that took us for a 10 euro circular ride and then dropped us off and pointed out how to walk to the hotel! Unless you have a lot of luggage, it's very easy to get around Barcelona by walking and taking the metro. I also recommend "Set De Born" for great Catalan & Castillan tapas (try the combination meat and cheese plates!), and Origins...both of these are in the Born and about a 15 walk from the hotel. Wish we had more time...3 days is not enough...5 would be about right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the NH Duc de la Victoria with my husband and 12 year old niece and was very pleased. Great location and QUIET. Room was very nicely appointed, the bathroom ammenities were very nice (my niece really liked the shower gel) and the towels were great! The room was a bit small for 3 - but manageable. We paid 114EU and went to the previously mentioned bagel shop for breakfast which was just what we wanted (try their fresh fruit salad with yogurt and honey!). Staff was fine with good English - but we did not interact with them that much. Took the bus from the airport which worked out really well. Also used the subway - very easy. Recommend Egipte (Las Ramblas, 79) for a tapas lunch close by (but don't eat at the italian place next to it) and Xampanayet in La Ribera. Barcelona is great! Wish we had had more time.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights & had a thoroughly enjoyable stay. Room was well equiped with lots of nice toiletries & a comfortable bed. All staff were friendly & the breakfast was extensive & tasty. Location is fabulous being close to the Ramblas, Transport & the Gothic area. Luggage hold in reception & safe in room were great additions. Would recommend this hotel to anybody as it provides good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, excellent hotel: Duc de la Victoria”
Reviews.Author: LP55
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! The location cannot not be beat, the front desk staff is helpful and courteous, and the bathroom is luxurious. The extensive breakfast buffet is outstanding, and the waitstaff makes you feel very welcome. We enjoyed our full week-long stay here. Barcelona is magnificent, and we hope to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews on this site, I chose to book the nh Duc Victoria for a short trip to Barca with my wife. The hotel was everything we were looking for. It is absolutely central, meaning you can drop shopping bags/get a change of clothing/get some suncream/have a nap inbetween your activities in Barcelona. This was wonderful for us. Being so central also means you can get there rather easily: Take the airport bus stopping directly in front of the terminals (3,6€ per person) to the Placa de Catalunya. You can't miss the place: it's HUGE and likely most other passengers will also depart there. The bus drops you in front of a big department store (Corte Ingles). Turn right and head into the pedestrian street Portal de l'Angel. After 300m the street narrows down a bit and you turn right into the Av. Canuda. After 50m the Av. Duc de la Victoria (and your hotel) is dirctly to your left. Total walking time: 3-5 min. Our room was furbished in a very modern and elegant way and was sqeaky clean, the bed was comfortable (if a bit soft for my taste), and the room was very quite during the night. All technical facilities (TV, safe, minibar, shower etc.) were in perfect working order. We booked the breakfast and found it to be excellent. From the complete cooked english stuff (bacon, eggs, fried tomatos, mushrooms, sausages etc.) over cheeses, sausages, fresh fruits, various cereals to a wide variety of local cakes there was everything to get you started in the day (and to slow you down again if you didn't stop eating in time). We did skip lunch because the breakfast was so rich. Talking of eating: If you don't mind walking a few steps before dinner, I'd like to recommed the El Mussol (Aragon, corner with Passeig de Gracia). They have a menu in English/German/Italian, excellent food, and *very* nice and helpful staff. Enjoy your stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: anne2606
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 nights stay there with friends and have a few comments : - it is true that some taxi drivers just didn't know where the hotel street was (it is a very small street indeed) : tell them that it is very close from the Plaça de la Vila de Madrid. - the hotel breakfast is excellent, with delicious fresh pastries and fresh fruits,+ the usual cooked breakfast, yoghurts, cereals, etc... It is really worth the extra charge. - my twin bedroom was large and had a tea/coffee making facility, which wasn't the case for the other bedroom we were using . A problem could occur in the bathroom, which wasn't too small but where you literally had to climb over the toilet to access the bath : can be quite akward for anyone disabled or overweighted . - the reception staff was very helpfull and the booked all the restaurants for us (it is quite difficult to find a table in a good restaurant even one day ahead during week-ends) We really loved this hotel, which is worth much more than 3 stars . A few tips about Barcelona : - one must be aware that the Gaudi buildings are very expensive to visit : more than 15 euros for the Casa Batllo, 8 euros for the Sagrada Familia where there is actually nothing to see because the inside is totally covered with scaffoldings... - we soon realised that most taxi drivers were actually going very long ways round with us . These things sometimes happen when you are a tourist, but nowhere before had any of us experienced that on such an extent and it was very unpleasant .

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice modern hotel, just 2 minute walk from The Ramblas and Placa Catalunya. Very clean room with plenty of space. Staff were not overly friendly but that did not bother us. Minutes walk to Barcelona Cathedral and the metro. Metro is so easy to use. Buy the T10 ticket and save money!! Its good for 10 metro, bus or tram rides and definitely saves money. Barcelona is a great city!!! Would definitely return to this hotel and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Thankyou TripAdvisor Members”
Reviews.Author: crouchhill
Reviews.Content: Just returned for a 3 day break in Barcelona. Stayed in the Victoria on the strength of the reviews off this site, and I tell you what, it's bloody accurate !! I thought teh Victoria was everything it was described as and meant to be. No frills, but exactly what you pay for and you need no more. The rooms are lovely, wood interior, with a television (only English channel is CNN), a lovely little bathroom and a wonderful power shower. The cleaners naturally clean your room everyday and leave you some sweets at the end. The staff at the front desk were very very very helpful, spoke English (and if they didn't they bloddy tried hard) and when we had to check out, they were more than pleased to hold onto our bags till later in the evening. The location is marvellous, it's just off the 'Las Ramblas' which is the main street off Barcelona, so you couldn't ask for more regarding that. All in all, it's a really good hotel. 5 stars.
